MMDfPZ-O2vSOEPS3RBOuzQ.text: I have been to the North Italia restaurant in Tucson and was excited to give Las Vegas a try. Like the Tucson restaurant I enjoyed the open kitchen concept but if you're looking for a place to have a quiet conversation this is not it. That being said the food is excellent We started off with the grilled artichoke Which was smothered in parmesan and served with an aioli. Was disappointed in our muscles they were overcooked and dry. Moving on to the mains the bolognese is outstanding And would highly recommend it. The chicken strozzapreth Was creamy and the chicken tender and moist I ordered the squid ink Mafaldin and would certainly order it again. The wait staff was knowledgeable and had a good understanding of the menu and helped our over all experience be positive. Will definitely return.

NBWXDkXaqfk0EXyW0r09pQ.text: My husband and I loved visiting Vegas. While we were there, we ate at North Italia. The food is simply amazing!!! We were impressed with how similar everything was to the food we once ate in Italy. Highly recommend Chelsea as a waiter, she was attentive and kept our drinks full (which is always a struggle for us) all the while she was fun to interact with. If you're in the area and love Italian food, this place is a MUST Try the chef's board and the bolognese.(:

jmY8af3pTgnfUutMjC_ETg.text: Super good. Amazing service. Amazing good had the chefs board, daily pizza and burchestta. Amazing atmosphere. Love sitting outside. Great prices. Awesome happy hour.

v7MmMu-YNCXJ65MAV7Iitw.text: Dinner took over two hours to be served Thursday night. Closed restaurant tab at 9:02, went to bar to watch end of VGK game and bartender says, bar closed. Asked for manager who came and offered nothing but excuses. Not going back!

mwP_sxahwzd4Bulhleb2Gw.text: Made a reservation, only waited 5 minutes. Perfect. Ordered drinks and appetizers, perfect. Order food, plates took an hour to get to our table. Manager and waiter didn't tend to our table as they should have. Flavor of food was not up to par by any means. In the end, manager took $40 off. Not what I wanted, would rather had a more enjoyable diner.

vzBwBwm8yyiHnKWu9OdCmQ.text: This place is literally the best of all! I've tried so many different pastas and dishes and none of them disappointed me in any way! They all actually were great! Especially their pastas! Not too much sauce but also not too little it's perfect and all so full of flavor!! I love it! Will be back soon!

LTZy75P-tCx18zljIPnKWw.text: We went Sunday for dinner with friends and were so pleased, we went again last night for an early Bday dinner during happy hour. Food was really good again. We started with the daily pizza and cheese board which included a special $20 deal for bottle of wine and cheese board. Waiter informed us that the happy hour Rose was not available but they had red or white. We stated we preferred Rose. He explained they have one that's not the happy hour, but he'd ask a manager if he could give us $10 off or a discount since they couldn't accommodate us with their happy hour offer. He came back and said they might have one more bottle of the happy hour. But then returned with the other Rose stating they were out of their happy hour Rose. I figured we were getting the discount he mentioned. When the bill came he said his shift was over and introduced us to a new waiter.  When I reviewed the bill and noticed full price wine, I was a little surprised. I didn't want to ask and delay his shift ending and my husband gets embarrassed when I ask about prices. Honestly, I have nothing bad to say about this place. We really enjoy it. However, I'm just really surprised that a fine establishment wouldn't offer a discount or accommodate the guests a bit if they are out of the wine on the happy hour. That's all. Thanks for the good service.

RBPID2x_52oSdxNTgItsJw.text: Nothing worse than a bitchy waitress, Sheena, to put a damper on a birthday celebration. If you don't like people, get a different job. This used to be our birthday celebration spot, but no more. We had a reservation and still had to wait a long time for our table. I never got my Minestrone soup that I asked for. My chicken parm was cold, and 15 minutes after I ask for a to go container, she sets it down and immediately ignores me to talk to the old couple next to us. The manager talked to them too. Must be big shots. Asking for anything brought nothing, but attitude. We still tipped her well, but it will be the last dollar this place sees from any of us. They are too big for their britches. It's a big deal to ask for water. No thanks. No more.

X4evN6CqK6B6UeOLq3lRXg.text: Heard great reviews and came out to try with friends and their kids. Great kids menu pricing, however food was salty. Must have been the red sauce? The pizza & spaghetti & meatballs were ordered and both were over salted. Unfortunately it was a packed house and our server seemed to have too many tables so we couldn't get her attention in time.  My food however was very good. Short rib pasta. Rich tasting beef, as if it was braised for days. The date burrata was good, oddly the burrata lacked flavor, almost bland. But the dates made up for it.  Would try going back again. A franchise, so check out the other cities as well.

Gnuc80_FFId9og28VfiDuw.text: I'm giving a mixed review. We came on a Thursday night with no reservation and were seated in about 15 minutes. The service was 5 Stars. We were seated outside but with the heaters the temperature was terrific. The atmosphere of this place is great. You could come here for a casual dinner, an after work drink, or on a date.   But. We waited an extraordinary amount of time for a pretty basic meal on a night that wasn't exceptionally busy. The manager was very polite, came over and apologized and offered us another appetizer. We were enjoying ourselves and declined as the food was expected shortly. When the food came it looked great. However. My salmon was undercooked. The center could have been served as sushi. Again the waiter and then manager were both apologetic and offered a replacement meal, etc but at this point I am put off for the evening and will eat when we get home.   When the bill came, all they had done was remove the meal I didn't eat. After the wait and the inconvenience this is grossly unacceptable.  I was excited for the potential of this place but we definitely won't be returning.

CqX6uz-CfyHqL5EmhH9eDA.text: The roasted cauliflower was very very good.  Eggplant pizza was good as well.  I would have given 5 stars for this place but our food came out room temp so I know it was sitting awhile.  Also I had to get up and ask the bartender for more tea, which by the way was fantastic.  I will have to try again to see if service is better because food was that good, even cold

Nx6_of-HFjRcd_FefJYKLA.text: I had a fantastic time the first time I went on Valentine's Day. The waiter checking up on us, even the manager stopped by to see how everything was. I decided I was going to have my birthday dinner here a couple weeks later. I bragged to my friends about this place and they were all excited. We arrived with a group of 9 and they had our table ready about 10 minutes after the reservation which is normal. The waiter took our drink order and took 30 minutes to bring it back out. After we had to remind him of drinks, we had to ask if it was okay to order and he said oh yeah. We started off with appetizers and he brought that out 15 min after which was fine. He did not take our order still for the entrees. We had to waive him down and ask him if it was okay to order food finally after we had finished our appetizers and our drinks. He never asked us for more drinks or if everything was okay. We had to share waters because they were never refilled. Our order came out and he never checked up on us. My scallops were SO SALTY. I thought maybe it was just me but I had the others taste them and the same thing. The waiter never came back and checked on us so that I could tell him. We had to waive him down for our bill. We asked if he could split my bill amongst 3 people and he said this would not be an issue. He brought back my check and every single person was charged something different. How is this possible!?!? He did $22 on one bill, $19 on another and $12 on the last one!?!? We tried to wave him down to see what happened and he never came back so we just bit the check and left. Terrible experience for my birthday and even more embarrassing since I bragged to all my friends about how great this place was. If he can't handle a table of 9 on his own maybe management should have sent someone to help? Sad to say I will not be back. They get 2 stars because of the first experience. Otherwise it would have been a 1.

NkxSrlUQ10eEw7zCzqVDYA.text: I originally visited the location in L.A. so I was surprised to see one in Las Vegas. The absolute best Italian restaurant in my opinion. The atmosphere is chill and inviting, they have a nice bar and plenty of seating in the restaurant area. Last time I visited Carrot Top was there. They do offer happy hour, although the menu is pretty affordable. The zucca chips are a must try.

H4cQASsEGyE9cEHYcH08LA.text: I fell in love with this place when I was living in Phoenix and was so excited when Fox brought North Italia and a couple of their other restaurant outlets here to Las Vegas.  When you come to North,  be sure to ask for Bonnie if she is working - great personality, really knows her stuff.  She is a huge reason we keep coming back!

nHNQAFa0LFTiMAND9c9xDw.text: We went to the North Italia in Tucson 8 years ago. It was wonderful.   So we were back in Tucson a few weeks ago, and again had dinner there. Another excellent meal, with outstanding service.   They told us there was now a North, here in Las Vegas.   We went there this past Tuesday. What a disappointment!  The people were just going through the motions of service. While running by us, they asked how we were doing, without listening for a response.   Plus we both ordered pasta dishes. They were terrible. I would rather go to Olive Garden.  Plus, with how bad the food was, it was pretty expensive. I would not mind the cost at all, if the service and food were anywhere near the quality of their Tucson branch.   I would strongly suggest going to a different restaurant for Italian food!

OaJC-py_dB_cou37tCHlUA.text: It was just ok for me for these reasons. The service started out strong, and it was hard to find the server from mid dinner to the end. The food was nothing you want to say, "I have to come back again", unfortunately...especially for the price, I expected more. I ordered Bolognese, Daily Special Pizza, and Calamari. Bolognese - just the usual Bolognese and was not wowed by the sauce. Calamari was good - different which I liked (tossed w lemon vinaigrette with arugula). Daily pizza was sausage and broccolini with white sauce - again nothing special. Felt like I can find other Italian restaurants that has their "house special" sauce or better service. It is a pretty restaurant though. Sorry - I really tried to like this place like other reviewers..

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Daily Pizza - Sausage and Broccolini with White Sauce
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bolognese

8p5aHfu3rsYaLJsq1rw4QQ.text: We had reservations for 7pm-4 people. I called yo change it to 5 and spoke to the Asst GM-he gave us the best seat in the house! Smack in the dab of all the excitement.   Ordered: Arancini-rice balls Zucchini Chips Caesar salad Chicken parm  Truffle Garlic cheese bread Strozzapreti  Everything was on point!!! Food was absolutely delicious. Our waitress, Laura was great. Will definitely be going back.

nwFYo99G-h4mI3Ho5cqcoQ.text: Wow!! This place is absolutely amazing. I went here yesterday with a girlfriend and the food is sooo good. My girlfriend went here with a few of her other girlfriends several time and mentioned for us to try it out. We were immediately seated. The hostess was super friendly. The waiter was hip and cool. He knew the menu and all of the specials. The ambience was laid back and casual. The decor was innovative and fresh. I had their Strozzeli, which was a pasta dish with spinach, chicken, mushrooms (omitted) and a white Parmesan sauce. My girlfriend had the roasted chicken with corn. Both dishes were superb. The portions were perfect (not too little and not too much). The restaurant location was good right between Charleston/Rampart. There was plenty of parking. I think the layout of the restaurant quite new and refreshing. The entrance was completely open with outside seating, that could be viewed from the inside and out. I'd highly recommend checking this restaurant out!

w0xKCbH_QeibRfXCBAeNEQ.text: My friend talked highly of this new Italian place and of course we had to try it! last Friday we went with No Reservation and Bummer we couldn't get a table :( So this time first thing i did Book A Table. booking 8pm. We were all excited. Parking was packed and from far away you could hear the noise from inside!!! The restaurant was full from entrance, Covered and heated patio, bar area and restaurant. the covered patio has a very nice fire place, love the decorative azulejos that reminded me Portugal the  restaurant is very modern, trendy. Even I loved the decor... if you like a quiet Romantic night ... North Italian is not the right place ... it's loud loud :( We got our table quickly. I could barely hear the hostess, not sure if she even care LOL Our waitress was polite but not very sharp on her service :( It's pricy and I surely expect an excellent service what we did not received. Had to ask twice for water refill, we ordered couple appetizers and she missed to bring our bruschetta prosciutto. We enjoyed it at the same time as our meal. We ordered a round of aperitif Champagne, Apricot Lemonatta (didn't taste the apricot) Sicilian margarita. Cocktails were great. White truffle garlic bread (amazing made of fresh bread), Buratta excellent, refreshing, colorful just delicious and prosciutto bruschetta with grilled asparagus. We ordered the Strozzapreti with pine nuts, spinach, mushroom and chicken. It was delightful but next time I will order it with no chicken or have them serve it on the side. The chicken killed the dish in my opinion. The bolognese with tagliatelle pasta, I tried and like the creamy bolognese not too tomato tomato. Perfect amount of ground beef d carrot. Buratta tortellini... mushroom is my peche mignon :) it was maybe 8 tortellinis in my bowl with some sliced mushrooms and couple leaves of spinach. The dish was okay. The Bolognese was our favorite! We finished our dinner with an expresso served like in Europe :) Ask for sugar before your waitress leaves because she might not come back lol I think we were the last to leave and what a pleasant time we had when half of the restaurant left!   experience ... so so  If you like A good Italian, i recommend ROMA deli on Spring Mountain and Jones. It's not fancy but the gastronomy is closer to Italian Grand Ma cooking ... If you want fancy go To North Italia

62nN_0Ik9gtgWlvF1ygnww.text: Service was ok... ambiance was very nice, The Burrata winter squash dish was outstanding perfectly balanced even had these slightly roasted fig-or-dates sooooo good! Yummy!  The pasta Bolognese was not good small portion & the sauce was not that good  I make a way better one at home. The pizza my son ordered was just ok. You want good pizza go to Settebello fantastic pizza.

xaDsy-IhsZU2qAkox837sA.text: Amazing!!! Can't believe this is part of a chain. The food is fresh, delicious, truly genuine. If you haven't gone, definitely go.

r4uRuCtYky6AX3fqPy1oBg.text: We saw this place while eating at P.f. chang's and this was such a great place. I order the strozzapreti pasta and substituted the chicken for shrimp and it was an amazing choice. Also i highly recommend the calamari, it was a unique preparing. Jazz was an amazing server and very friendly and outgoing. She made the experience overall an outstanding time. Highly recommend for Italian lovers.

QR6DnwqyawRqwZC9yn5nzA.text: After weekend business trip, we made a reservation to this place, luckily we had a wonderful corner table with fantastic waitress "Bonnie" she gave us seamless service , never missed  a bit even though the place was over flowing with people

6-rk0YRwLirJXhB2r025Rw.text: Red Sangria. Delish ! Chef board. delish ! Squid ink pasta and margarita pasta. Delish !   This place is so cute, wish I lived closer so I could pop in for an appetizer and a glass of wine. Recommend reservations they get busy.

rrzu_ru2I6L1Oq3BrS4qBg.text: Excellent atmosphere. The service was great. The beef filet was so tender and delicious. The tiramisu was out of this world. There is a drink called the quiet Italian gentleman and it's the best. I like the outside inside setting. Great location. A homerun.

1hrWlMMrHfFMUs7zcjQ_ZQ.text: Great place to have lunch with friends!   Menu has something for everyone!  Very good service ....Bonnie is great! They don't rush you so you can enjoy the food and your friends! Great place for Happy Hour because they have small plate selection too!    Love the green ice tea!

1Za1JZJIdFEYuHq8A4ml-Q.text: 7 tortellini for $17 dollars. Ok, so this might fly in Arizona but in Vegas welcome to True culinary competition! My main course didn't fill me up at a petite barely over 5ft! No bread with tortellini pasta either? Manager explained that is by request only! That's not Vegas! You need to conform to foodie culinary ways of Vegas! Give this manager ability to be successful! Allow your service professionals to ask guests if they want bread so this restaurant can be successful! It's busy but from the people at the bar it's ok.... make it amazing and give decent portions and offer bread! Let the manager perform magic! He appears extremely customer centered and amazing! Listen to his requests!

-TaxdkGE5nxcvyBKHdkccg.text: Best restaurant in Vegas. The vibe and atmosphere is chill and the food in always amazing! The patio is a great place to sit with the nice weather.

RoWnJ7IIphzP_iFuDyt4Ig.text: I really wanted to love this place but the food is very bland and nothing really to write about but here it goes...first off I would think if you hire a hostess you would hire someone that reflects a classy restaurant not someone with tats and nose rings all over the place. If that's your thing great, but to welcome me to a classy restaurant, sorry no! Second the staff was not accommodating at all. Barely checked on us and barely knew the menu. The food was bland and nothing special. Since this is northern Italian food I expect it to be some what different than southern Italian food which tends to be more flavorful and robust! North Italia reminds me of a place for millennials to hang out with and try to be cool. There are so many new Italian places in the area that I would never have a reason to come back here. Pricing wasn't bad, portions were ok but bland Italian food is an oxymoron!

w1HaWxiIRSaYVUYke1WIKA.text: I have been seeing this restaurant all over social media and everyone has been talking about it, so I've been dying to go. First, I started out with a dirty chai drink which was exactly what I needed in my life. It had espresso, almond milk, and chai over ice and it's definitely worth getting if you are in the mood for a coffee beverage. For lunch, my mom and I split arancini, calamari, and the vegetable salad. The arancini is basically a fried mushroom risotto ball and it is DELICIOUS! I would go back just for these. The other items were so tasty as well. The pizza and pasta also looked so good, but i just wasn't in the mood for all of that during lunch. Everything is fresh and you can definitely tell. My waiter was Winston and he was so friendly and helpful with the menu. I know I will be coming back to this restaurant all of the time. North Italia is the type of restaurant that Summerlin needed.

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Arancini. Amazing.
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy Calamari
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegetable salad , delicious!

nuGnVZhp7lxxXoCk5oASKw.text: Not only was the vibe of this restaurant on point but the food was so good! The service was also good! I definitely recommend this spot for a casual dinner or even a date night.

CmTB7sYzJqWWplhaEy4aCQ.text: Being Italian I am very picky in my Italian food. We tried North Italia for the first time yesterday and I have to say it was amazing! We had the Margarita Pizza and the calamari which was wonderful. The Pizza a crisp and tasty. The calamari was different from what we are used to but I have to say it was light and refreshing. We then ordered two different pasta dishes, mine was the short rib,and it melted in your mouth, the pasta was cooked perfect and the light horseradish cream was a perfect bite when put all together. The other pasta was grilled chicken with mushrooms, spinach, pine nut, with a light cream type sauce, it was light and fresh and the combination of it all was perfect. For dessert we got the Italian donuts on top of a lemon sauce they were so light you could eat them all and not realize it.  Our waiter Oscar was attentive and explained everything to you. He gave some great recommendations on what we might like and as you can read above he was right on point. If you are looking for a great Italian place this is it! A must try! We are so glad we went and looking forward to returning there soon.

8wCAx5aXLo0E8lUFYvnlMA.text: Very rustic,authentic vibe here. My husband and I very much enjoyed our meal and will most definitely be back on another date night

oDRvJnZyR_PqquyLIZiF2w.text: We came for the soft opening and had such a delicious meal here,  we can't wait to come back! There were 3 of us and we all loved everything we tried. We ordered the Italian meatballs and burrata for starters and both were fantastic. For entrees, we tried the Chicken Parmesan, bolognese pasta and roasted salmon. All were excellent and very generous portions. For dessert we tried the hazel nut torta  and the salted caramel budino and couldn't decide which we loved more! The service was impeccable and the restaurant had a cool vibe to it. This will definitely be a go-to Restaurant whenever we are looking for great Italian food!

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ypgszziuP7ztTcCWoRBZeg.text: Loved the atmosphere, the cocktails and the food! Staff were friendly and responsive. Awesome artichoke dish and pizza yummy!

qj_mito5vzW62-QCi5Zr5g.text: ARE THE MANY 5-STAR RATINGS LEGIT?  Our group had a so-so experience at this loud, overpriced, undervalued venue.  $18 for a medium-sized bowl of barely-more-than-warm pasta?  Accompanied by nothing.  No bread, no salad, no vegetables.    The place has been open 6 weeks and the newbee local customers pack the place.  Will North Italia sustain a customer base?  Doubtful.  We enjoyed the food.  It was very good -- not exceptional.  A cast of twenty in the kitchen produced half our entrees after waiting 20 minutes.  The balanced arrived 27 minutes after ordering.  The service by M was defined by our 10% tip:  inattentive, slow to respond to a request, forgetful.    Not sure if a "manager" was around.  Not one person asked if we were enjoying our dinner.    And not sure if I will go back considering Olive Garden, Carraba's, Marc's Trattoria and others offer a similar if not better value and experience.

bQ1iFKMuvuMHjb99rJCTRA.text: Our party of 30 showed up without reservations. There seemed to be concern from the hostesses if they could accommodate us. They sat us on the patio with a bit of hesitation so we were unsure sure how the experience would be. Brenda helped us and rocked it! She was incredible. She seriously made the experience for us. The food was great and Brenda was amazing!! We had a great meal, lots of fun and perfect service. Thank you!!

BwZAItQ-5TkPb7oGmBkJNw.text: We are locals and it was our first time at the restaurant. The service started out really slow, 15 minutes before anyone acknowledged we were seated at the table.  I ordered the chicken parmigiana, it was the best I ever had. My husband is Italian and is extremely critical of Italian food at restaurants, he agreed it was the best we ever had. He had the bolognese pasta and asked for a side of sausage, which was not on the menu.  The side came late, but both were excellent.  They comp'd the sausage.  Coffee and the salted caramel budino were excellent as well.  The waitress did her best to make up for the initial tardiness and in the end we were very pleased and will go back.    We went back for dinner and I had the same chicken parm it was so good.  Hubs had the rosemary chicken, which was delicious.  The cranberry marscopone was to die for.  In spite of the excellent food , they still need to pick up the service level.  We were done with the appetizer by the time we got our cocktails.  Btw Hub's manhattan was excellent.  The coffee was old and cold...should have been tossed.  The refill was perfect.  Both women's restroom stalls were out of tp!

grl13o3UPScvPGHuO-1tiQ.text: They do not tell you or show on the menu what all the ingredients are on their food! I ordered two entrees and they both had truffle oil on it, which I can not eat. I told the server I could not eat truffles so she brought me one new entree with out truffle oil but the other entree was not replaced. I did not touch any of my food and they still charged me. Total of bill was $117. Food was definitely not worth it!

lfFJ7VgJ4Zzbhp0KhiJs6Q.text: Excellent food,staff,& managers! My new favorite spot in Summerlin. Well done North Italia

MKOm4xfxpRotmaExylI5UQ.text: I came here to celebrate my friends 25th birthday. First my waiter offered us drinks. Told us they have wine,cocktail, tea, then looks at me and my other Asian friend and asked if we wanted some green tea?!?!?! Next when the birthday girl asked our waiter if he can grab another chair for us he told us "you can grab a chair if u can find one" and walked away. I heard my neighbor table tell the same waiter that she was upset for her wait time and how he ignored her his response was "oh darn, I've just been so busy with other tables." Finally cherry on top of this excellent service is us asking him for clean plates and he brings us 3 plates when we were a party of 5. I'm not sure if he had a bad day or he just doesn't like us. But terrible service.   Food was great but due to the service the food tasted bland.

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Q5KmXDkjZvesgNrxhB5WXw.text: The service here was impeccable! The food came so fast it made my head spin! Kay keep working the room with your award winning smile and to Kevin our waiter thank you for making us feel at home being that it was at first time, but definitely not our last!

PEe_uHStxDzLuguEqaNRBA.text: Love this place! I always get the Tuscan kale salad with salmon for lunch and oh man, those charred grapes, life changing stuff. Pro tip: sit at the bar when Marie is working and get an espresso martini, as if the espresso wouldn't pump you up enough she's an angel from the cocktailing heavens. Stacy is great, too. If I could give ten stars I would.

xjZOB8T2cQ-fh8vhrr2jPg.text: This was a very popular spot for many Las Vegans as we visited thinking that it would not be busy. We were wrong. Thankfully, we were served right away because we opted to be seated outside. It was windy and cold, but thank god they had covers that made prevented the draft from entering.   The ambiance was romantic with many guests dining in with significant others. But this was also enjoyed by friends and family as the room was filled with muffled chats from everyone.   Our server was overly friendly as she helped us order our food and checked on us pretty frequently. They really cared that your beverage is filled to the rim so they often came back to refill our drinks when necessary. That was quite impressive for me.   We ordered the Chicken Pesto, Bolognese, and White Truffle Garlic Bread.   Chicken Pesto: I thought the pasta was not cooked thoroughly which made me enjoy the chicken instead. But it was delicious overall. I've always thought pesto didn't taste much so I was happy to learn that they have a different style of pesto that had hints of flavor with this plate. It wasn't too salty and you can taste the hints of garlic with it. Delicious.   Bolognese: Loved the cheese and the meat sauce that went with it. It was simple but heightened in another way as I enjoyed every bite of this meal. Would I order it again? Certainly.   Garlic Bread: I've heard a lot of good things about this plate, but I wasn't too impressed by it. I understand it's made with truffle but that wasn't enough to give it that "wow" factor for me. I also thought the side of cheese was a little weird as I couldn't figure out if it was indeed cheese or butter.   Also, serving the garlic bread was delayed as they gave it to the other table next to us. To our surprise, they apologized for the mishap and made a fresh batch, free of charge.

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States

EhMFfqtZlj3PDDmTpAaPiw.text: Great food, great service. Happy hour Monday through Friday...no complaints! Good energy for a night out :))

CEDn_P9-7-S18nL_M7RZhQ.text: I love Italian food and I love Italian food done well. This place does both. Has an amazing open concept interior as well as a wonderful inside outside bar. Amazing food selections with all the favorite Italian hits. I'm a big antipasti fan when it's done well in this place nails it. They have a happy hour. Which really affects the prices of the drinks more than anything. They have checudere boards with All types of breads, cheeses, meats and unique condiments and fruits. They have a really good drink specials and mixes that are pretty unique. Service is efficient and fun. Many of their appetizers can be full-blown meals for to the servings are so huge so be prepared for leftovers!

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XxrtnVh6L4MpQndOktXd7g.text: My new found favorite! Love the happy hour chefs board and the Sangria...mmm hmmm. We popped in after an afternoon golf session and enjoyed the chefs board 5/5 which included a plethora of delicious options including: prosciutto di parma, artisan cheese, marinated eggplant, roasted peppers, castelvetrano olives, marcona almonds and some apricot marinade. There were also some small pieces of bread with a little oil that go well with the plate. One great combination is a piece of bread, the apricot marinade and a marcona almond. Mmmm can't wait to come back.   After our first round of drinks we ordered a couple more Sangrias and tried the house specialty bolognese 5/5! The house made noodles were delicious and were served with plenty of sauce. Lastly, we tried the grilled cauliflower which was served with fried egg on top, cauliflower, baby asparagus, toasted breadcrumbs and a delicious pancetta cream.  Only regret is that we didn't save room for dessert :(, gives us something to look forward to our next visit.  The service was great 5/5. We sat at the bar and were catered to the whole time. Thank you North Italia for a wonderful time.

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bolognese (House Specialty)! 5/5
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chefs board is amaze balls!

kq-SOP7PuLra-jaE8odzwA.text: We had the mushroom pizza and the Bolognese with fettuccini style pasta, both were very tasty and enjoyable. It was a take out order that turned into a "lets eat at this empty table at the bar since we are already have drinks" type of deal. Speaking of the bar: they needed one extra person back there for a bar that size and it being within the 6-8pm drinking hours for Vegas.   The ambiance was lively and they had a bit of a wait for a table inside so id suggest making reservations on their website if youre coming any day around 6-8pm.   Join there ebite club for $10 off a $20 purchase. Id go back considering their service,  quality and price point.  Hopefully one opens closer to the Strip considering Town Square doesnt have a southern Italian restaurant and lets be honest Brio is a bit tired.

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dont bother ordering the Ginger Vanilla Greyhound. Sounded great but execution was lacking.
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The pizza crust was very good. I dont eat crust but this was fantastic. Onions i could have done without.
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The to-go order didnt look like the pics but tasted great!

yxOJZzK2z1uvQmyV9oqEZw.text: This Italian style eatery is located inside the rampart commons shopping center right next to Pottery Barn. This petite corner strip mall is lined up with affluent boutiques along with a couple dining options like Honey Salt and PF Changs.  We enjoyed the fresh, modern vibe and the outdoor covered patio looked like a fabulous place to dine when the weather cooperates. Indoors, they have open windows lining the back wall giving us the perfect view inside the kitchen at all of the bustling chef action. The service was very friendly from start to finish. But unfortunatly, most of the food we tasted was lacking flavor and love.   I wouldn't come here with high expectations for anything in particular. I also feel that the cuisine fits with New American/Italian fusion at best.  Their price point didn't match the way the plates were served; I was not thrilled with the presentation of the food. Value is hard to find here, especially when you have a lot of local, non-chain, Italian restaurants to choose from.  If I had to recommend something, try the arancini mushroom risotto balls and make sure to save room for the tiramisu, this spot adds clusters of crunch balls to the top which gives it an addictive texture.  Appetizer: Grilled cauliflower rated: 3/5  Arancini fried mushroom risotto balls rated: 4/5  Pizza: Prosciutto pizza rated: 3.5/5  Dinner entree:  Squid Ink malfadine rated: 3.5/5 Beef filet rated: 3.5/5  Dessert:  Tiramisu rated: 4/5  Cocktails: Sangria rated: 3.5/5 The IGT rated: 3/5

fMiiVuFiIrURpui_8lGv_A.text: Food Is Amazing!!! Bar Service is Awesome!!! Food service is terrible!!!!!! I made reservations for a quiet table for 2. We sat between two families with kids.  Server was late, food runners were horrible, never offered anything with our meal !! Cheese? Peppers, salad??? Nothing. Uggggggg Went back to the bar.  Happy New Year

xk7tX1EsihINoqHZG1EziA.text: This was our second time eating at North Italia. I have nothing but wonderful things to say about this restaurant. First of all, the customer service was great. Rita was our server, and she was absolutely lovely. Attentive, prompt, and very sweet, everything you could want in a server. The main courses took a little while to come out, which was fine because it was obviously very busy, but they gave us complimentary dessert anyways! The food was something else... chicken parm was gloriously indulgent. Perfectly cooked chicken, the crust was just right, the tomato sauce was tangy and delicious and the rigatoni noodles with white sauce were a wonderful compliment. The pistachio olive oil cake was amazing! Real pistachio peices added a nice crunch and the tang of the strawberries complimented the density of the olive oil cake very nicely. We will be back!!

IsjYp3-SnSw6DMVakx2LwQ.text: This pizza place was amazing!!! We had their specialty pizza of the day which had spicy salami on it as well as Gorgonzola cheese,balsamic vinagarete, arugula, and a white garlic cream sauce base. The crust was to die for! I had a apricot limonata which was a delicious cocktail and my mom had the sangria which was also tasty. We each had a Caesar salad which was yummy with the best cheese and then we split the pizza. Plenty for the both of us. Will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Specialty pizza and limonata

gki4goKwcG52QJWnPna9xw.text: 8 oz pour of wine was the highlight of this meal. Truffle bread could use a little less oil but delicious none the less. Arugula avocado salad perfect for when you're on a diet! Chicken parm was a hefty portion and the pasta that came with was super creamy. Would order again. Charcuterie was disappointing but welcome to Vegas. All in all great place and atmosphere. Server (Leonard) was super cool too with great knowledge of the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States

opDnh-WWPhoB4u2irqzz8A.text: Great food. Excellent ingredients. Awesome customer service . Cool spot for Sunday brunch. As of now a hidden gem! This place is definitely on my repeat can get enough. My daughter got the kids chicken plate. Amazing!!! Full of adult flavor done for the kiddos very nice north Italia .

tEnOjiHcEgJFKTy-n0p7-A.text: Excellent Italian dishes that rival Nora's here on the west side of the strip.  The calamari appetizer has a different spin than most with a light tempura batter and a lemon glaze that gives it more zip than your usual plain breaded calamari app.  Was a big fan of it.  Comes on a bed of arugula for some extra greens.  I love me some arugula.   We also split the prosciutto Pizza which was I thought was really good, but nothing to rave about...BUT my girlfriend thought it was the best pizza she had ever had in her life.  She's a big fig fan and a lover of prosciutto.  The goat cheese always makes everything good.    The missus got the chicken pesto and despite my waiter telling me that my order of short rib radiatori was his favorite by far, I have to say that the chicken pesto was on par.  It was really good.  The Sauce us heavy leaving you feeling full and satisfied...and guilty.   My short rib radiatori was just like the chicken pesto.  Excellent.  Very filling and satisfying.  A heavy dish for sure.    Desserts were both really good.  Tiramisu (hard for tiramisu to be bad, no?) and a hazelnut torta I think it was.    A great new Italian addition to summerlin.  We'll be back for sure.

obCNDB015IFGLuxaHHaJ5Q.text: First visit here.....simple (this simple is good) but creative menu. Had zucca chips, bruschetta apps. We also had the Burata Tortelloni  and mushroom strozzapreti in a cream sauce.  All was absolutely divine!!!! Service from Rita was the perfect amount of attention. The Asst Mgr Cole also stopped by and talked us into 2 desserts, I write this as we wait for those treats to arrive............they arrived....SHUT Up.. he brought out 3. And each one is better than the next.  GET HERE!!

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9r-RfzzswfElluxpKWgI0A.text: I came here this past Sunday night and I was very impressed!!  The experience was just great.  Right when we walked in, they had a table for us. They explained the menu and the concept of the restaurant.    A beautiful large bar in the front and an open kitchen towards the back made the restaurant look very big and open.  Loved the uniforms of the servers and bartenders too.   Their special Drinks were so yummy and the menu looked great. We ordered the short ribs and the scallops and they all tasted amazing. My favorite was the mussels on the appetizer menu.   Our server was also so sweet. I apologize for not remember her name because I really should of.  I've already ranted this place to my friends.   I will definitely be back soon!!!

6bLr5UgX3TqJe1CxmBMMag.text: It went downhill.  Their food is watered down and tasted like microwaved food.  I ordered the mushroom Chicken dish (can't spell it) it was soooo salty and bad.  They changed the pesto chicken and it was microwaved, water downed food.  It was Sunday and wine was half price hence the 2 star.  I am not coming back even though the location is nice, but the food is horrible.   Buy some microwave Italian food and eat it by the lake and you will have way better time.

c4HIXwi3jghkXrPEIQCfCw.text: I've been here with my wife a number of times. This particular time we came with my parents (which we've also done at least once). The food has always been very good, and the service is great. This time was no exception. It was Sunday, which means half off wine. So my wife and I shared a bottle of wine (a Cabernet Sauvignon from Washington I believe). We had a number of appetizers (including cauliflower and meatballs) followed by dinner and dessert (budino and donuts). We've had a great time everytime we've come, and will continue to come.

V6X1MX-FtZd___iyEGDQhg.text: Super cute place. Definitely putting this place on my 'go-to" brunch list. We came on a Sunday during prime brunch time so it was pretty busy but we were seated right away. I ordered the Tuscan kale salad which was light but flavorful and had great texture to keep it interesting. My group ordered the meatballs, arancini, breakfast wrap & egg sandwich - all was pretty delicious apparently.   Unfortunately, our drink order was lost so we ended up getting our food before our drinks came out. Our server immediately apologized and rushed to get our drinks out and even comp'd the first round. The manager (I'm assuming) also came by our table, apologized and again assured us our drinks would be on the house due to the inconvenience. After the initial shortfall in the service, they more than made it up to us which was really appreciated and actually saved the trip. Even though the food was delicious, service can really make or break me wanting to come back (especially with all the other great brunch spots around town). Kudos to the manager in acknowledging the mishap and making our dining experience great after that. I've already recommended to my brunch friends and will be back soon for dinner or another brunch outing.

S8K_qisU5b09dIlxF7rJ9Q.text: Very hip open rustic. Not for tshirts, sneakers unhip tourist. Great indoor outdoor bar ,patio dinning. The service on point. friendly and very professional. The food is outstanding.Best for dates, large parties but kep the kiddies at home.

MCs1lck0trfXXNDeCEQL3g.text: This restaurant is amazing I love the whole theme of having the kitchen wide open where the guests could see the back end of the kitchen cooking their delicious food. The server was wonderful and the food is quite amazing. Will definitely come back here again

p8rPPbLt0KODUTrxzglMHQ.text: Our first time going to North Italia were heard some good and bad stories. We went on Fathers Day it was busy. We sat outside let me tell you the food was yummy, great flavor and our waitress was fun and fast. She did an awesome job recommending appetizers (meatballs, Chefs board, calamari),  salad-(Caesar) and our main dish (chicken parmesan) we definitely will go back. We had a great time.

H1YZUzsbMqHYhNT--XdQMw.text: I went here for a birthday party for the first time tonight. They have happy hour specials from 3 to 6 and they are great. You can get a chef's board and bottle of white or red wine for $20!   We had the grilled artichoke, zucca chips ($3 at happy hour), and the chef's board and wine. Everything was very good but the zucca chips were amazing. We would buy them by the bag.  For dinner, our party had the margherita pizza, bolognese, and filet of beef. We recommend them all.  Dessert consisted of sorbet (lemon is still refreshing), caramel gelato, and the salted caramel budino. The caramel gelato was very ordinary, while the budino is the dessert of dreams. It tastes like salted caramel toffee. I will definitely be back and could imagine going solely for the zucca chips and budino.

9Wom4t8tcgzq8kHApA-njQ.text: North Italia is amazing!  I have eaten there twice, and both times my food was absolutely delicious.  The first time I had the pasta bolognese, which they make with their homemade noodles...perfection!  The second time I ordered their burger...and again, it was perfect.  The only problem, is the parking lot is so small and there are all those new restaurants that opened up in the same location, so at times, there is nowhere to park.  We were going to go have brunch here last Sunday, and couldn't because the parking lot was full, and there were so many cars driving around waiting for a place to park.  Anyway, not that it's their fault...just mentioning that.

jyeqwGhnEFLhDuJsgkFlYw.text: We have been twice so far and the food is great and our service was AWESOME. Jennifer was a stand out server. She was super nice, very accommodating and had great suggestions that was our first time there). The servers all seem really knowledgeable about their menu. Definitely going back!!

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cannot beat their Board and a Bottle Happy Hour deal!
