QG-pKkmwNNjVnKimWR9FSQ.text: My friend and I came for a late Sunday brunch.  The food and drinks were good, but the service was exceptionally slow...which was weird considering they were not at all busy while we were there. I love the ambiance of the venue and would definitely come back.

lVwsC5f6_li3Mt-4UwbyGw.text: Located in the same shopping center as Honey Salt, this restaurant is brimming with people, it is recommended to have a reservation at dinnertime. It took them about an hour or so (peak evening) to seat us.  They have an assortment of pastas and pizzas. The margarherita pie fresh from the oven, the squid ink pasta has a spicy kick with a nice portion of calimari + shrimp.  There was a mixup of one of our friend's dishes ans had to be sent back. The response time was prompt and understandable given how packed it is. Seems that the workers met the challenge with success

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Squid Ink sooo delicious
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meatball appetitizer

JFd1HGywu0irrYf7kcXJiw.text: Great restaurant in Summerlin. We were recommended by friends and told to get the calamari. We did and it was great. Our server was pleasant and informative. We all ordered four different pasta dishes. The kids spaghetti was as big as an adult order. The pesto and braised beef was flavorful and filling. No bread needed at this restaurant. The desert donuts were a little different. The ricotta dip was not good. Everything else was great.

Q2HtQJG2KgI1bvZMI9QfQQ.text: Our first visit to North Italia was on Father's Day and it was busy! Wow! We had reservations for 6:15 and our table was ready on time.  There were so many people there and it was absolutely filled with families enjoying their dinners.  Our server took our drink order quickly and appetizers, heirloom tomatoes and cucumbers and grilled artichokes were delicious.  No bread though.  They did take a minute and the manager came by too apologize.    We were with my husband's parents and together managed to order the same thing, Bolognese for the ladies and chicken parmigiana for the gentlemen.  The waiter suggested ricotta for the bolognese and said he'd bring a little out for us to try.  I ordered a side of meatballs as well for my husband to try.    It was taking a bit of time and the manager again came and apologized for the wait.  The food came out shortly thereafter sans meatballs but they were brought out quickly when we asked for them.  Three smallish meatballs.  They were really good though.  The bolognese was very good and needed nothing.  It's cooked with sausage as well so if you're not used to that, it might bother but I thought it was very good.  The ricotta addition gave it a lasagna component.  The chicken parmigiana was amazing! The chicken coating was nice and crispy and the chicken moist and tasty.  The pasta combined with the chicken was the perfect bite.    We really enjoyed ourselves and were happy with everything we ordered.  We just wish there was some sort of bread to sop up the remaining sauce from the bolognese.

_NpWZTx4V8bGvZcHNYIRZg.text: It's a chain that I enjoy.  But this location is a bit amateurish.  How do you run out of your signature cocktail, the Apple Bourbon Sour?  And continue be out for 2-3 days?

kNDHSQMPPucBwMuBl1Jzbw.text: The branzino, salads and pizzas are great. The only thing we've had that was not good is the bolognese.

Ri9mpchT6qy98t9F03r80g.text: I've been here a couple time now, and I'm a big fan. So far I've had pizza, and salads with salmon. Some appetizers, too.  The pizza was pretty good. The crust was a little soft, even though I asked for it well done, but the toppings and flavor were top notch.  The salads are definitely the star for me though. Came here for lunch with the wife one day and was not super hungry, so didn't bother with a full meal. Salad sounded good, so I had a caesar with grilled salmon added. Oh boy, this was delicious. The salmon was cooked perfectly, the salad was crisp and fresh. My only complaint is that they were a little short on dressing. I've had this salad on three visits now, and unfortunately they're a little inconsistent with serving size. Twice was good and the most recent time I felt like I got a "lunch portion" even though I was billed the full price and didn't ask for a lunch-size portion. Salmon was still the proper size though! And still delicious.  I'm glad this place is so close to me. I don't eat out often for lunch, but this is one of my go-to spots now.

dIR4-sLQWaKxo_xlK89eKw.text: To say I was disappointed with my meal and service quality at North Italia is a vast understatement. This past Saturday a friend and myself decided to call in an order and take it to go since her husband was still at home and it's about 30-35 minutes away, we just happened to be over that way.   We order on the phone and they repeat it back to me and everything sounds great, they say it'll be 25 minutes and we head over to pick it up. Once we get there they confirm our order again and give us the receipt to sign and all seems good. We ordered two different pasta dishes, the scallops, and the bread appetizer. We leave and get back to the house, again, 30-35 minutes away and the appetizer and two pastas are on top with the scallops on the bottom. Everyone's food looks ok, then I get to the scallops. I asked for no butternut squash and to sub for asparagus, which the receipt said again that it was subbed. Upon opening the container, the risotto part of the dish was missing entirely from our order, so right there half the meal is missing. They still put the butternut squash in as well, and the Brussels sprouts weren't actually Brussels sprouts, just the ends that when cooking you usually discard because they're too fibrous to chew through (I included a picture of the Brussels sprout ends, which were the only thing included).   So, basically I got to pay for a full entree to only get 3 scallops and a few asparagus and nothing else to eat. I called them to see if they could potentially put me on a list or something to have the entree remade at a later time, because again, I'm 30+ minutes away and driving back would be ridiculous. I didn't want a refund and I wouldn't even have written this review if something like that was done but they just apologized and asked if I could drive back to get the missing component of my meal.   Based on their reviews and people saying everything was good I was excited to try this place and upset that my experience wasn't the same. Just prepare to be disappointed if you order to go.   **UPDATE: The manager messaged me wanting to make it right and I tried to reply but the email he gave me wasn't valid and he never replied to my message so I guess my review stands since I won't be giving it a second chance due to the flaky communication

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9S92surf0CA2hFTf8CaI-A.text: This place is one of the best Italian spots we have been too!! The truffle garlic bread is a must, I repeat a MUST!!! I had the squid ink pasta and I'm very use to spicy things but I must say it was very spicy! The flavor of the seafood and pasta kept me eating the dish but drinking water between each bite! The atmosphere of this place is amazing and the waiters know their stuff!

srAFP74yQxQ_R5T7VXHCbw.text: Truffle bread is to die for! Great service and food. The chicken parm is great. A little disappointed in the eggplant parm pizza. The eggplant was just put in the top. Eggplant parm should be breaded

HM00F3N38q09xCwKF6izeQ.text: Love the atmosphere, love the simple clean foods. The staff is always nice and the food is always fresh tasting. The restaurant has a great vibe and is perfect for small and large groups. Definitely sign up for the Fox Restaurant groups email and get the $10 off coupon valid for 2 weeks. The breakfast pizza with the egg, bacon, and potato is delicious. The zucchini chips are light and easy to snack on.

35Ww7jKjYHGVhNv4J_slBA.text: Awesome  and friendly service, high quality food. The atmosphere was pleasant and the cleanliness was legit which is super important to me.

HvwqyfHjL3-1ZvkoPeC63Q.text: This place is really popping for being so new. I suggest making a reservation because there will be a wait if you just show up. But the bar is open seating outside and inside. The cheese board and cauliflower are great apps. The seasonal salad probably one of the best salads I've ever had. Second time I went I got spazztetti (sp?) pasta. Very good!!! I'd get it again. And enough to take leftovers home! Fun atmosphere restaurant bar style. Heaters outside.

zoZJ8zf36yKOPLkturBiUg.text: Simply amazing, very hip Northern Italian cuisine. Great food, great atmospher and great local prices. would never go to the strip again for Italian food. The pasta, pizza and salad was very good. love this place will be back tomorrow  night.

9VNl76Ewctvbfgqh6_CNng.text: Came here for a date, bartender Eric's service was very quick and efficient, and he recommended the short rib ratiatori, LOVED IT. Will be back for the friendly and fast service and will ask for Eric! This guy is the definition of customer service!

DY6fG5E3zHE4Gq6ZqKV0Hg.text: The food was amazing!  Excellent service too quick and fast! I'll definitely comeback and leave room for dessert.

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tVadlftlIYSaiy1OPNj37g.text: Today was our first time dining at North Italia. It was absolutely fantastic. Bonnie our server was so attentive and incredibly informative. She told us we had to try the short rib radiatori- it was AMAZING. Also, the calamari is insane. Make sure you try this gem and ask for Bonnie. She is the best!

pG2wiSeT5w-DL84XJa_4eQ.text: This restaurant is a great addition to Summerlin. The ambiance is great. The food is yummy. The staff is friendly and helpful. They have some great happy hour options during the week as well.

ppBPdSnBwhsWMzoZ-J_M-g.text: Not only was our waitress, Paulina, extremely knowledgeable about the cuisine but she also was excited about her employer and her future with the team. Friendly and passionate she helped make this experience an amazing experience for my partner and I. New favorite place. Thank you chef and the whole team.

5pWRoAEcyrkeR3zwJvjLTw.text: I've been here 5 times now. Super cute place and delicious food! I don't usually write Yelps but the last time I was here, I felt like I had to. Met the ladies for some wine and apps on the patio. Food came out awesome and our service was amazing! Giana was so personal and attentive and made us laugh!  Will definitely be back and requesting her!!! Thank you Giana and North Italia!

JGhT3ZLvQkw4sNv5R29j7Q.text: Excellent rating for atmosphere, service quality and delicious flavors.   Would give 5 stars except that the portions are pretty small!   Overall kudos to this new neighborhood gem.  The bar looks like a fun vibe to grab a beverage & a bite.  Very easy wait because they provide texting service and there are nice shops to browse.  We tried the short rib pasta...excellent, the farm salad and tortellini!   We will be back for sure!

yLG8fEHDamOGc1CBO_7KrQ.text: Another overrated Italian food chain. Nothing great about the food except for the service.

O1vfPoc7nYOi9a7-Shpbww.text: Brenda is the best! She's so kind and funny! By far the best service ever! She was the only waitress working the entire time we were there! I wish other places had people like her! Thanks for everything Queen B! You're the best!

rIm4JltTpu1Tf_HVUufnqQ.text: First time i went it was so so. Second time was better. Best to make a reservation on open table. It was way better experience when we made a reservation. I asked to be close to the tv cuz the playoffs were on and they did accommodate me

mvzIsEeR7EETsLPRntY3ZA.text: Great get together with about 15 friends who had no reservation at this restaurant. We live on the edge!  But they welcomed us as we grabbed a couple of high bar tables outside and it was great. We all had several cocktails and appetizers all very good and our server was patient and kept track of all the checks which can be challenging.   It is very nice, fun place to hang out, have drinks or dinner.  We'll be back!

GJ1MQrZDeGDQLo3Ae0SI9Q.text: Spectacular experience. The service was top notch. Not only were they very accommodating, they knew their facts about every dish, drink, and decors purpose. You don't see this type of service anywhere off the strip. Food was mouth watering. Great flavors and pairings. I already can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States

m9lNFZsARH2Bgzsm7-KvCg.text: Unbelievable service from the entire staff especially Tyler. Atmosphere is excellent and food is perfection. Easily 5 more things on menu I have to try. Can't wait to come back!!!

_tMIxdpr8pxOv6NsUlHeqQ.text: Great Italian cuisine!! Always fresh ingredients and awesome customer service! A great go to when you're in the mood for authentic Italian food.

8Q3Sj4MEsDZhnOpZnF1HFw.text: Great place for both a family setting or a date. Amazing food all around with a great variety of Italian foods. The service was amazing and the workers kept me feeling pleased. There is indoor and outdoor seating with a bar both inside and outside. The only downsides I could find were the long wait time and the short close time. the wait, on average, is about 20-30 minutes. Not too bad when considering the great service and food. The restaurant closes at 9 pm which is kind of a bummer but eating early is worth it!

EJVxaU_4lbZz6Felt2I0Gw.text: Extremely disappointed. I went recently with my girlfriend to celebrate our anniversary and was presented with dissatisfaction. My lovely girlfriend ordered a chicken pesto, chicken on the side (she is vegetarian and wanted to give me the chicken) and I ordered the simple salad with salmon. The waitress was quick to take our order; however, the dishes took quite a bit, which is understandable considering how busy they were on a Saturday night. About 25 mins later, we received our food  and we both dived in. My girlfriend began eating and then said, "I don't know what I ate, but I hope it was cheese." A few bites later she asks me to try it and I told her it was chicken. She was extremely upset considering the pasta was $18 and it took very long for the food to be delivered. I, on the other hand, enjoyed my salad with salmon. I was tempted to call the waitress and complain since my girlfriend is vegetarian and there was chicken in her meal. It's understandable that the kitchen was overwhelmed with the amount of orders coming in; however, it is utterly unacceptable to have something in your food that you specifically asked for on the side. I had high expectations for such a highly rated and expensive restaurant.

XG6SKe8g2dNqdZLuM3pL2A.text: I would love to give this place 5 stars but I will explain why I can't at the end of this review. I first tried this place in Austin, TX. I had never had fresh in house made pasta. It is truly life changing!!! Ok, well not life changing but definitely changed my ability to have pasta any other way. It even has convinced me to buy a fresh pasta maker and get my pasta making on! When I found out it was going to open locally in Las Vegas in December I made it a point to go the day after it opened, 12/13/17.  We went for a friends birthday. I made reservations and made sure to tell the hostess. When we entered the restaurant they asked who's birthday it was and said happy birthday to my friend. Figured we were good to go with some kind of dessert at the end. Dinner was fantastic. We were all impressed, even my friends father who said "he is not a pasta fan". My only reason for deducting a star is that the birthday somehow got lost in the transfer from hostess to server. She did not acknowledge it at all. Those little things mean something and are a huge miss when you make it a point to take someone out on their birthday, especially when you've raved about it. Maybe it was overlooked because I didn't bring in any obnoxious balloons or gift bags. It took me a few months to get time to write this review and in reading some reviews it seems the majority that aren't perfect are coming back more on staff and customer service than the food. It's sad because it really beats out places like Nora's that does not do fresh pasta but bad service will deter anyone even from the best food. Hope they get that together! Other than that, recommend!

TSV7iaCwrAhK4W_BwaCRuQ.text: After waiting with anticipation, we were there on the second night the restaurant was open.  The place was already jumping, and we were glad to have reservations.  With a friend, our party was three.  We started with salads all around--mixed vegetable, mixed vegetable with chicken, simple salad.  All were great.  Then it was on to prosciutto and fig pizza and filet of beef.  Both were really outstanding.  Dessert was an almond and mascarpone tart.

RWk1_IYWneSkiuGpPD4VTw.text: Sunday brunch was a win at North Italia. Great company and great food. This is going to be my new recommendation when asked where to go for a great meal in Summerlin.   The inside of the restaurant is open and lively. The vibe would be great for a brunch with friends or a date night with your love. In addition to a large indoor dining room they have a large outdoor patio too.   Since I was dining with two foodie friends we dined family style and were able to try quite a few items this way. Our waitress informed us that everything is made in house and this was evident in the flavor of everything we enjoyed.   Arancini- mushrooms added a nice touch, the risotto was perfectly cooked, and the red sauce had the perfect flavor Margherita Pizza- loved the flavor and texture of the crust with the fresh ingredients, would definitely order this again Strozzapreti- the homemade pasta was delicious and perfectly prepared, all of the ingredients worked well together, and the flavor of the parmesan cream was delicious Chicken Parmesan- a large chicken cutlet with more delicious red sauce and a great tasting parmesan rigatoni on the side, loved this dish and that it came with both red and parmesan sauce on the plate Lemon Donuts- so much yum, the texture was light and airy with a little vanilla cream inside and delicious lemon sauce to set off the flavor of the donut Almond & Mascarpone Tart- the dessert of my dreams, creamy and the perfect amount of almond flavor with delicious cranberries and oranges to round out the flavor  I'm already dreaming of my next visit!

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Almond &amp; Mascarpone Tart
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Margherita Pizza
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strozzapreti

kUs3P5nyrq3KEQcCGJ5q0Q.text: Thanks for the presentation, tasty food and creative drinks menu. Desserts are also excellent. All in all, a well-rounded restaurant. Close to home. Pleasant and accommodating service. We enjoy coming here.   P.s.: we also had the apple bourbon cocktail and the almond mascarpone dessert. No pictures for those. Were too busy enjoying everything. At least a couple shots of the scallops.

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The scallops. Yum!
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BLwaAqEDPEfMOX01_XtPeg.text: My favorite spot for lunch, family dinner or a quick salad and cappuccino with my little puppy! The staff is always warm, friendly and recognize me as soon as I walk in.  My favorite server is TC - her vibrant, positive personality always leaves us smiling and feeling good about ourselves. She is the highlight of my week.   Every dish I've tried has been fantastic.  Highlights are any of the pizzas ($10 during happy hour!), the strozzapreti pasta, any dish with short rib, the filet with crispy potato and burrata with grilled bread.  I love the open atmosphere, the large outdoor patio which is perfect for when my little chihuahua joins me! The noise levels are surprisingly moderate/quiet considering how packed this giant open space gets at dinner time.  I cannot recommend this place enough!

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Simple salad with perfectly grilled salmon.
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Broccolini and sausage daily pizza!
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Perfectly cooked filet with crispy smashed potatoes.

L3tOtP5GCANxwxQL5qPi9g.text: 4 stars for a killer deal of charcuterie board and a bottle of wine! Plus nice venue, can sit outside or inside and enjoy happy hour! Servers were great too! The board wasn't the best but it's decent bonus to the bottle. I'll return and recommend to others! Cheers!

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Charcuterie board with the happy hour wine bottle
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy hour
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Zuca chips

x0DbSty0ik9BiC06PBgIUQ.text: Came here with a friend after he heard that I hadn't tried the place out. I loved the decor, and that there is an option to sit inside or out with a covered patio and heat lamps when it's chilly. We opted to sit inside on a brisk December night, and I slightly regret it due to the noise level. The acoustics in there aren't the greatest and everyone's conversation just bounces off of the brick walls.   Our server was less than delighted to be there, and acted like we were a waste of her time, but we hardly had any interaction with her so it wasn't that big of a deal.   The grilled cauliflower with a sunny side up egg was really good as a starter, and we both ordered pastas for dinner. I had the mushroom tortellini which was REALLY heavy, I'm talking like-- your calories for the entire day rich, but definitely worth it with the butternut squash and sprouts that accompany inside. I'm not a huge pasta person so I didn't care for my date's bolognese but he loved it.   We ordered the salted caramel bundino for dessert and it was 100% worth it for the finale of our dinner. I wouldn't order the merlot for dinner it was pretty bad palate wise, but for $10 you can't really complain. Aside from the noise and service, I'll most certainly be back to try other things on the menu!!

WxsOg5AjiyCsPmB9J8btAA.text: Had a delicious lunch with my gal pals.  Excellent lemonade, zucchini chips, white truffle bread, margherita pizza and chicken parmesan.  Fun bustling atmosphere with outdoor seating.

D_aoFpQMCAMmQWgp2r5xYA.text: This is probably one of my favorite restaurants! The food is delicious. I highly recommend the homemade pasta for food. You can't go wrong. I had the chicken pesto, and my husband got the squid ink pasta. The wine is also amazing. I really enjoy their rose and white wines. If you're still hungry, get dessert! The vibe inside the restaurant is awesome too. There's a fire pit on the patio and a bar area. Service is always on point whenever we go.

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2EgRHR1ICLm0AYru6ZqWMQ.text: Most important info first: HH is 2-6PM, Mon-Thurs. You're welcome. Their happy hour is one of my favorites in town, and they have the best deal with a chef's board of meats and cheeses PLUS a bottle of wine for only $20. Winning!  While I usually visit for HH, the menu is full of great options from apps to desserts- their sea salt caramel bundino is a must-order for me, and their pasta portions are large and shareable. So far, I have yet to try the pizzas but they have a featured daily special each day with seasonal produce. I also hear rave reviews about their truffle bread. Location is gorgeous, opt for the patio if tables are available. Staff have been really great about accommodating tweaks to orders due to dietary restrictions, which is really appreciated.  TIP: Sign up online for their email list for $10 off your first visit and make reservations through the OpenTable app because they're usually busy!

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States

w4qJmIbB7yiYZh08HWgb8A.text: LOVE THIS PLACE!  Seriously the best Italian food in Vegas! Great location & the atmosphere is so nice. We sat outside for lunch and thankfully had a nice Vegas breeze - it was perfect!  Arancini - DELISH. Perfectly cooked & the sauce is light.  Baked Salmon - Perfectly cooked as well (medium). Sauce is a pesto type of sauce. Not too oily though which is usually my issues with pesto sauces.   Spaghetti & Meatballs - Best I've had, honestly! The spaghetti was a thicker size which I love and the sauce had a sweeter taste (but not too sweet!) The tomatoes were so fresh and sauce was light.  I would absolutely recommenced this place & will be back for more!!

poJF49AmeN3u1mNxkeFEAg.text: Amazing Customer Service and Food! After an amazing birthday dinner last night I had to rave about what incredible employees North Italia has. The Manager was incredible, I didn't get her name but she was a beautiful expectant mother, who made sure our party was taken care of and seated as soon as could be. She brought over a few appetizers on the house due our table not being available due to nothing under their control. (A few young gals were sitting there texting long after their table was cleared and bill paid). We had reservations but we sure didn't mind drinking the great wine while waiting.  Our server was incredible, Kaye made sure all 7 of us had anything we needed and when one of the pizzas came out wrong she immediately brought us another and then gave us another comped appetizer. I must have interacted with about 5 people that worked there and each one of them was so helpful, kind and prompt. I stood at the bar to pay the check before my friends could and the ladies at the bar were swamped yet they both asked if they could do anything to help me! :) I said, "Oh, I'm being taken care of but thank you so much for just asking!"  This was a Thursday night and the restaurant was packed but we never waited for anything we needed.   I had to write a review because having an entire restaurant staff with these great of attitudes and customer service needs to be recognized. I can't thank Kaye and the other managers for everything they did for me and my friends.  Thank you all for making my b-day celebration so incredible and delish! (Wine and bread was incredible)   Also, this was my first time here and we will hold all future fun events and gatherings here from now on.

cF4i0y9v4oc8kWZG4GnS2g.text: Came here last month and had chicken Parm with rigatoni in vodka sauce. Just came in tonight after driving 20 miles to get here and they tell me "they don't have the ingredients for vodka sauce". Complete bs. You know you can make it. Thanks for a great Friday night

M7TDFFDBpEYNJibW5lnWeQ.text: LOVE this place! I'm so excited to write this review because I'm so happy there is an amazing hip Italian place in Vegas. We came last night around 6 for dinner, and it was super lively inside. They have a beautiful outdoor patio seating that takes up nearly half the restaurant, and the whole restaurant itself is open air. I would describe this place as elegant and rustic.   We got the Garlic Truffle Bread w/Ricotta Appetizer and omg this was so good. The bread is well coated in olive oil, retained the crunchiness and softness of the french loaf, and was bursting in flavor. The homemade ricotta cheese with it was a really nice touch and added a coolness to the bread.   For our main course, we got the Squid Ink Madaldine. I honestly wasn't wowed by this dish for the fact that the pasta itself was too al dente for my liking and the pasta flavor was overpowered by the mint leaves. The spicy tomato sauce itself was really delicious, but I think it needed more of it.   We also got the Funghi Pizza, and WOW this pizza is legitimately so delicious I kept commenting throughout dinner how yummy this pizza was. The crust is really nice, but the star of the dish were the perfectly cooked roasted mushrooms in the olive oil and mozzarella. It really tasted as though truffle oil was used, and I'm a huge truffle fan. So pretty much, you need to get this pizza.   For Dessert, we got the Tiramisu. It was so fresh and yummy, and actually comes in a pretty large portion (enough for 2). I really liked the crunchiness of the chocolate balls on top, adding some nice texture.   The service here was also top notch. I was greeted by the GM and checked on multiple times throughout dinner. I'm in love with North Italia.

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Funghi Pizza. SO YUMMY!!!
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Squid Ink Pasta. Pretty good, but didn&#39;t blow me away

rjFrG1bR7vTtoYLrD29bjw.text: Excellent service, amazing food. This place is a must Visit.   The grilled artichoke appetizer was excellent - cooked just right.  The spaghetti and meatballs felt like I was in Italy - the sauce was amazing and pasta so fresh.   For desert - the tiramisu is some of the best I've ever had. And the pistachio olive oil cake was out of this world

YXwVROvwbJIw-Ij9QiUECw.text: Went to North Italia today for the first time with a friend who is a regular customer. It's definitely attractive both inside and outside in the patio area where we sat. The food was trendy good and the service was excellent. The only drawback was the extremely snooty/rude blonde female bartender. This place has so much going for it I'm sure they should be able to find someone a LOT more pleasant hence the 4 stars instead of 5. And one final note; their website states that weekend brunch is from 10 to 4 however the rude bartender abruptly told us they didn't open until 11 and to sit on the bench and wait.

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Incorrect website times

pdgSRHfaA7XCQ38CCFUlMA.text: This place is fabulous!! The service was great, The food was delicious and the cocktails on point. Very clean atmosphere. I always drove by here to and from work, I had no idea of any other restaurant in that corner besides PF Changs. Well, I'm happy that I found this place. We now have a new hang out for cocktails and good food.

EgOOTVPcMWZtaYLkm-nd_A.text: Was a solid choice for Saturday lunch. We had a nice sever but did take his time on things. Highly enjoyed the burrata for appetizer and arugula avocado salad. I had their breakfast option of veggie scramble with toast and potatoes! Their roasted potatoes are to die for. They look like small little hush puppies. Their French toast dish was wonderful too. Everything was well seasoned and good portions. Not overly abundant on portions which I prefer. My gf had their bolognese signature dish and it was really flavorful and the pasta was cooked al dente. The kids menu had nice options and tasted great. We had the crispy chicken with fries. It was plenty for the 3Yo. Their only item I was not too overly excited about was their salted caramel gelato. It was ok.

AbU7GfLRYLBLYLcR0fky2A.text: Excited to try this place as it always seems so lively and many of my friends love it. I made a reservation via open table to ensure I had a table And that went well. I had a table waiting for me. I asked about a wine and the waitress said she never had it and offered a taste of it and holy cow...that took 20 minutes and then another 20 to get the bottle and another 30 for the food. She kept blaming a back up at the bar...which was seriously empty so i would hate to see what a weekend night that's busy would be like.   Outside of the slow and undesirable service...the food was top notch. This restaurant would make it on food alone and it might just be so good that it would compensate for the miserable service.   The waitress asked if we needed boxes and obviously sees we have a pizza and realized after she brings tiny boxes that....yeah pizza...doesn't quite go in a tiny box. I'm not sure what kind of experience she has in restaurant....but she really needs some training.   I think the front of the house needs work to really nail this. If this restaurant flops, it's because of the front of the house. The food is impeccable. We had some amazing food. A little disappointed that they were out of meatballs though...but every dish was amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zi_0U8XS752okSTOzom7tQ.text: This has become my favorite restaurant in Las Vegas, which speaks volumes considering all of the delicious spots to go to in the city. I go here for my birthday and all big celebrations and I have never been disappointed with the quality and flavor of the food, and everyone that I bring has the same reaction. The first thought that comes to mind with this place is definitely the appetizers, which have been so good that I have contemplated not ordering an entree (just a fleeting thought, of course). Really though, everything is delicious, and service has been nothing short of wonderful.

uFEfs6k2pxxyYXKrR5LjGQ.text: We met friends for dinner here on a Saturday night and it was definitely a neighborhood favorite, they were busy!  I thought the experience was okay, but I was not as impressed as others before me seem to have been....I was looking forward to the food, I had checked out Yelp ahead and had even bookmarked the restaurant previously. We had the Chefs board and the truffle garlic bread to start. Both were good. The truffle garlic bread was the star of the night! I would recommend this appetizer for sure.  Dinner for me was the "House specialty" Bolognese. Not impressed at all.... sorry... Chef Marc's Bolognese is FAR superior!!! I love pasta and didn't finish my entree...  My husband liked his Short Rib Radiatori. So did our friends at the table.  It really was for my a three star "A-Okay"...

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chef&#39;s Board.
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. House Specialty, Bolognese
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short Rib Radiatori

CVRfUp1CBjnOE813iZTMeQ.text: In my previous review, I deducted a star for their service. Recently joined an out of town friend for lunch since she wanted to try this place. Our server was attentive and funny and definitely checked up on us unlike my last experience. We ordered the daily special for both the pizza and soup. Both dishes were so hearty and delicious. We ordered the Potato Spinach pizza and seasonal butternut squash soup. It was such a perfect combo for this cooler weather we are finally having. We sat outside and the ambience was perfect: Warm pizza, hot soup, chilly weather and great conversation :) The ingredients were fresh as per usual. Again, I left not feeling overstuffed and yucky. Highly recommend to at least give it a try since it looks like management is making an effort to improve their service.

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seasonal butternut squash soup with Potato Spinach pizza

vB7rnwKGxe4JMCxObxA43A.text: Great lunch spot with friends! I had been wanting to try this place since it opened and I was planning a lunch with some friends and one of them chose this place- so glad they did!!  Awesome atmosphere, cool decor, very clean bathrooms. Perfect place to catch up with friends and talk. It wasn't noisy, although it might be during dinner when its busier.  The lunch menu had a lot to choose from. One of my friends has a few dietary issues and they were very accommodating. Our server explained the menu and was very helpful in ordering. Our food came our exactly as we requested it.   They have gluten free crust for the pizza, one of my friends choose this and it looked amazing- she said it tasted great! I had the roasted vegetable salad which was super yummy and very filling, my other friend had a green salad with salmon.  Our server was awesome, super fun and very attentive. I will for sure be going back :))

69TZbnTY0yi3gO_ZY8vssg.text: Great service and varied menu. Friend had scallops that looked awesome. We had meatball appetizer, cauliflower and seasonal vegetable salad. They messed up our order by putting cheese on each of the three items we ordered without cheese. Service is good. Food was tasty but not must return memorable.

urt_yS8Xiad0G5nbmO_tdA.text: Everything I've tried here was delicious. But you must try the short rib radiatori! The short rib literally melts in your mouth.

1AJjbeCaXjaRi7MJ9IqZoQ.text: Stopped by for bar appetizers and ended up staying for dinner. The chicken perm was amazing. The bartender, Marie was as efficient and friendly as she is beautiful. The food and service were top notch and I think this is the best Italian I've found in the Summerlin area.

fDdSF92UqDIhTRUDRXlD9A.text: I typically do not like to write bad reviews especially only after one visit and this was no different.   We gave it another shot and I have to say I'm done.   Love the location, ambiance and vibe, however the food is only worthy of two stars at best.  The portions were small, not so tasty and overpriced.  It's totally possible we went on bad days so if your a gambling person give it a try.     Being a married man with two teen kids the bar scene is not for me, however I would recommend the singles crowd give it a try.  Don't think you can go wrong with alcohol.

X0OM3bf2VdXyrEmw_rnPEQ.text: Ambience and decor is nice! Like Pottery Barn next door threw up in here - I love it.   We came for brunch on a Saturday and were seated right away. Our table shared the chef's board which was amazing. Great starter. And in fact, my favorite dish today. We each ordered something different to have a taste of everything.   The squid ink mafaldine was delicious. Wish it was real squid ink sauce but handmade pasta will do too. The sauce was flavorful, slightly spicy, and more water than saucy.  The Bolognese has had great reviews on here and was recommended by friends. Though it was tasty, I thought it would be better. Maybe all the hype just got to me. Don't get me wrong, the dish was great. But I want to say I've tried better!  The strozzapreti was a pleasant surprise. I totally wasn't going to order it, but my friend did. The truffle flavor was perfect. Just enough salty and savory to do the trick.   The Today's Omelette was also yummy. The crispy potatoes were a hit! Along with the truffle bread. I didn't have too much of this dish but my husband enjoyed it.   And of course, all the pastas were perfectly cooked.   There's so much I want to come back to try. Though brunch ended up pretty expensive, round 1 here turned out great! Definitely coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6hdfg1AouD_GuikJlqLBCg.text: We really enjoyed our dining experience-- seated promptly on a busy Tuesday night in the dining room.  Inquired about HH- it is honored throughout the restaurant until 6pm. Had to go with the Board n Wine for $20. Delicious!   Manager came over early as she heard it was our first time there.  Wine glass was never empty and Pig pizza as the main was great. Service was terrific.  We always tip on regular pricing during happy hour and our server deserved every penny :) We left full and happy and look forward to going back soon!

TtbDJDyvObpxFp6Uc0vjdw.text: Beautiful place with nice people and nice service (Mathew was great and accommodating).  Food was good, very flavorful, little salty and greasy.   Pizza was awesome, pasta was rich in flavor and pine nuts!   Tiramisu was a winner.   We will be back. For sure.

oVbvGSW3tKZdANiB3_JUWg.text: They really need to work on the service and food. They have the atmosphere and the location but the rest needs huge improvement.  This is industry city and the bar is pretty high.  I've visited the place 4-5 times for the past several months and I waited for improvements since they just opened.  Do not expect anything if you visit later at night like pass 9:30. 1-2 servers running around between the patio and inside while you have 3 bartenders. Just need some organization and consistent management with experience, not some 25 yo.  Food quality and options are another issue here. The menu has 30ish items max between apps salad and main.   I hope they work harder and improve it

MOPNyPUii8FdDu1t0DcJhw.text: Huge disappointment! This used to be one of my favorite restaurants in town. Have been there at least 10 times and the last three (including last night), have led to my decision to not go back. The server did his best but as with the two times before, the kitchen was backed up. It took almost an hour to just get our salads and another 45 mins after that to get our meals. Out of 5 meals, 3 were cold and one had a hair in the chicken.

GrJjlbQsifAW1VcmnUAO4Q.text: The restaurant is very spacious and the decor is beautiful. Every dish we had was cooked to perfection. Our server was very welcoming and attentive. Bottles of wine were half off which was nice. They also bring warm bread and olive oil and balsamic vinegar to the table. There is also a brunch menu if you are not looking to eat pasta or pizza. Def. Need to come back to try the ink pasta!!

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bruchetta

SJwRTMcXCpz9dbnsncwEqg.text: Calamari , the cheese board, spaghetti & meat balls, Margherita  pizza, doughnuts, ice cream , coffee are the items on their menu that I've tried. If I had to pick 1 I would do the calamari. I will definitely return to this spot when I get in the mood for Italian. I love the fireplace out in the patio.  I love patios but that just me.

jK4keY2l9eRMWoI8ecg9gw.text: Liked it so much, we've been back several times since our first experience with NI when it opened. The food is AMAZING and for the most part the service has been great.

JvnxniXIX-9Jwco8e7yC5w.text: I loved the atmosphere and zucchini fries were perfect!  I ordered grilled cauliflower. It was amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yAXo0x_yJOeyly7sTDJA0A.text: My totally favorite Italian restaurant ever ! They are always helpful with my diet , always making amazing spaghetti from zucchini and sweet potato , topped with nice sauce and meet balls on top. Always respectful to my requirements and allergies. I even had my wedding lunch there and it was nice , cosy , warm and friendly ! Thank you North Italia , you have loyal customer for long time ! See u soon !

MHtJ94BSBDTsinn8re-o6Q.text: Seriously one of the best venues on the West side! Was a little concerned after reading some of the reviews regarding the slow/bad service, especially since we were going on a Saturday night,  but we took a chance and are so glad we did!   5-star food, service, ambiance and plentiful parking to boot. Our server, Keith was friendly, fun and efficient. The whole team worked together to take care of all of the guests (not just their own tables)  and made our dining experience (as well as the tables around us) a fabulous one.    The food ... what can we say .. DELICIOUS!! Large portions, very reasonably priced. Everything we tasted (Calamari, Chicken Pesto, Salted Caramel Budino) was great and we will definitely be back .. a lot!

PngqX5DnhORE9__popUFUA.text: This place is a great family spot. The food is excellent and even during their busy time of the evening our waitress was extremely attentive and the rest of the staff we teaming up with her to provide an enjoyable dinner. They're were 13 of us and 4 of them were kids. Dinner out can get stressful at times with kids in tow but they sure did made it a great night for us all .

6BW1exljNp5Yyk2zViOL9A.text: Great pasta The pizza dough isn't my favorite I wouldn't order pizza again there but the bolanese sauce is 5 star  Good hip new place

kjfPjuXWa1X4x1gCz_gdQQ.text: My wife and I tried this restaurant tonight to celebrate our 23 Anniversary. This is my new favorite restaurant in the Summerlin area. We ordered the bruschetta with tomato off of the happy hour menu. The house made ricotta and tomato jam were awesome. We ordered another after we ate the first.  My wife ordered the chicken pasta strozzapreti . The pasta Was house made and very flavorful. The pasta had mushrooms and pine nuts in it. I had the short ribs with polenta. That dish was out of this world. We finished with the salted caramel Budino. The portion sizes were perfect, our server was awesome. We will be back very soon.

kOVf3xbg3jMS4nOALgsFcQ.text: I was craving some pasta and North Italia definitely satisfied my craving. We couldn't decide between the piglet pizza and the house specialty, bolognese. So we had both and shared. Best decision ever! The pizza was delicious and crispy, while the pasta was filling and flavorful.   If you're in Vegas, reroute from the strip and give North Italia a try.

Ol30uxml-IfrKgUpt8aDUw.text: Probably one of the best Italian places in Vegas. There was a little bit of a wait but that's to be expected of a popular restaurant like this. Service was excellent. Our server Leonard was awesome. Quick and polite. His recommendations were on point af. I will DEFINITELY be coming back!

aaWZhKUjIKfupAf-jeDyyg.text: I was excited to try this place but was disappointed with the whole experience. Service was slow - the bus boy finally came over, apologized for my waiter being busy and brought me water. I was underwhelmed by the menu but ordered the bacon and egg pizza. It was ok but lacked flavor. I doubt I will go back.

xUK5HPHNMYH-icIGVFYySA.text: Great food! Great ambiance! Service needs help but giving them the benefit of the doubt due to being relatively new still.

_2TuT6Hrj96KHaaL4ldipg.text: good first experience ...great food.. good prices...  for ko wait make reservations... great drinks.. good atmosphere ... def coming back.

-YQRBC2Y342NGHXsD2Yk5Q.text: We needed a place like this! Great pizza too! Quality Italian food and amazing service

_Hxb7MHYkJkTK83x4aYrug.text: Great new restaurant. I am forgiving of new restaurants as they work out glitches. The food is fresh and delicious, the service great, thank you both Oscars. I wanted  to take  a group of people here and called ahead several days ago to see when they could accommodate a party of 8. When I arrived tonight, my 6:30 reservation was booked for 8:30. David immediately stepped in to right the situation. It was customer service at its finest. Great restaurant with top notch customer service. Highly recommend!

Sx02dp1vVZ7Kmy-lS97yxA.text: It suits the chicken parm was so undercooked and their pasta was so salty as well as their pizza. Don't go there don't recommend it

WAlRmwDAFlY_QQ0X8zc9fA.text: Everything was great food and service. The issue is I sat down at 7:42 and didn't leave the restaurant till 9:40. The food took so long to go out. They made up for it with how good it taste but no one should ever have to wait that long for food to come out

uIjVPt6eW46jf_g12v3vTA.text: First off! The handmade pasta is ridiculous. The apps were great, didn't get a chance to try pizza but I do think the pasta is the star. Small menu of pizza and pasta but willing to adjust to your needs! Good wine list. Modern environment and open kitchen! Will be back.

coB4vS3vChmX9FH43mq3qg.text: We liked  the food the ambiance and our server Gerardo was amazing!  We will definitely be back!

eS1bezw-gcxo-PS7itcWQA.text: Our food was amazing and sent out quick.  Jaz our server paid attention to even the smallest of details and was very courteous and friendly. My friends and I will be back often.

OLHFn0dFCYQaF7BgCnwLEA.text: Went here with some good friends on a busy Saturday night. Very energetic vibe, great food, and even better service. Gianna is the best. We will definitely be back and will ask for her when we return.

EbVmk5pVQIiHv0zxHYKSgA.text: its always nice when manager/owner  takes care of the specific issue  , we wish this guys buona fortuna!

iczZE7hydvqbPzMpYO_UnQ.text: Have been to this place twice already once for lunch and once for brunch. It was amazing both times!!! The food comes out piping hot!!! Chicken parm was delicious, the breakfast sandwich was tasty, nothing beats their truffle oil bread with ricotta butter!!! So yummy. The waitresses were consistent and friendly! Would def recommend for a great lunch or dinner date!

xmUKJE6HQcMLb9kJb_8VYg.text: Omg please stop!! This place is a train wreck. From the moment we arrived we were told Five minute wait which turned out to be a 20 minute wait. Then we were seated at a table and we proceeded to order a glass of wine. The glass of wine had a object in the glass which looked like a critter but we were told it was sediment. We're also asked if that made us uncomfortable that they would give us another glass instead. Then the calamari came that we ordered and it was smothered in a bed of arugula salad to hide the fact that there were only a few pieces of calamari . We ordered a Caesar salad since we were told this place is like a French restaurant which uses only the freshest ingredients in their salad dressings and their fresh pasta (repeated each time a new customer arrived #annoying) when the salad arrived  we had just started eating it when our pastas was delivered. No one seemed to care as the wait staff seemed to be very unorganized and ill trained. As we started to eat the pasta we realized that both of our dishes which were separate dishes I order the squid ink pasta which came with the smallest over cooked shrimp (reallly) and my husband ordered the chicken pasta dish with the cream sauce. Both dishes had a Marie Callender feel to it nothing felt homemade and there was absolutely no flavor to it!!! Remember when you go to this restaurant that there is no bread served at the table and there is absolutely no ambience to the place. I had not touched my pasta dish but I was asked if I needed a box. They immediately sent over a small McDonald's burger Styrofoam boxes and we were to put our own leftovers in our boxes and walk away sans a bag. Having lived in Vegas for over 25 years this is probably the worst place we've ever been to. If you want some really good authentic Italian food go to Marks Tratoria which is not a food chain it is a local place with real fresh pasta and no one ever says is like a French restaurant. PS overpriced food that is served Luke warm.

ARO5JZ7XsHALeu5_EPG-PA.text: The food was outstanding! Started with the calamari which is to die for then the classic chicken parmigiana with the fresh pasta and ended with the salted caramel budino. Every last bit was pure heaven. This is a must for anyone in Vegas.

AXi7BVfIECcTiwmh2rUxIg.text: My wife had been wanting to try this place so we went for an early Mother's Day dinner with our young daughter.  We made a reservation and were seated within a few minutes of arriving.  The hostess was very nice and gave us a couple recommendations as we were being seated.  The place is a little loud but nothing new for Vegas restaurants and the decor is pretty cool.  We ordered our appetizer and drinks first and took a little time deciding on the main course.  After we ordered our main course it seemed like everything went into warp speed.  Our appetizer came out about 30 seconds before our main courses which we did not appreciate.  Our waitress would disappear for long stretches at a time.  I was never asked if I wanted another beer or if my wife wanted another drink and our waters were refilled once at the at the beginning of the meal and they went empty after that.  The next time the waitress came by she started picking up plates that still had food on them that we were still eating and we had to tell her to stop and put them back.  Talk about feeling rushed to get us out of there on a night where we just wanted to relax and enjoy a little family time.  The unfortunate thing is that we did enjoy the food, I had spaghetti and meatballs, the wife had pesto pasta and my daughter had a kids pizza, but the poor service and the feeling of being rushed put a damper on the night.  Its pretty bad when you feel like the server could care less about your dining experience at their restaurant and just wanted to turn the table.  As I said earlier we did like the food but it will be a while before we go back again if we do, too many other places to go with much much better service and dining experience.  It is very unfortunate because we did like the food and the atmosphere.

qIFpBd8oSWY68TiBSflYcg.text: My friend and I came in today. I'd seen reviews for this place on Yelp and convinced him to try it. It was a Tuesday mid-afternoon so not too busy. The hostess was super friendly, the ambiance was nice-not stuffy. The outdoor patio looked super inviting and cozy. We opted to sit inside because it was windy and chilly. Our server (I wish I remembered her name) came straight over and took our drink orders. She was friendly and gave us several suggestions throughout our meal. I wanted to try both pizza and pasta, so My firiend and I ordered a pizza to share to start and each ordered our own pasta dish. We chose the Pig pizza-pepperoni, sausage and soppressata. It came out quickly and was hot and delicious! The crust was perfect and the sauce just right. The pepperoni had some heat to it. It was perfect. My friend even said that it was the best pizza he'd ever had. Next, we decided to order some calamari. It came on a bed of arugula with a lemony vinaigrette on top. It was perfectly cooked. Crispy on the outside and tender inside. Yum! We ordered our pasta (even though at this time we were getting stuffed!).  I ordered their specialty the Bolognese and my friend ordered the Strozzapretti pasta. They were both outstanding. We decided that we needed to try the dessert, so we both had a couple bites of our pastas and decided to box the leftovers. Our sweet waitress suggested the Budino for dessert (a salted caramel pudding like dessert). Wow! It was amazing. I was tempted to lick the jar but held back. Lol! All in all, it was an excellent meal and we both agreed that we would be coming back soon!

PDpsUPinryp-hZnMqtfggQ.text: I went there Saturday night with my wife and 3 granddaughters for the first time.  Very disappointing !!!  After placing our orders I noticed that the waitress made no attempt to bring any bread to the table.  I finally asked our server if bread was available and she said yes and brought some over.  5 pieces of bread for the 5 of us.  Gee thanks.  After we finished our bread she came over and removed the bread plates and "NEVER" OFFERED TO ASK IF WE WANTED MORE BREAD".  THIS IS AN ITALIAN RESTAURANT, RIGHT? Bread at an Italian restaurant is part of the eating experience.  I can only imagine that she was following some restaurant protocol where bread is not offered unless asked for and then give as little as possible in order to keep costs down.  But wait it gets better.  When our meals arrived my granddaughters portions of their kids meals were BIGGER than my wife's and my dinner portions.  My wife's $25.00 order of scallops consisted of 3 half-dollar size scallops,  3 tiny pieces of squash that could fit on a spoon, and maybe a half cup of risotto.  My Bolognese pasta dinner, the restaurant's signature dish, more closely resembled a side of pasta you might get somewhere else.  We were done eating before our granddaughters.  The funny part about the whole meal is that on the menu there is a section called "small plates".  Since my "main course" was so small I can only imagine that the small plates must come with a magnifying glass.  There is a restaurant a few doors down from this one called "Honey Salt" WHERE YOU CAN GET A MUCH BETTER EXPERIENCE AND THEY BRING AS MUCH BREAD AS YOU WANT... WITHOUT ASKING !!!

0R3cIrHaAZp_MDYqAS64TQ.text: We (2 of us) went on a Friday night and it was packed. It was a 30 minutes wait, which isn't terrible so we stayed. Usually when we wait we go and grab a drink but after standing at the bar for what seemed like an uncomfortable amount of time with no one acknowledging us we gave up and went to wait outside. We asked a few of the hostesses if there was a way someone was able to get us a drink while we wait and she said our only option was to wait at the bar. We had already tried that with no luck. There was quite a few empty tables so I wasn't sure why there was a wait. After the drink situation I wanted to leave but I knew my boyfriend had wanted to come here for awhile so we stayed. I noticed that a lot of people that came after us got seated before us. I was getting pretty upset but I thought maybe it was due to them having reservations. I was going to get up and ask but then we were seated. Obviously so far my experience wasn't the best but the reason I still gave it 4 stars is because I thought the service, once we sat down was so great! The entire staff works so well together! I've never been to a restaurant where everyone helps each other out the way that they did. Everyone was very nice. Our server was Laura (that's what the bill said so I hope that's correct) and she was great! Always up-selling (which worked!) and she did her job so well. Never got overwhelmed with it being so busy so definitely give some props to her! The restaurant itself is really pretty, trendy. Food was good. Overall, I would come back and I would recommend to friends but if you can, definitely make a reservation or go on a weekday.

V8qzkEcsBuA_KmDiXTi2Fw.text: Hostess was overwhelmed when I entered the restaurant at 11:45am. She was taking a carry-out order from a lady standing in front of me, then she answered the phone and promptly asked them to hold, and then explained that they would be on hold for approximately five minutes as she was "busy". A group of ladies entered and approached her to say they had reservations, and she asked them to wait so she could assist me since I was next in line. I noticed the hostess area was consistently packed with people "waiting" to be seated, throughout my lunch. Clearly, backup is needed! The food and drinks were all tasty: Milano Mule cocktail, Acqua Pana Water, a non-alcoholic  cocktail, an espresso, kale soup, caesar salad, calamari, and tiramisu dessert. Unfortunately, a hair was found in the caesar halfway through lunch. The waitress apologized and offered a new caesar salad, which we declined. Then the manager/supervisor on-duty came to our table to apologize and again offer a new salad. Which we politely accepted the apology and declined the replacement salad. I suspect most people decline a replacement due to the feeling of nausea caused by finding a hair in the meal. Overall, there seems to be some kinks that need to be worked out. Please insist on hairnets during all food-prep activity. Hygiene is imperative.

o_sV1BfgfI43NMwZ4Hctsg.text: I have dined here twice and love the atmosphere and the decor.  Service was good.  Busy little place with a lot of help shuffling around. Food not so much.  We had the hamburger which was cooked to perfection but not liking the taste.  May have been the tomato jam.  Asked for the potatoes for my side and they mistakenly brought a green salad. Took a while to get the exchange but let me tell you they were good. Smashed pieces of potato cooked to a slight crisp, salty and with fresh Parmesan cheese sprinkled on top. The bacon and egg pizza was different but not something I wouldn't crave to come back for.  Second trip the Italian farm salad was oh so good. Pieces of greens, meat and goodies cut to just the right sizes and the dressing was fantastic.  It was a rainy day and I was looking for something comforting so we ordered the meatball sandwich. Didn't hit the spot. Got those scrumptious potatoes again. The Margherita pizza was kind of plain. You would think with a simple pizza you would have tomato on this pizza. Sauce just didn't do it.  Even to try the happy hour looking a bit limited.

cgBowo1H2N2RFpQdpImL3A.text: excellent.. neighborhood place.. seriously delicious.. go.. enjoy.. we will return soon.

RHXEjOMxJHw2gHvTCZw4UA.text: Nice atmosphere and solid food. Didn't know we walked in during happy hour so got a bottle of wine for half off! However it took over 10 min for it to get to the table. Hospitable staff

pW6bLdGjXFQpEGa6WhKRbw.text: First time in & me and my husband had a great evening. First we enjoyed the truffle bread it is to die for! We decided to try the house made pasta . The tortelloni and bolognese was amazing. Our server Chelsea helped us navigate through the menu and pair the Barolo with our pasta dishes . Also the tart for dessert was scrumptious. She was one of the best servers we've ever had! If you come to north Italia ask for Chelsea !

0SHOmhZEVpzYtS0RiSGi_g.text: Amazing food, ambiance, and staff. Some of the freshest and tastiest Italian food around. Don't expect your classic mom and pop Italian restaurant. The calamari is amazing!

dLKbBgbFTW71tMEgOzGf1w.text: When sitting at the bar at 6pm on a Tuesday, it was moderately busy. The barback after about 10 mins came over, threw down 2 menus for me and a friend, and walked off. Not even a "how are you, I'll be right with you".  10 more mins go by, both bartender and barback continue to walk by us, serving others and making drink tickets. I had to interrupt him and ask for 2 draft beers. It seemed to be a bother to him. After we had sat there for 20 minutes.  I had to ask someone to order, I had to ask for each beer while they continuously provided horrible service, even had to ask for my tab, a togo box.   Ordered a pig pizza to start, waited 15 mins then ordered 2 pasta dishes. It all came out at the same t  Not one single time were we asked did we need anything, how was the food, etc. And we're right in front of you. Me and a friend, $100 tab with the worst service I've had in Vegas. Won't be back.   The food was good, service was horrible.   Update: Food was great, great atmosphere. Not too busy for 5pm Friday. Happy hour On Friday's should be implemented, but understood why not. Beers are nice and delicious!

PRL3xyfuC_0vtZwGOGIoZQ.text: This is a great restaurant with awesome services and prices.  The food is really good and we will definitely be coming back for more.    It's conveniently located in the Boca Park shopping center on Charleston and Rampart.  If you like Italian food that will keep you wanting more then check this place out.

9mb5JGXMgXb4cu98cvpfNA.text: Yes! The 5 stars speaks for itself. Trust those who review it as such. Kale-potato-sausage soup-amazing! Crispy calamari with arugula - spectacular! A1DysSuxN780EhDCqtXm4A.text: We were so excited to try this place because we had just come back from our honeymoon in Italy and we were looking for an authentic Italian restaurant back home. This place is legit. Their cocktails are very delicious. Their chefs board was a delicious little taste of everything and you must ask for extra apricot pepper jelly! It tastes amazing on anything! Their bolognese was very True to what we had in Italy. Another must try is the short rib radiatori. I've never had a white creamy pasta with fresh horseradish on it! Completely new, crazy, amazing flavor! It was a long wait for the food and drinks, but the place was crazy busy and the food definitely made up for the waiting.

QTdRq0GxDF0PbBgNJTh6Hg.text: I heard a lot of good stuff about this restaurant so I decided to go try it for lunch. The restaurant setup is really nice, the service was good, but I was really disappointed from the portion and the shrimp for the dish I ordered. I had the squid ink pasta, it comes with Calamari and shrimp. I checked the pictures of that dish on yelp before I ordered, and everything looked the way I wanted it. The flavor was delicious but the portion I thought was little plus the shrimp doesn't suit the recipe, since they used the smallest size shrimp. That shrimp could be bait for fish! I was really disappointed when I saw the shrimp, and I compared my dish with the pics on yelp, it doesn't look the same. I was really excited about the restaurant.l, but I will not go back. I gave 2 stars for the ambiance and taste.

w2FxVwMhQH2cZSlXcVND-w.text: Amazing happy hour, decor is on point!! And we have an amazing time. Pizza is on of the best styles in vegas

X7REub1wEmNS9OoPyEzvxA.text: I had the pepperoni personal pizza and it was pretty good. I can't say that it was the best pizza ever but it wasn't bad and it's suppose to be a healthier option for those looking for that. It's still pizza so it's not  super healthy but it was good. I believe in everyone trying and forming there own opinion so y'all should try it.

JytMIS8zJsgQzSHBksRuGg.text: Excellent!  I was a little nervous walking up to this place. We were starving. It was jam packed. And, I was sure we would have a crazy long wait. I was wrong. We were greeted and seated right away.  The restaurant was clean & bright with a bit of that industrial feel. Our server, Tyler, came over right away and took our drink order. We weren't given any kind or bread or anything. I don't know if it was a fluke or if this is something they just don't do. Our drinks took a bit of time to arrive. Not long enough that we were getting upset, but long enough to notice it. I felt like this wasn't because the service was lacking, but more a result of how busy they were.  We had planned to order pizza, but other menu items had us at hello so we opted for 2 entrees. My husband ordered the Bolognese ($18) and subbed  Rigatoni. I opted for the Red Wine Braised Short Ribs ($26). Both were excellent! The Short ribs we flavorful & tender. Served with Marscarpone Polenta, Swiss Chard, Carrots, & Fingerling Potatoes. The accompaniments were as delicious as the ribs themselves. I'm not a huge polenta fan, but this dish made me want to lick my plate!  For dessert, we had the Bombolini ($7) which are served with a vanilla anglais & lemon curd.  Again, not a dish I would normally gravitate to, but it was calling to me and I'm glad it did. These little donuts were light and lovely. The perfect happy ending to our meal.  I'm already planning my next visit to North Italia! I am excited to try some of their pizzas, especially the Prosciutto w/ fig & goat cheese and the Bacon & Egg w/ roasted potato, garlic confit, & rosemary. I'm, also, looking forward to the Zucca Chips & the Arancini.  North Italia has a great vibe. The food is excellent & service is laid back and friendly. They are in a great location, and clearly the word is out! My biggest complaint about this place is that it is WAY across town for me so I can't go nearly as often as I would like.

Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4PzjPGcIbUbc2Vndo31mvQ.text: This place was so good! Came here to celebrate my friend's birthday and the overall experience went very well. We did not make reservation but the wait was not long at all for how packed they were. Our waitress was awesome! So friendly and informative, the whole wait staff was very attentive, drinks were constantly re-filled, food came out quick, dirty plates were promptly picked up, no complaints regarding service at all.   We started out with a few appetizers cuz friends were hangry! Grilled artichoke was good, dipping sauce was bomb! Garlic and truffle bread...need I say more? Must try. Grilled cauliflower was average, I didn't think it was worth $12, it was very sour and didn't have much flavor other than that.   Now the pastas...so so good! I got strozzapreti and even though my stomach was full my mouth wanted more! I never had pasta shaped like that also so it was a fun little surprise, the flavor was awesome, so cheesy but not overwhelming, great pasta dish! My friends got tortelloni and bolognese and both were delicious!   For dessert we got cheesecake, tiramisu and donuts and oh my lord! All were very good but the tiramisu was my favorite! It was one of the best tiramisu i have had in a long time!  Definitely recommend this place for date night or casual hang out. Nice vibe, lovely open kitchen concept, modern decor, and delicious food!

nAtMsRWDH37FSAliPdkVdQ.text: I really wanted to give this place 5 stars, however the service fell short of my expectations. The food was good, but not fantastic.   The waitress was cheerful and upbeat. She didn't waste anytime wanting to fire up my order. Within 2 minutes from sitting down, I was greeted, menu was explained, and asked if I wanted a drink! No time to look over the cocktail menu, the waitress just stood there looking at me. Iced tea came to mind so she could just leave! Iced tea came, but no sugar or anything.  I asked for recommendations for small plates, but she was all over the place with her suggestions. I went with my original order of burrata and squid ink pasta.  I was observing the male waiter who was attending a couple in front of me as I waiting for my food. His service was on point! Straws for beverages, water to start off, bread and butter, etc...when I compared that waiter to mine, she should have been a runner.    The food was great, the service was off.

LQ6GTV27UVmnHMaRzuqeZg.text: Excellent food but mediocre service. Very busy restaurant but from the time we were seated until the time we were acknowledged by waitstaff was almost 10 minutes. I will definitely go back but I expect an improvement in service.

VNJNx3xWBanJ-rrnCYKENg.text: Amazing food & service.  Such a cute and quaint restaurant.  The hostesses were so welcoming and friendly.  Makes all the difference when you enter and it sets the tone.  Terrific training.    The Chefs Board, Kale Salad, House Speciality - Bolognese was spectacular as was the Calamari & Shrimp Squid Ink Pasta.  Phenomenal, efficient, attentive and warm service by Gabriel.    The Bomboloni and the Affogato were also fabulous.   A great addition to the area mall.  Thank you for a wonderful lunch.  We will be back.

TGrsBg60-wpFRy0N0sBPKw.text: Cute place for Italian food. Quality food without the hefty price tag. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Order the mussels, crispy calamari, arancini  balls, pepperoni pizza, bolognese, squid ink pasta. Mussels were a nice light broth. I asked for Squid ink pasta not to be spicy and it was very delicious, not too heavy on the cream sauce either. The crispy calamari seem to be fried in old oil as it came out a tad dark. The pizza was very greasy. Half of my crust was trenched in the grease which I wasn't pleased with ......I would recommend this place and will come back and try other food on the menu.

OWmJ-dtCI1evn6wEQ6df0A.text: Tried this place tonight and it's a great date night spot. Definitely had a good vibe going on. The place was packed but didn't take long for us to get seated.   The food was good but nothing was spectacular. Their calamari was to bready but the addition of the arugula was nice. We also ordered the zucchini chips and truffle garlic bread which were both good as well.   For my entree I tried the squid ink pasta which was tasty but not the flavor that I was looking for. It was Spicy which I like, but it overpowered any of the seafood flavor that I was looking for. My husband had the chicken parm which he liked. It came with Alfredo rigatoni which was a little different from the usual red sauce pasta that it usually comes with. The portions are bigger than Ithey look like in the pictures. Definitely enough to fill the belly. Oh and they have local beers on tap which I thought was a nice touch.   Would probably come back for a nice friends dinner.
