E5URfNaz4GAkOjVJl8oknQ.text: North Italia is a locals Summerlin spot for solid Italian food and a hefty number of "adult beverages", to include imaginative twists on the same, such as a "white sangria," which is not even on the menu--you have to ask for it. You're welcome.  But we came strictly for the food. Sunday night family dinner. The offerings are good. The dishes range from the elegant, a Branzino with white pearl onions and broccolini to the more casual, a mushroom ('funghi') pizza. There are meatballs for an appetizer, as well as calamari, and salads. Even though the menu is not especially large (a welcome change), you should be able to find something you enjoy on the menu, whether vegan, vegetarian, pescatarian, or good old-fashioned carnivore.  We thought the salad was very good. I have forgotten the name, unfortunately, but it did have pine nuts if that is any help. (And I might have a photo of it). It veered a teeny tiny bit into the "overdressed," category, but that's quite alright. It's like someone wearing a sundress to a backyard barbecue. ~~ Perhaps it might have been a little better to have just come in jeans, but you're not going to kick someone out for that, and besides the effort is appreciated.  The other dishes didn't wow us. The meatballs in the appetizer were fine, but a little bit underseasoned and a tiny bit dry. The sauce they were in was splendid, though. Chunky and rich, fully ripened tomatoes, that seemed almost homemade. A little salt did it right up!  The pasta bolognese was bland, sadly.  The meat was imperceptible. The fish was cooked fine, but could have used more acid (in the form of lemon or whatever). Branzino is not an oily fish but with the olive oil added to the dish (which was fine), it needs something to break it up.   The desserts were 50-50: Tiramisu and the Gelato/Sorbetto were ECCELENTE! The tiramisu came with these little chocolate bead balls (that taste a little like Kit-Kats) that really add to the traditional dessert.  The Salted Caramel Budino and the Hazelnut Torta were just cosi-cosi, in our opinion.  The former was too sticky and sweet, and the latter was too dry and sweet. (And the little chocolate beads were not enough to save it).  All of the desserts come in a very unattractive wanna-be Mason Jar, that's not a Mason jar...in a wide jar/cup reminiscent of a plastic cup you might get at a cheap cocktail party or a frat party.  Our tiramisu had some paper receipt underneath it and then a saucer.  Very weird.    Speaking of which...  We found a piece of gum wrapped in plastic and sticking out of the bouquet when we sat down. We noticed it immediately, but didn't say anything. We of course expected someone to remove it, but nah, that didn't happen. Eventually, we pointed it out to one of the servers (we seemed to have a couple, in addition to our main one, a very nice young woman), and she cleared it away. But can we say, "Gross?" And a little inattentive to detail on their part. A clean table is a must. So a little more attention to details would go a long way.  On a positive note, the decor is hip, modern, and unimpeachable.  The idea of an indoor-outdoor kitchen is smart and worth a visit in itself.  I hear they have a good Happy Hour. Might return to try some of the plates again then.

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemon sorbet and Raspberry gelato-yes.
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Budino...not so much.
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiramisu brings its A-Game.

ccbGn9mhK6ziSilfyBRwvA.text: My friend and I came here on the recommendation of a friend who knows eating out very well. I had never heard of North Italia before but they have 13 locations, three of which are in Southern California....oops. Anyhoo, North Italia is located in an extremely busy strip mall off of Rampart. The interior is very cool. The bar separates the inside & outside and you can see into the kitchen through the glass. One thing I have to warn you about is that it gets extremely loud inside the restaurant. Like, by far the loudest restaurant I've ever been in. If you take someone here on a date, you might take this into consideration beforehand.  We started our meal with the prosciutto bruschetta and it was phenomenal. The grilled asparagus they put on it makes for something different but very good. For the main, I went with old dependable. The chicken parmesan. And boy, it's a lot of food. You get two good size cutlets and a side of parmesan rigatoni. Everything was perfectly cooked and the combination of the intense flavor of the chicken with the more easy going rigatoni was just right. Like fire and ice.   Service was very good. Our waitress was very knowledgeable about both the menu and the drink menu as my friend put her through the paces regarding their wines. Beer selection is also great. Lots of local and non-local craft goodies for your palate. Also, be aware there will be a wait on peak days. I went on a Thursday evening and there was a line outside the door. If you're looking for a place to eat with friends with tasty food and a pretty fun atmosphere, North Italia is a great choice. Whether I'm in Vegas or in So Cal, it's an option I won't say no to.

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken parmesan with rigatoni $20

9FgSRNOzOpwcRxWQV_cz7A.text: I've been looking for a really good Italian restaurant for a while and we came here for restaurant week. It was absolutely amazing... we were seriously impressed with the quality of food. I wish my love and I would have taken our servers recommendation for the chicken parmesan because it was so tender and delicious! We order the bolognese it was good but I've had better. The chicken parmesan was something else... I haven't had one that good. It's a must try and all the appetizers we ordered were all so good! The ambiance was really nice! The patio is beautiful and the interior is quaint with large Edison bulbs around the restaurant. Another cool feature is the open kitchen watching all of the cooks in action. It gives you a sense of relief when you can see the cooks through the windows handling your food with care. Not that I'm ever worried, but it's kind of a cool feature. If you enjoy Italian food this is a no brainer go check out North Italia.

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salted Caramel Budino
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Arancini
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Parmesan

bFkK9Nu2QY1NEOu28swuHA.text: Have never been dissapointed!  Food is amazing! Decent selection of wine and at good prices. Friendly staff.

sHzqwavmFRX9ElhWsXEsKA.text: Flashback to my Italy visit! This place is awesome! My friend recommended this place for happy hour, which was from 3pm- 6pm, and our server recommended some delicious appetizers to start right when we got seated.   When we moved on to dinner, I had ordered the burger and my friends ordered two different kinds of pizza; margarita and I think the arugula pizza. We all shared, and everything was sooo good! We were so stuffed by the appetizers that we had a lot of dinner left over. And let me tell you... every bit of that left over was not going to be a waste!   The server was so nice, and if I only remembered her name I would give her a big shout out. All in all, I really enjoyed this place, and this was a really good place to catch up with friends.

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prosciutto Bruschetta
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy Calamari
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Burger*- Medium, grilled onion, arugula, mayo with lemon? And potato crisp on the side.

dE3BXIEphdWFyi33tKLW8w.text: We went at 3:45pm on a Monday and sat at the bar.  Lots of workers back and forth behind the bar, but it seemed only one person assisting people, so service took a long time.  We were given menus and ordered a couple of things.   The bruschetta was just ok, the chef's board was really skimpy with just a tiny amount of proscuitto and cheese on it.  The cauliflower was good, but the egg was way overcooked on top (rubbery and could barely cut it).  We were surprised when we got the bill that the items were not priced as happy hour - $18 for the chef's board was ridiculous for the amount of food on it!  Apparently, you have to order specifically stating the happy hour bruschetta and chef's board?!?  Would they have been smaller yet for a reduced price?  There are much better happy hours in town, so I suggest you skip this one.

RQE_2oy5aCdmLPOpGFWH7Q.text: I have been to North Italia a couple times and both times have been a good experience. There was no wait and we were able to be seated immediately. However, I went during the day on weekdays, so it may be different at night and on weekends. The service was great and the servers were very attentive. They were more than happy to explain the menu and the different drinks/wine they had.  Everything in the restaurant is fresh and made from scratch daily. The bolognese was my favorite! During happy hour (M-Thurs, 3-6 pm) you can also get a chefs board and a bottle of wine for only $20. Good quality food and good service. Will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The cutest chefs board!

KzB4cXXdnld_X1mw50rqjQ.text: This was my first time visiting the North in Las Vegas. I've frequented the location in Houston and I love it. The food was quite delicious. You can't go wrong with almost anything on the menu. I enjoyed the chicken pesto and my boyfriend had ??? I forgot but his was good too. The calamari is different than most because it's lightly breaded.   Ginger beer margarita by far my fave drink! Have fun!!

43hk4piOYhmkIxGwzW0Ovw.text: Ok, I'm going to say 4.5 stars.  The food was excellent.  We had the calamari, the zucca chips, the bruschetta, and the chef's board as apps, they were outstanding.  Add the happy hour wine and sangria.  The soup and Caesars salad were also very good.  The mains; branzino, short ribs, squid ink pasta, chicken parm, chicken pasta and short rib pasta were also excellent.  Desserts rounded out the great meal.   They lost the half star with sporadic service.  They were busy, but there were long waits at time between visits and an extended delay to get dessert and the check that were excessive.  Several times water and ice tea glasses remained empty for too long.  Overall, nice dining experience.

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chef&#39;s Board and Zucca Chips
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bruschetta

vtMGIeWBV2LP5j9pu-c48Q.text: North Italia is a place I haven't stopped talking about. The food is just so flavorful, fresh, classic yet modern, and CRAVE-ABLE! I am still dreaming of the bolognese.  The two bar tenders who are married are also my two favorite people in the world.  They have amazing red sangria AKA it actually tastes like wine and isn't overly sweet. I say just get a pitcher instead of a glass because YOLO.  I am a bruschetta hoe and I really liked their more savory version with prosciutto and asparagus. It was a very satisfying bite of food.  The pasta dish featuring pesto was also delicious. I love the strong basil taste. It wasn't overly oily and was very fresh tasting. You can tell by how vibrantly green it was that it's made fresh.   The bolognese sauce was just amazing. The pasta was just perfect. This pasta you can tell was made fresh. There's a time and place for fresh versus dried pasta and I just thought this was perfect. It wasn't overly cheesy. The cheese just helped the salt but main that deep meaty flavor of the bolognese was just one of the best pasta dishes I've had. No crazy extra things just a slow cooked well developed meat sauce.   I've had the affogato and the hazelnut dessert and they were both excellent ends to the meal.  Price was very fair for the food quality and my I can't make this at home factor lol  The space is open, bright, modern, and spacious. They don't have everyone crowded next to each other which I love. The bar seating is also great.   I always consider if I'd return to a place when deciding what I rate it and this place is a solid five. North is definitely in my top three favorite Italian restaurants in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sangria.
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I forgot what this is but it was amazing. Cake, ice cream, and brittle of some sort. Delicious.
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. One of their bruschetta offerings.

dXPPXqzaQ50u3QO0Yt_PJg.text: Loved everything about this place....from the moment I walked in until the time I left! I was greeted right away with a smile, which by the way I love!!!! I was seated rather quickly and my server came just minutes later to get my drink order. They have a decent happy hour menu but man the branzino fish is ah-mazing!!!! Seasoned perfectly and I can't wait to come again to try other things from the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FNxfLqVA0sOgvPibz971Dw.text: The ambience and service gets an A, but the food was average (and that's with some grade inflation). I would give an A+ but the tables were so close. It makes for an awkward intimate conversation.   I had their "BOLOGNESE (HOUSE SPECIALTY)" dish. It was fairly blah. For what they label a "house specialty" dish, I expected a bit more flavor.  My leftovers did heat up nicely the next day. And I even liked it more reheated. Maybe it was rushed in the kitchen and didn't have enough time to settle? I'm not a chef, so I have no clue. But it did taste better the next day.  Now I will tell you their Seasonal Vegetable salad was amazing. Started the meal with that and was so eager to try my main dish. But it fell flat. Maybe I had too high of expectations after the great salad?  Overall, I give this place a B---it's above average mostly for the lively space (although don't expect an intimate conversation).   I'd give it a second shot.

Upm3T9he_8VU4op8mnveZg.text: Great place for Sunday brunch! They have tons of food options like breakfast plates, pizzas, and traditional pasta dishes. They hand make all of their pasta and it is to die for. No bottomless mimosa specials, but all bottles are 50% off so you can get a bottle of Prosecco for $22 and ask for a carafe of orange juice for a few bucks. Service was great even with our group of 12 people!

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle garlic bread (AMAZING)
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prosciutto bruschetta
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short rib pasta

ayaHF3WAGm6PI46K-v57TA.text: North Italia is one of my favorite Italian restaurants here in Vegas. It has a great atmosphere, perfect for special occasions or even casual outings. Their unique and amazing food is amazing and the employees are so nice to me there. Did I mention a good price range? For places that are usually located in nicer areas with good food and atmosphere, the price is not too shabby (not too cheap but not rooftop high prices). I have to say there is nothing that I dislike here.  Here are a few of my favorite so far:   Appetizers:  Proscuitto bruschetta  Crispy Calamari   Pastas:  Squid ink mafaldine  strozzapreti  roasted mushroom tortellini

vPyi4yvKrxgsE_QknSvVnA.text: "I should really stop having high standards for restaurants that others have hyped up." This is what I thought after having dined at North Italia for the first time.  What we ordered...  Chef's Board: For someone who doesn't eat much meat and dairy, I was still able to pick off this board. The Marcona almonds, roasted peppers and marinated eggplant were delicious. My boyfriend loved all the meats.  Squid Ink Mafaldine: I enjoy spicy food but the spiciness of the Calabrian chili sauce was too overpowering, and I couldn't taste any of the other flavors.   Service...  The kitchen was busy and the food was taking longer to come out - not a problem, considering how busy it was. Plus, the manager and our waitress came by several times to check on our table and inform us on the status of our orders.   Other...  Words of advice: Make reservations in advance, especially on the weekends. This place was jam packed on a Friday evening. Also, be prepared for a noisy atmosphere and the possibility of having to yell over all the noise if you're dining with others.

vkB9dZJzsopQPhUNV-0uTQ.text: First time here and it was delicious! Had the scallops and were what I was hoping for full of flavor and perfectly cooked. My husband had the roasted chicken and it was a little on the dry side but full of flavor and our son had the a pasta with meat bolognese and didn't even see him take the first bite when he was done with it. The best part for me was the prosciutto bruschetta appetizer and the Italian donuts Meyer lemon curd. Last the margarita pizza was a hit. Service was excellent. Nothing bad to say. We'll definitely be back and tell our family and friends!

cCCdw0vTnAUzdNDDSI7TAw.text: Went here for dinner and had a fantastic evening. The restaurant is so nicely decorated and comfortable. We went on a Sunday where they were doing 50% bottles of wine so of course had to take them up on that!   Our server was so cute and informative so I ended up having:   PROSCIUTTO BRUSCHETTA        (crescenza cheese, grilled asparagus, truffle, grana padano) - sooo delicious I'm sad it's the only photo I took!    And   BACON & EGG PIZZA  grilled asparagus, roasted potato, garlic confit, rosemary I know it sounds gross but it was hand down one of the best pizzas I've had.  I will gladly drive from Green Valley to Summerlin and go back

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1mUSlRviC31Xjij_xrC9uw.text: Decided to give North another try! This time I opted for some quick take out. Very simple process just called up, and it was ready in about 15 minutes. I kept it simple, less carbs the better! Lol I know it's carb heaven, but a girls gotta do, what a girls gotta do.   I ordered the Cesar salad and the appetizer meatballs, last time they were really good so i figured I would just grab the same thing! They do give you free bread as well.   Meatballs were delicious and the fresh bread as well. I was a little disappointed in the Cesar dressing though, I do not remember it having such a fishy taste. Last time it had bit more of a garlicky taste, which was fabulous. I didn't get to indulge into it the way I had envisioned. Maybe it was just me, or maybe this is how they make it, which isn't to my liking, but I swear last time I was just perfect.   Still I do think I'll be back again, for another date night, or even girls night! I'll have to try the pizzas next!

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Neatly packed, and organized! Always a plus in my book!
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meatballs! So good! I recommend this appetizer to anyone, great portion size as well for two!
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Love this bread! I only took one bite, no carbs! LOL

h_DeagrXgui2gjzvA4l3zA.text: Okay.. so after several visits I give them three stars. But let me explain  Food: 5 stars We have tried several dishes and all have been full of flavor.. leaving you wanting to come back  Atmosphere: 5 Stars I mean who doesn't like covered outdoor dining options in Vegas?! This is a nice patio that flows thru the bar.. a few TVs for live sports at the bar and plenty of heaters for the winter  Service: 1 star The hostess seem to be more concerned doing their side work (making menus) than taking care of a paying customer. We were quoted 10 minutes for a patio table (the patio was empty).. meanwhile the hostess just made menus. This wait was all because someone needed to "make up" the table (salt, flowers, ect)  Our server was absent, and really inattentive to our dining experience. Lastly, the staff decided to retract the patio screens at 20 minutes before they closed.. ignoring that we were still eating! Guess we didn't want to finish the meal and have dessert in the ice cold..  We really love this place and hope our next experience is better

ci-FoqVQ5k_my8samELo-Q.text: HOMEMADE Typically, I don't get very excited about going to an Italian restaurant. Most cannot reproduce that homemade taste and quality. But NI comes very close! "From Scratch" is their motto and they live up to it. And as expected, the restaurant was packed. Great service. My only disappointment is you have to pay for bread though it is fancied up.

7BSNsY5w5G2fNYMpBuf7wg.text: My new FAVORITE place!! If you haven't gone to check it out, u need too! Can't wait to go back! I will definitely be a regular here! I recommend the chicken parmigiana or Bolognese.. both are amazing!

f1NljWK_Jn6DrbHH7uerUw.text: It took over 1 hour to get my pizza and this Irish looken guy yelling at people don't know who he was but didn't look right..won't go back..

g2SzpYuhVdY9-hXJlIgxNw.text: Went on a Saturday night -we were 5 people . Ordered the Arancini and meatballs -both tasty ,but small portions & served in cast iron tiny skillets ,which I didn't like to see. Ordered two pizzas-the sauce was raw & the dough was dry. Ordered two Chicken parms which were too thick & not enough sauce (asked for extra sauce which they did bring ,but the sauce was raw) also not enough cheese on the chicken Parmesan either & was served with rigatoni in a white cream sauce -that was tasty &  al Dente which was great, but small portioned . No bread on the table.  The vanilla gelato -one tiny melon ball  scoop ,it was ok ,not great . I wouldn't run back. Very noisy & not liking the too many high tables.  Reminds me of kona-more of a hang out & to be seen!

HT_7jI36AgwVswwfzmJXUg.text: Good food.  Terrible service.  Terrible service. Terrible service.  Noisy. Don't go there if you are over 30, because you will be the only one!  They made so many mistakes on our orders, they comped us a bowl of soup.   They tried to be nice, but they were just overwhelmed with too many people and a kitchen that is not yet operating like seasoned professionals.

xNwEActZKKqszPbG1MJEiw.text: Excellent food and ambiance. I've been here twice and nice waiters and hostess but looks like Kitchen was overwhelmed for lunch crowd. Spent 2 hours for lunch but got there super early 1115am. I'd come back for sure - great food and vibe just need better execution for Kitchen speed but taste quality is top notched. Blows away CPK and Wolfgang Pucks in my opinion for all categories pricing, ambiance and food.

K_w0eO6rRH4Ed4jUnajoZQ.text: We had 6pm reservations (made over 2 weeks in advance). We did not get a table until 6:50. It took over an hour and a half to get our food and it did not come out together...the manager said they would take care of the appetizers (it didn't happen). We wound up paying and leaving after 9pm. Sad thing is the food is delicious and the wait staff was friendly... they need MAJOR HELP managing the kitchen. We will not be back.....

4Ekz7S2pwpFaAHmtUM4Thg.text: Tried this place on their second night of business and it was absolutely delicious. Enjoyed the traditional salad and the strozzapreti pasta - both wonderful. You can taste the freshness I love when a pasta has pine nuts and they actually put a lot of pine nuts in it. The service was excellent, our bartender Tacie was so knowledgeable and friendly. Even though the restaurant was busy, she was very focused on us. We inquired about brunch and she went and got us a menu and pointed out her favorite menu items. Can't wait to come back and try out more items.

8DtckiukRPYbFBZM2v68kQ.text: Definitely a must try if you're craving Italian. Recommend making a reservation as it is busy even on Sunday nights. Everything was delicious and tasty. Nice atmosphere with indoor and outdoor feel.

5qwsgbHDICUIrzzMX6zCRw.text: Love this place, food amazingly delicious. I highly recommend the baked French Toast, The wrap yummy yummy for breakfast ... for appetizer  Baked Mussels OMG. The squid ink pasta, Drooling.. Ok I need to stop now just writing this review makes me want to drive back to North lol...

XUKmDx12JvRjlmvtiXQ--w.text: I went for the first time Wednesday evening, beautiful restaurant with great atmosphere.  I sat at the bar and was pretty disappointed with the service- extremely slow  not personable or friendly.  To top it off bartender put my drinks on someone else's bill thinking we were together and then had to wait 20 minutes for them to fix it.

R0w90_e3kmYQin2tjAETZg.text: Loved the wine, the service, the salad, the soup, the energetic atmosphere, the pizza, the meatballs, the dessert -- loved it all. We just moved to this neighborhood and know we will be regulars!

RpaIPzTmzmlIV_gWIOMnUA.text: Came on a weekend and had the egg and bacon pizza, the bolognese pasta and the short rib alfredo pasta. Simply AMAZING! Good value and nice decor.

uULk4x3_2VnqPDW4KivKJA.text: This restaurant is amazing! The waiters are fenomenal and make you feel like home! In special Paulina ho I love her attention and attitude!!!! So the food OMG amazing True Italy!!!

NzPJRQhb-ZkH5QyJKb-F7Q.text: Service is so so so slow we ended up having a 2 hour lunch because we kept waiting....but the food is great.

nPqNeFatnOvrLKhMIly8ZQ.text: A friend highly  recommend this restaurant. We were seated and greeted by a friendly server.  We ordered and received our drinks and appetizer timely. However, our meal took over 45 minutes for a salad and  pesto chicken pasta dish.   The server was very apologetic and offered a free dessert.  When we asked for our Diet Pepsi, we asked for very little ice, then no ice.  Both times the sever completely disregarded or didn't hear the request.  When they served the food, my drink was empty and she didn't offer a refill. I had to ask another server to get our server to refill.  Basically after the food was finally dropped, so was the service.  Food was excellent, but experience  was over 2 hours for the 2 of us.

tld4x6sfkKWHbwpdFjEJdg.text: I just recently tried this place out with one of my friends for brunch. They have different options for food and drinks for brunch which is really nice. The food was great and fresh and the staff was super nice and considerate about the fact that we had not been to the place so they introduced everything on the menu for us and even when the plates came out, they explained a little bit more about it. Great service, great location.

8KXP-rpvEquvecoRNJriGw.text: This was the third time I have been to this restaurant. What started out as a good neighborhood italian eatery and bar has turned into a poorly managed mediocre restaurant with close to NO service at all.  The pizza was similar to a frozen pizza from the grocery store and I looked at the frowns on my friends' faces as they ate the pasta and salads they were served.  I'm sorry, but this place is going to be gone in no time...bye.

rw7uiaUyw1GVf2A4IiqWNA.text: My first visit to this recently opened Summerlinrestaurant was as wonderful as I expected due to the majority of 5 Star reviews. Our group of 8 ordered several appetizers, calamari on a bed of arugula was lightly battered and lemony delicious, meatballs, zucchini chips and grilled cauliflower. Each was so delicious and tasty! The dinner was even better from the homemade pasta dishes, salmon, short ribs and the pea soup was amazing.   The service was fantastic.  Our server was friendly, attentive and offered suggestions of favorites which is always nice when trying to decide.  As expected for a newly opened place it was packed and yet the service did not suffer for it. We liked the atmosphere and watching the open kitchen through a big window was fun to see.   Although we were full we saw desserts being served to our neighbors and had to order. The tiramisu was one of the best I've ever had! And the Bombolini (Meyer lemon curd donuts!) were light and fluffy and delicious.   We can't wait to go back for Happy Hour on the patio to order the Chef's Board.

viwTN82gwY7xHT5D7TL8EA.text: New restaurant located in the recently renovated, rebranded and re-positioned Rampart Commons lifestyle Center. Beautiful interiors, excellent food (roasted cauliflower, Pepperoni and corn pizza sprinkled w arugula was fantastic and authentic to northern Italy). Service was just just middle of the road as our waiter felt new, inexperienced by that did not stop us from enjoying a wonderfully delicious lunch and tipping well. We struck it up to restaurant being new. Wine list prices were some of the Best I have seen in Las Vegas for both bottles and by the glass selection and pricing.  Highly recommend.

hCVNMWlO_ZUjk_FXeak3Og.text: Had lunch with three friends and thoroughly enjoyed food, service and prices. Recommendations from jackie, server, were most helpful. Will be back again and again.  So glad to have North in the neighborhood.

fI3sPWmK-_mfhR1JZrdSTw.text: From the perspective of someone who eats gluten free, I highly recommend this place. My friend and I shared a pizza and a pasta and both were great. The pizza crust was just okay, but the toppings were so good I wouldn't hesitate to order a pizza here again. The hazelnut torta dessert is also gluten free, and so good! Great cocktail menu too. Our server was great and actually came out to check the pasta dish as soon as the runner was dropping it off to make sure it was correct and did not include the breadcrumbs that normally come on it. I will definitely be back.

me-1Ji-VpbMnf8B0rDU69w.text: I was in this Restaournt with my Yuval (doghther)las week . Service is amazing . Everything was delicious!! So nice ambiance.  I love it . Will come back for sure.

ar9qeCN-Y4nMZEQngzRSQA.text: Walked Out - poor service The food is good and the ambiance is great. Saturday brunch service, dismal! How disappointing. We told the hostess we would sit at the bar since the restaurant was about 20% capacity and why not enjoy the view. We somehow confused the high tops next to the bar. We sat there...and sat, and sat. It's not that nobody saw us because just about every server made eye contact with us INCLUDING the hostess. Apparently, if the staff purposely ignored us we would get up and ask for the table. Instead, we got up and told the hostess we were leaving. We walked a few feet away to Honey Salt and got the service we were looking for.

hgajiumAa8YNTOYewRt47A.text: Good food.  Love the set up, the bar and seating area opens to the outside.  GREAT calamari.  Great service.   Busy place.    SUMMERLIN APPROVED !

mRLyr8ZOeK5_bFkBGqlItA.text: I have been to North Italia for the first time last Monday for dinner with my friends. Wow the restaurant looked good than in the pictures and did not feel like we were in Vegas, seems like in CA. Love the food especially the fresh pasta even the happy hour house pizza was good too. We had couple cocktails and 2 bottles of red wine, they were great. Good quality both drinks and food and also the service! All staff were super friendly and very fun to talk to. We met a male bartender named Polloh(sorry if i spell it wrong) but yeah he was awesome, took a good care of us and had a sexy italian accent lol we loved it here. Love all servers here as well, they were amazing. Will definitely coming back.

Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dV0rVkvXZXQl27T1wy8uyw.text: Loved sitting at the bar having a glass of wine and some wonderful apps! I look forward to having dinner there this week with family.

bHEAmJIpCYr607VS_Ne1pQ.text: My favorite cuisine is Italian and when I heard they were opened here in summerlin I was extremely excited! I've heard such great things about them and their food. As you walk in there is a huge outdoor patio that is heated during the winter with a lakeside backdrop. The place inside is huge! Our waiter was awesome and explained everything that was a favorite on the menu. I love truffle so we ordered the truffle garlic bread with fresh ricotta cheese served in a skillet! It was flavorful and a good size, along with it we got a tomato bisque. We ordered for the entree Chicken Pesto pasta and tortellini pasta! They were both great dishes but the only con was their portions are so small! I wish they had bigger portions especially because the food is so flavorful. For dessert we opted for the hazelnut Torta, it had rich chocolate flavor and to soften the taste the hazelnut makes it the perfect flavor combo. We will be back to try other dishes.  5/21/18 UPDATE STILL amazing, we were able to try happy hour and they have the best around town, everything is priced great and the happy hour menu is delicious! What I love about this place is that their pasta is made fresh and handmade here at the restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States

G4G7hK2s82B8mmvJX0V4cg.text: I dined alone at the bar for happy hour with expectations of good food and cheap wine. My bartender, Marie was quick and efficient and offered me small talk even though I could tell she was busy. She was able to offer me a great cocktail selection when I mentioned I preferred gin. Also, the happy hour food was at a great price and was delicious  Next time I'll come back with some friends and sit a table.

jKOGYnndj5FuhrAMJqaD4A.text: Pleasantly surprised by this restaurant! An easy 5 stars for being able to maintain a kitchen producing house made pasta and delicious pizza in a high-traffic location in Summerlin. I expect their quality as exclusive to much smaller joints, so definitely give North Italia a try if you're craving Italian! The service was also great, with genuinely kind and attentive staff. Loved the funghi pie and even recommend the basic, but well-done and nostalgic spaghetti and meatballs. Zucca chips are a must have starter too. Will be back!

nH95SA7FOr_UqUGxN1rsxQ.text: Ohhh North Italia. We really loved this place. Especially the happy hour they offer. However last night was one of the worst experiences EVER.  My family and I had dinner there at 6pm.  Our server seemed very friendly and was upbeat with a smile. We all ordered appetizers and main courses everything seemed to be fine. Place was very busy. Then it went all down hill.   1st the server had forgotten to bring the drinks we had ordered. While trying to get his attention numerous times he would just past on by. After flagging him down. Wed ask if he'd put in an order. He initiated "you never told me".   2nd They had dropped the wrong food at our table and we were asked are you sure then frowned at for being sure it wasn't our item.   3rd Dirty glasses were never picked up or asked to be refreshed. It just sat there. Until we asked for them to be removed. I had asked for a refill on my drink and he had forgotten that too.   4th He cleared our table and asked if we'd like to see a dessert menu. I wasn't able to order another coffee before he disappeared again.   This is what tops it all before we could order dessert he drops the bill!  He never asked if we wanted another coffee or order dessert.   He never seemed to check in as often or wouldn't stay at the table long enough to put in any other orders. While we watched him walk constantly around the restaurant not doing anything. It took another server to recognize we were not happy.   We gave him the benefit of the doubt he was probably having an off day. But seriously? We are never to return. We were offered a gift card to return but left it on the table. It could've been handled differently. He could've just brought us dessert.

dWgtnv5sV_IBEa2kGLlVqg.text: Awesome atmosphere and food! Friendly staff, especially  our server Alissa! Great personality!   Will be back whenever we are in town! 5 stars!

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States

sB05gS3SBdPhP7AWIYmsNA.text: My wife and I visited this location on a Thursday night. It was crowded and we had a 20 minute wait. (normal) We received our page and we were seated quickly. We ordered our food and I asked for a diet soda with very little ice. The drinks came and ice was overflowing . Three sips later it took my server multiple passes before she came back. I asked her for a glass of diet with no ice this time. She came back with another glass with soda and a lot of ice. Food took 35 minutes to arrive and our server offered us a free desert. Food was awesome. It was a shame it took 35 minutes for a salad and tortellini. We will go back because of the food, but would like to have another server.

6LnU0_akRsElbv2pJLH-vA.text: As a newly noted pescatarian, I was quite reluctant choosing North Italia as an eatery on March 17, 2019 however my server, Sebastian was so helpful and let me know the options that were available to me. Sebastian suggested the burrata w/ no pancetta as an appetizer and the squid ink malfadine for the entree. It was DELICIOUS! I've already told all my friends and plan on visiting again.

-aed4n8uzLcbdK2j8C9J2w.text: Came here for a second time since I really enjoyed the food last time even though the service wasn't great. We were seated promptly but unfortunately we were left sitting at our table for about 15-20 minutes without anyone coming over to take our drinks or even introduce themselves. We ended up getting up and walking out of the restaurant. They have good food but the service really needs a lot of improvement.

pOgYADxhuQcLpIjeJ3G7-A.text: Over priced food with terrible service. The nuts were rancid and the $38 meat was dry and over cooked. Also the kitchen was clearly having issues. It took an hour to get our meals out to us. Which we understand sometimes problems just happen but we got no communication as to why our meals were coming out one by one and 15minutes apart. The last meal that came out was a salad that took an hour and 20minutes to be brought out. Go to Maggianos! Way better food and it's a restaurant that knows what it's doing.

3T0ZqXkaEFtyeuy-hGXyIA.text: Horrible service !!!   Server brought wrong salad and her response was simply "well I put it in correctly"... the manager came to the table and again stated "I confirmed she put in what you ordered".  I had to explain to the manager that server putting it in correctly is irrelevant to the customer.  The server should be confirming that what kitchen gives them is what was ordered!   Luckily I am from AZ and North Italia at Kierland has impeccable service.

XBjykc88q-5mKqx77FAUbA.text: We liked it here but not something I'd go out of my way to dine. My son's pizza - The Pig with pepperoni, salami, and sausage was good. He said it's like a lot of other pizzas in town.  We ordered the calamari - and it came tossed with arugula. I don't think we read it in the menu, but maybe I didn't pay attention to it. My son ordered it, and they staff were kind enough to remake it without the arugula. We should have just canceled it. Without the marinara sauce or some sauce, it's just that - deep friend breaded squid. We wouldn't order this again.  I had the veggie salad and the grilled branzino. The branzino was $27 and it was good, but not $27 good. I'd get it again but not at that price. I think I'd go to Nora's and get a whole one instead.   The veggie salad - I read it had faro, but it seems it also had quinoa. It was mushy with the avocado and the grains. The only vegetable besides the lettuce was small pieces of cauliflower. I definitely would not order this again. I don't know... maybe we ordered all the wrong things.   We ate it, but we left going, what's the hype? On the people side, they were super friendly attentive. I think if you're in the area, and you want to have a relaxing meal in a nice setting, and you want to try something other than Claim Jumper, PF Changs, and Chili's, this is a nicer atmosphere with a feel of more stylized food.

yhGVCx_BdGDaXOPc3Cz74w.text: Buyer beware - this place ain't cheap! Went on a college football Saturday afternoon. They have garlic bread as an appetizer for only $12! Wanted spaghetti and meatballs and about passed out when I saw they charge $18 for something it likely costs them under a dollar to make. A draft Stella Beer came in a small glass for only $6.50! The place was cold and drafty inside. You can choose to stare at two televisions or a wall loaded with boat propellers hanging on it. The ambiance was not worth the price of admission. There are just way too many dining options in this part of town to settle for these prices. We headed over to a more reasonably priced Giordanos Pizzeria instead.

1Ght9dad_fH1DnjTOg3DxQ.text: First, I would like to say this place has a great atmosphere and very friendly and attentive staff.  We were greeted warmly and seated at a beautiful walnut table.  Very quickly our drink order was taken and we had regular tea which was very tasty (like the best part of the meal in my opinion).  We also opted for an appetizer of a grilled artichoke for $13 - which was 3 half artichokes grilled.  Tasty, but nothing you wouldn't get down at the claim jumper across the street for much less.  They also brought out bread which was cold out of the fridge with some butter.  For dinner, I had the spaghetti and meatballs.  The meatballs were pretty good but the pasta sauce is among the least spectacular I have had in a long time.  I don't want to say this, but the dish actually reminded me of Chef Boyardee spaghetti.  I feel kind of guilty for writing that, but unfortunately, it's True.  Having said that, my wife had Burrata Tortelloni and it was good for her - she liked the spicy sauce.  Finally, the portions were very small for the price.  2 Teas - Great 1 App - Good but not wow'd 2 Pasta Entree's - One not good, One Good (so, mediocre)  with Tip $70  Although there were a few good things, this is a "one and done" place for us.

USLpTXUxHvH0TRMfNCoUFA.text: Love this place so much !!! The food was amazing and our server Bonnie  was the cutest thing in the world !!!

4BaFNT80YqJw3cVLlHSQZA.text: I love restaurants like this!!!! These places are few and far between and I love finding them close to home, you usually need to go to places like Seattle to find something like this! Right in summerlin, North Italia has an excellent happy hour. Great choices for regular people but unfortunately I am not regular....if you know me you know this lol- gluten, dairy and meat free is not a blessing people - they made me a gluten free pizza, no cheese with mushrooms and broccolini....don't forget the garlic. Love love love the happy hour sangria and my husband and friends love the bottle and board where you get a bottle of wine and a charcuterie board - all in all this place is worthy of 10 stars - thank you North Italia for exceeding my expectations and thank you MELIANN for taking excellent care of us!!! See you next time FOR SURE

ym_yHSXus8kjru0pjfJ7fA.text: Very friendly service . Thanks Deja .    Good food.   Nice date night place to go ..  Our first time and  my wife already is talking about going back

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy. Our first time everything looks good. .

2aOOpD1ZPa_RLkiexGzKvQ.text: Service is good but food not so much. I come here often and lately the food hasn't come out so warm/hot. I don't really know if I'll return due to the food or being up to standards.

WTTp6y8f4xAAd8x_9aHXIA.text: Went to north Italia with a group of friends Saturday night. We made a reservation and when we arrived, the place was pretty packed at 9pm. The decor is super sleek and cute inside. We were seated shortly after ordering drinks at the bar. Service was pretty good. Since I think this is a new location, they are still training staff.   Our party of 8 almost ordered most of the menu. For appetizers we got the arancini balls and calamari. I liked that the calamari came with arugula because it made it lighter but that dish was a miss for the table. They were expecting just calamari and more of it. The calamari was crispy but it didn't come with any dipping sauces. My friends said the arancini balls were just ok.   I ordered the funghi pizza. I love mushrooms and this pizza was very very good. It had great flavor and they were pretty generous with the mushrooms. The only complaints were that the crust is too big and thick, and the pizza was on the greasy side.   I also got to try some of the chicken pesto. It's very flavorful. The short rib pasta was good but the meat was a little stringy. I did enjoy the Parmesan cream sauce though.  The diver scallops came on a bed of risotto with butternut squash. The scallops were very juicy and big. It could have had a crispier sear to it. The risotto was good but overall the dish is on the sweet side.   The atmosphere is great and the food is satisfying so I'll come back again!

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Arancini
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Margherita pizza

Yn971M6Lhf3YbIOvBNwHYw.text: I really like this place! My boyfriend and I came for dinner on a Friday night and the food was very good. We ended up arriving right as happy hour was ending and we were lucky enough to find a spot at the bar. The bar atmosphere is amazing, as the bar opens to the outside which gives you a great opportunity to enjoy the patio vibe. The place has a beautiful ambiance!  I started with a cocktail, and ordered the Julietta which is ginger infused vodka, vanilla, st. germain, lime and prosecco. This was such a fun cocktail and very tasty. I highly recommend it!  For food we started with the Chef's Board which includes prosciutto, artisan cheese, marinated eggplant, roasted peppers, olives and almonds. This was a great starter and shareable item. The bread that came with the Chef's Board was a little to crispy, and could do without it being soooo toasted. When then shared a Margherita Pizza, the basil was fresh and there was a good amount of mozzarella.... so you can never go wrong there, came out hot and delicious.   I was a bit disappointed when I went to order a glass of wine and they seemed to be out of every options that I asked for. I was wanting red and all they could offer was white, so I ended up getting the last 2 ounces of a pinot.   Overall the food and atmosphere are wonderful! I know that the restaurant is still new and I can hope that the attentiveness of the service will improve. The staff were all very friendly and kind, but lacking attentiveness, and would forget drink orders all together. Although each time they were very apologetic, it was a bit exhausting. (and when we tried to sympathize by saying this must be a really busy night they responded with no, this is actually slower than normal for a Friday)

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Julietta (ginger infused vodka, vanilla, st. germain, lime and prosecco)

PhuOkEp2Usnm8lFupsubkQ.text: Two Words: Go North  This place is the new wave here in Summerlin. Been here twice. Once with my lovely client who knows the owner and the second time on a date.   It reminds me of being back in LA - quality food, great service and open concept.   My favorite dish is the bolognese - the pasta is made fresh daily. I also love their white truffle garlic bread!   Their cocktails are amazing! I got the one with green chartreuse in it because that's my jam. Everyone from the hostess to the waitress are amazing.  10/10!

U-WHXLQwZ94Jes2piWJ-Tg.text: this place is amazing! I wish I could rate 20/5 stars. Came in for happy hour and as soon as I stepped in I immediately loved the ambiance. The interior reminded me of a restaurant that could have been in Seattle, was very clean, modern, and comfortable.  To eat I got the Chef's board (apricot marmalade is so tasty), Prosciutto bruschetta and Bolognese pasta. Everything was amazing from start to finish. Definitely recommend giving this place to visit.   Didn't get the full name of my server but her initials were TC - flawless service, she was very informative of each item we ordered and was welcoming.

yVIoDK6mhH_jRfDRw1JACw.text: Finally, an Italian restaurant in Summerlin that impressed me in every way! From the open kitchen where you can have a personal look at your pasta being hand made, to the great service from the entire staff, to the desserts that make me never want to diet ever in life, this place has it all covered.  Between my visits, I've tried quite a few dishes. The bolognese blew me away, truly one of the best I've ever tasted. The salty crust on the salmon was very unique and flavorful. And the salted Carmel budino is my new favorite sweet snack! I'd also suggest ending your meal with an Italian coffee.  This place is good for date night, family dinner, a ladies outing, or even a solo dinner and glass of wine. In the nicer months, they offer outdoor seating.  As much as I love Honey Salt in the same lot, I'm worried this place may have just taken the spotlight when it comes to semi-fine dining.

Qz7cElxN27W-RvX4UoYW3Q.text: Oh... how I wanted to like this place. Maybe we got unlucky and came on Bad day? But how bad of a day could it of been when all bottles of wine were half off? I genuinely was excited to try it. It's location is convenient, the ambiance is cute, the patio is awesome, and the kitchen is behind glass so you can see everything that is happening. I'm giving two stars because I'm being generous... and will try it again and hopefully update with a stellar review... but for now all I can leave you with is this...   The service lacked in every which horrible way possible. It took over 10 minutes before anyone even noticed we were there. It wasn't our server, it was a manager. I got over it. We got some waters and ordered a bottle of wine. And spaghetti for the little guy because he was starving. He said he was going to bring out some bread while we looked at the menu... it didn't come. Our server came over and said he was also going to bring out the wine we ordered and before he could walk away, the manager had the bottle opened and poured. It was confusing because I didn't know which one was our server at first. We asked for the bread five minutes later again::: they said it would be right out. I informed the server when he came back (still with no bread) that I was vegan and wanted to try something with no dairy or animal product. He made some suggestions and we settled on the heirloom tomato and burrata. I didn't get to try the food because when it finally came out... it came out full of cheese:( I sent it back... we still didn't have bread on the table and I was over it. We finished our bottle of wine and management came over to apologize. They seemed sincere... I didn't want to get the server in trouble (probably a bad day)... we said we would be back... and we will... hopefully with a better updated review.i

ZuUyLzxyQrHucGnuabZ15g.text: Local favorite! Been 20+ times Consistantly great food, good cocktails and friendly service all for a reasonable price.   Try Margherita Pizza (gluten free crust is great!), Chicken Parm, Scallops, farm salad, Salmon, and the cheese board!  Happy hour Monday through Friday 4pm to 6pm, great deals on drinks and food  Avoid the calamari

h_lX5077qgyMzNf0qcLlxQ.text: I've been to North Italia a few times and have always spoken highly of the restaurant and posted on my social media to recommend the restaurant (even my profile pic is from there lol). I work at a hotel on the strip and am constantly talking to my colleagues about it because they love the restaurant as well!  However, after my most recent visit, I am unsure if I will go back.  My friend made reservations for 5:45pm on 2/2 (Saturday).  I ordered the same thing I always order for myself: a glass of red, the truffle bread, chicken pesto, and the affogato.  This time, my friend and I decided to try the mussels.    I did not eat anything else after and went home since our dinner ended around 7:20pm. When I got home that night, I could not stop vomiting and using the restroom.  I was told I had food poisoning from the doctor's the very next day. I figured the mussels were what got us because it probably wasn't cleaned thoroughly.  Please keep in mind I don't have any allergies to anything.   North Italia is always packed at night so I understand if the kitchen gets hectic but I don't agree with rushing out items when they are not fully prepped.   I am unsure if I will visit again at the moment since I am still recovering.  2/6 Update: Tim (manager) contacted me at around 8:35am to follow-up with how I was and that alone took me by surprise. He then offered to send me a gift card to my address which he didn't have to at all. I truly appreciate the guest service.  3/2 Update: Gift card received!

O8K8Y2H_Y1On-NCWtKHMFA.text: This place is ah-mazinggggg!!!! They make everything from scratch  Everything is good!!! #favoriteplace

46Bkp5Cqs4hjdSjvzWrkng.text: Bad quality, bad customer service, we waited almost hour to they bring us our salad. And salmon  Server just walking and pass with out of asking if the customer need anything,  If you are looking for good Italian food this place you can not find any taste of Italian food not even close !

7q7KFdo20jktiG_l-SkMTQ.text: Yummy yummy get into my tummy. We tried twice to come here but both times it was super busy so prepare to wait when you decide to visit. The ambiance is awesome with a farmhouse feel to it: bronze salt & pepper shakers, wood top tables, comfy cushy chairs, even the uniforms are a farm feel but it works!  I immediately asked the server for vegan options and even though they don't offer a separate menu for those items, he was able to point out my options with making some adjustments to them. For my meal I had the   Tuscan Kale Salad (remove the cheese and parmesan vinaigrette dressing) and he replaced it with another dressing and it came with grapes and apples. It was awesome!!   Special of the day Vegetable pizza (hold the cheese) came with broccolini, crispy eggplant, mushrooms, roasted red peppers on a gluten free crust and it was AMAZING!! It was a decent portion, 6 good size slices and I ate every single one loving every bite   The bf ordered the tomato soup of the day and the scallops. He loved every moment and our meal was complimented by a glass of the Riesling, pinot grigio and a makers old fashion.  The service there was awesome from being greeted at the door to our server and food runners. Everyone was so friendly and if something wasn't right, they would do their best to accompany the request. Nick was our server and even though was very busy, never left us hanging for service.   Definitely check out this place and also in the same shopping center they're opening up a sister location called the Flower Child which looks to be a farm to table concept. Can't wait!

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Special of the day Vegetable pizza no cheese on a gf crust

Gc-MfHZxOiQW42x8w26sJQ.text: My first visit to the newest Italian hot spot in Summerlin was as good as it gets... "I'll be back" -Terminator (T-800 model)  Service: We sat at the bar on the side that's outside the indoor dining area.  The weather covers were down because of the recent rain and the outdoor heaters were on to keep it cozy.  Our bartender/server was fantastic! I wish I would have gotten his name.  Food came out promptly out of the kitchen during a very busy happy hour.  We ordered more food after happy hour, during the dinner rush and the service didn't falter.    Happy Hour Menu: The Chef's Board had Meat, cheese, veggies, bread, nuts, etc was pretty to look at and very tasty.  The Margherita pizza had a thick crust on the edge and the cheese was great.  Sangria was mixed proportionately well of wine and juice, I would drink again, and again.  Menu Menu: The Braised Meatballs order came out with 6 and loaded with red sauce, good times.  The mushroom risotto and scarmoza cheese in the Arancini balls was great.  Deep fried perfectly and the red sauce complimented it well.  The Spaghetti and meatballs pasta was well made and this classic dish is an easy "go to" here.  The high quality ingredients and the preparation were key to the tasty dishes I tried at North Italia.  Ambiance:  Wooden ceilings and floors, white walls adorned with some simple decorations, and contemporary bulb lighting make for a clean minimalist dining area inside.  Outside, there's a boardwalk mural and plenty of seating when the weather is nice.  The attractive rectangular bar serves both the inside and outside area of the restaurant and is stocked with premium liquor.  I believe North Italia has been opened for just a month now? I am pretty impressed with how well they're operating in such a short period of time especially during that dinner rush I saw.  I'm going to suggest reservations would be the smart thing to do here. The menu is extensive with so many dishes to try and is now a go to restaurant for me when I'm feeling Italian.  I'm looking forward to their brunch and another dinner experience in the near future.  But that's another yelp tale...enjoy! =)

SeXS0XYZWeSn7s39zcWNTg.text: I took my family here for the first time but it was a big disappointment. Our waitress didn't seem to care or have any sense of urgency. We had to remind her to bring my husband his beer after waiting for more than 20 minutes. My boy finished his entree before our small plates arrived. We finalized our bill before our dessert finally made it on our table.  Staffing isn't an issue with this restaurant. There were many waitresses and waiters walking around.  However, only a few were efficient and paid attention to their guests.  Everything seemed to be moving in slow motion.

DupHMn7Kg37vRevgozFbcw.text: Overall, solid Italian restaurant. I spent about 3 years overseas in Italia (North Italia, north of Venice) so I first opted for the Friulano wine--pleasantly good wine. The selection of wine was awesome too and most were from Italia.  We then got the Chef's board, and it was amazing; this was about as traditional Italia as you can get. For dinner, I got the grilled Branzino and my wife got "the Pig" pizza. Overall, my fish was 4/5.. the setup was good but the fish was charred just a tad too long that left a slight burnt taste which impacted overall flavor and left it dry. For the price, I would've definitely got something else next time--My wife's pizza was supremely amazing--again, comparable to what you'd actually get in Italia.   Finally, my only real critique was that our waitress was not present most of the night for us; either she was assigned too many tables or was inefficient/new at handling the workload. Delayed refills and getting our food out in a timely manner.   Overall though, nothing major and I'd recommend this restaurant to anyone wanting to try a new and authentic Italian restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FZHN3HI92Xr5sxlWFrmglQ.text: Food was incredible and the only thing that saved this from being a 2-star review because service was downright terrible. Our server clearly didn't want to be there and didn't want us there either. Asking for the restaurant week menu (twice, actually, because the first time she said "yes" then just stood there, and when she came back she tried to take our order and we had to ask for the menu again) was obviously some kind of sin. It was uncomfortable, and this is coming from a table of four hospitality professionals who all know the deal.  Anyway, food was fab. From the awesome toasty truffle garlic bread with creamy ricotta to the delightfully bitter radicchio Caesar to tortellini and chicken parm perfectly executed, everything was YUM! Even dessert - I'm a tiramisu freak but even their delish version paled next to the amazing salted caramel budino. Oh, and the charred cauliflower app?? Amaaaaaazing.  I hope we just had a new server because it would be sad to see this place go down because of service issues. Didn't seem to be anybody in charge or at least no once seemed to notice perpetually empty water glasses, food dropped with no silverware, dirty plates sitting and sitting. Everyone was more interested in their side work than our experience, but I bet I'll still be back for the grub.  Btw - we sat inside but I loved the look of the patio. A def must-try year-round - they've got a two-sided fireplace for when Vegas stops burning like the seventh level of hell.

UqPIMGaB-GF4_s90c1k7dw.text: Absolutely my favorite place to eat. The restaurant is usually always busy especially and night so make sure to make a reservation. The price ranges from 13 and up per dish which I think is fare. The Bolognese and the charcuterie are my favorite dishes. Also try the zucchini chips! Delicious
