AfCzt54kR-nrAiFm4gsbJA.text: Helpful and kind staff. Chicken parm was great and big enough for two portions. Nice atmosphere. Would definitely come back for the happy hour - $20 wine and chef's board combo. Had a great evening!

uk9ieQeJLI4P7VVl-UfACg.text: Great place to dine and not even expensive. Loved the white truffle garlic bread and it is probably the best Italian restaurant I've been to in a long time.

9qps_kSMl4t7zqfPcPWwzg.text: The best for the best. Treat yourself to a wonderful dinning experience at North Italia.

eanUttXSS_TWe8vX0OO39Q.text: Holy hell. Go here. Best meal I've had in a longggg time. Every single thing was incredible. The sangria is delicious. White truffle garlic bread was amazing. Calamari is the best I've ever had - not greasy and breaded, just light and crispy. The scallops with Parmesan risotto was to die for. And the desserts were DIVINE. Tiramisu, bundino, and hazelnut torta.   On top of all the amazing food, our service was absolutely fantastic. Even comped the birthday dessert. Hands down best meal experience I've had in ages.   Tip - make a reservation, it's busy and for very good reason.

VyOD-4OVxMg0xhsKiKxmwg.text: We went for an early lunch last Sunday and really enjoyed it. The vibe inside is fresh and clean with the indoor and outdoor meshing into one. We loved the truffle bread as our appetizer. My husband and I got pizzas and enjoyed them. My mother ordered pasta which was delicious and you can tell the pasta was made fresh. Will definitely return to try more items.

9P_PheLHJtsFe1dYmXR78w.text: I've been looking to try a different Italian restaurant in town and was disappointed after seeing the yelps and hearing from friends that this place was a good place to go. The service was excellent. However, I was surprised to see this place only have two dollar signs on yelp when my lunch for two people; this is two entrees with waters, no fancy drinks or appetizers, was $40 for lunch! You have to request the bread but it does have a complimentary bread which honestly wasn't the best. I got the chicken parm and was disappointed with the rubbery feel and seasoning on it. It also came with a pasta that wasn't at all impressive. I ended up take a few bites of pasta and chicken in hopes that it would taste better but it didn't. I didn't even bother taking it home because my boyfriend didn't want it either. Definitely not worth the $40. I will go elsewhere next time I want Italian.

jOTRMbcBK7VbFokZG5_E1A.text: My first visit to North Italia was one Saturday morning, as they offer brunch on Saturday and Sunday.   We both ordered the Short Rib Hash which came with eggs, potatoes and grilled bread.  My wife isn't much of a meat eater, however, she "tasted" the Short Rib Hash, and commented that it was extremely tender and flavorful.  In fact, the entire dish was absolutely delicious!  We thoroughly enjoyed the beautiful atmosphere and found it to be a relaxing experience.    We plan to revisit North Italia very soon!  Hopefully, we will have a repeat positive experience!

13qyOQsmqBvPgL88fnIxww.text: Same small tiny boring menu every time, but they still haven't figured out how to cook any of it in under an hour.

K5LP2wSYYprRQ7bbsa32_A.text: We checked this place out for lunch and had a fewlozzas and salads and everything was great. The meatballs are awesome. I can't wait to go back for dinner.

6M1TgG-cpsD9C2PWma9_cw.text: I thought it was just OK. I had wine and cheese plate. The cheeses were good but it had a lot of fillers and jams on it instead of more nuts and cheese. The wind that comes with it is not up to par.

qZy01YwY4wZkoVJbVsPRAA.text: Great new spot in summerlin. Took our family there for our Christmas dinner and we were not disappointed. Food was flavorful and thoughtful. Service was friendly and professional without being overbearing. Restaurant was very busy but we were seated immediately for our reservation. Must have arancini, buratta and pears, and Italian farm salad. desserts butterscotch budino and almond cake. Looking forward to returning again soon.

sBMTSoKhPP8mMg-dAl3AWg.text: Very busy, make sure to make a reservation. Great drinks, great food. We had the cheese board, pasta and mussels. Mussel broth was very flavorful. Fresh made pasta which is not easy to find in Vegas.

-IbSS-_rJUeqzyaCkKGC9g.text: Well.... I really wanted to like this place. I know it's Hot & New.   The portion sizes were very small for the price and our waiter never offered and never brought any bread to the table. Not sure when we will be back. Maybe for happy hour.

KIlJu1gVG3DAcA7-LRrttg.text: Service was AWFUL!!!! Hosts were rude, servers were frantic, disorganized and lacked wine and menu knowledge. For how busy this place was I was surprised at the quality of service or lack thereof. Salads were bland an uninspired, pasta was not made from scratch and lacked texture and density, my main course was extremely overlooked and presentation was mediocre at best. If you want to try some real Italian food give Masso Osteria at Red Rock a try!!

tCELVeFn_Pisa_-cDTrMlQ.text: Our second visit did not disappoint! We got a pizza for take-out and the crust and toppings were perfect and delicious! The caramel budino for dessert was the best decision we've ever made. This place will be on our regular list from now on!

kobZk3k1PGARMgEMndpEjQ.text: This new Italian restaurant is such a welcome addition to the neighborhood! It's near Pottery Barn and Williams Sonoma. The food and service were amazing! We had the chef's board which was a great start to our meal. The diver scallops were served on top of yummy risotto. The Bolognese sauce over handmade pasta was to die for. The server recommended the ricotta truffle garlic bread with the pasta dish. Sooo good!  The perfect ending was the salted caramel budino for dessert! We can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chef&#39;s Board is a great appetizer. Super high quality ingredients!

ZbKTMn0--5y6FHDe_-tv-Q.text: They really did a great job with the space it's fantastic. And one of the best build-outs off the strip for sure. The service is a little hit or miss. They need to use trays instead of hand carry everything. The menu has pretty good options, but they will probably need a chef to keep up the seasonal changes and creativity.  This place with put Honeysalt out of business for sure!

0y1nbQDGkNL0RA3BKkXlsg.text: Great food, service and atmosphere.  We loved the fungi pizza and short rib pasta with a light alfredo sauce.

WYiwUiAgzbwgj_FDHnQB7g.text: Great food, service and atmosphere.  See and be seen at this new Summerlin eatery!   I recommend you make a reservation.

u9jPiVA4MS1i63r3XRf_3g.text: This is by far the best Italian place I've ever dined at! I got the white truffle garlic bread as an appetizer and OH MY LANTA was it delicious. My mouth is drooling just thinking about it. Our bartender Ryan was very informative and attentive. I got the local beer Gypsy Fade which was a great balanced IPA. I've never tried any vegas local beers and I'm glad this place carries them. For the entree, I got the Wine Glazed Short Ribs.. it was soooo tender and flavorful, so amazing. As to when I thought it couldn't get any better, I finished off my experience with the Tiramisu dessert and it was worth it. Every bite felt like heaven in my mouth LOL   Definitely dining here again, amazing food and great service! Everyone was so kind and welcoming.

bBy0TYY0L4IWLaPy1wQOcA.text: YUMMY! YUMMY! YUMMY! This place has got the right touch with all their food. Their salads are unique and delicious, their pasta is scrumptious with their house made noodles. Don't get me started on their desserts, which change seasonally as I've experienced; an added reason to go in more often. The customer service has been impeccable every time I go here. Even when they are swamped (which is often as they stay busy), they take their time to make sure every thing is just right for a delightful dining experience.

I-NOaVJhg9nzlSRTdf8eXQ.text: Went here for dinner last night.  We had a reservation and was seated immediately.  The ambiance was great and even though the room was big and it was noisy it wan't an unbearable level.  Service was also attentive.  I had the artichoke which was good but not the best I've had.   My husband had spaghetti and meatballs and he said the same thing.  Some other tables nearby had the Chef's Board which looked really delicious and I would try that next time.

bVS2Q8UotE8KtT6eeGZejA.text: Delicious food and drinks. Love the decor and bar is easy to get a spot on most nights. Definitely happy that one of these opened up near our house. Will be back for sure, especially now that it's cooled down and we can sit outside on the patio.

-BCrzQvmJeq3-qHfqoFeqg.text: This was our first time here and the food was amazing service was excellent. Our waiter Oscar was helpful in helping to make our choices on the menu. Oscar made our first visit very comfortable, elegant setting with great food. We will definitely be back

_D4Ge-Z_dJa2gwrjpRflkg.text: Great spot for casual dining. The food is wonderful and the staff is as kind as you get in a restaurant.

gsuolgJ3-f_JZ_ZK831wsA.text: Cannot get any better? You post anything less than a 5 star, well you must be a miserable person. If you haven't tried it, GO. So so so GOOOOOOOD

pRrwLSsYSusB3LTACHYPDw.text: Very authentic and delicious food. The mussels are cooked to perfection and the bread is amazing as well

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States

S5_VV-9fRWG7nGxNvqK01Q.text: Ambiance: North italia is located in summerlin las vegas, which is one of the suburbs in Las Vegas. Rampart and charleston is the cross street, the location is situated in dining/social restaurant district since it is dotted with great restaurants and Bars, the food has to be good to compete in the area. The restaurant has a bar and dining area and is ideal for meeting up, and socializing. The decor is modern rustic, the music was a bit loud.   Food: The food had great flavors!  I ordered the braised beef pasta and my wife had the kale salad, the kids had the chicken fingers. My braised beef pasta the meat was tender  and the fresh pasta had bite to it definitely Al Dente, it was not soft. My pasta was great, I actually used the idea at home. The kale salad had the ingredients roasted, and pine nuts. Did not expect  the kale to taste good because it is kale. I was suprised that it was flavorful. The chicken fingers of my kids had some twist and it came out good flavor wise. Over all the food was good.     Service: The staff that served us, missed some request which is totally understandable because of the amount of diners that they are serving is big we had to be on the wait list for 45 min before we got seated. Again please be patient  because the amount of people that dines in north italia is huge, because its new. Sevice should improve overtime.   Overall: It's good food and would like to try the other entrees offerred by North Italia, the service should improve overtime. North  Italia is good for socializing since they have a bar to hang out, the food can be a great topic for conversation since its combinations that I did not expect to taste great but it did. Even copied the  braised beef pasta at home. I would to come back to North Italia in a few months to try other entrees. Definitely a must try if you are in the summerlin area.

gdhKVj4XKdmug94XlSwJlg.text: We'd been wanting to try North for a while and finally managed to get there. We went early, around five,  thinking it would be empty and we're surprised at the number of people who'd had the same idea. You can tell once this place gets really hopping it would be way noisier than it already was, not exactly a plus for me.   I was in the mood for a cocktail and tried two from their craft menu that were recommended by our server. Both were a little more complex, and sweeter than I usually like, I'm kind of a purist. Next time I'll probably stick with what I know.    We started with the grilled artichoke and garlic bread. I do love a good artichoke, and this one surely was. The aioli was not the best I'd ever had, could have used maybe some dill, or other herb. The garlic bread was otherworldly, and you damn well better love garlic because it is seriously loaded with it. The bread was light as air and the ricotta was amazing. I finished with the arugula salad, which I also loved. The hubs had the bolognese pasta. It was good, not as good as mine, but still worth having.   Another visit to check out other offerings is definitely in order.

xbYS6C_k8hS9HSJENdts5w.text: Lovely place!!!! Patio is adorable! Super Italian cozy! Staff very friendly and welcoming! Sangria was thick and fruity and came in a pitcher for $28! Calamari fritti was Light and crispy and paired wonderfully with the lemon arugula salad! My gluten free pizza was the best crust I've had yet! Thin and very crispy! The radiatori pasta with short Ribs was creamy and delicious! We fell in love with the place and plan to return for happy hour block of antipasto and bottle of wine for $20!

lGuRojf3FTwCBY6wG3UKGQ.text: You know a restaurant is GREAT when you decide you will need to visit it's other location that's closer to home when you return from vacation.   The ambiance is hip, modern, and clean. The wait staff is friendly and on top of things.   1) Italian Grinder: this was sooo good. The side salad that came with it was perfectly dressed.   2) The Pig Pizza: love the crust! It's nice and crispy. The pig was a lil salty and greasy for me but still a delicious pizza. Would definitely try one of their other pizzas next time.  3) Meatball sub: didn't order this but saw one delivered to another table. Must try this next time and get the crispy potatoes!!

EaJ6ZlY_PFVjc717dHNYdw.text: North Italia restaurant is major fail! We made reservation and was the second party to be seated. They sat more than 10 other tables and they all got servers/drinks. We complained to host and still no service. Some walked around to scan tables and no one came to us. Even the manager walked around, saw it, and didn't see it.  We got up and walked out.   This is the first time anything like this has happened in our many years of dining out!

8OrRpihyIiS6jqhxhN_GDg.text: Excellent food! Definitely try everything! Pizza, pasta, apps were all 5 stars! Our server was amazing. She was very personable and explained the menu in detail with great suggestions.

nTtCMujW06kTO8ihJEtOzA.text: Definitely lives up the hype. The food is amazing, and the feel and vibe is better! I love the decor and outside /inside transition. Can't wait to try it in the summer! So glad they turned that plaza back into something

468kajqnLwRHWGlzWwYX0A.text: Returned for my anniversary two weeks ago and it was just as wonderful as the last time I was there. I had the Bolognese, and it was the best I have ever tasted. It was SO flavorful! My husband had the short rib radiatori and it was very good too, but the Bolognese was my absolute favorite.  We had the hazelnut torta, because it was so good the last time I was there and I wanted my husband to try it. It was just as good as the first time. I will definitely be going back. It is a little on the high side for prices, so not a regular thing for us, but for special occasions it will be my go-to place.

jwPwl_oDPgXamswXE8QbKw.text: Great food and great outside atmosphere. Across from boca park, you can't beat the location, especially if you need to shop for holiday gifts after, because, all the nice higher end shops are right next to it. Save yourself a trip down to the hectic downtown summmerlin shopping center. Support some of the more struggling businesses and shop right where you eat.

8Ln70AkxPzhDbA2PzY_N7Q.text: OH MY GOD! This is my new favorite restaurant! I love the decor and the clean dining room. I can't wait to try out the indoor-outdoor patio! Gianna is so kind and makes me feel like a regular and very at home. They have an extensive Italian wine list. They use very fresh and authentic Italian ingredients. Their pasta is so light and you can see them cooking it from their open kitchen. Kay the manager came and she was fantastic and so welcoming. I can't wait to suggest this restaurant to anyone that visits Las Vegas or Summerlin.

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. White truffle garlic bread
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Pesto

cgsSftz3aWgOsFjtc_Q5VQ.text: Great food and ambiance. If you like open air dining this is a great spot! The wait staff is always pleasant and most of all accommodating. Don't hesitated to host dinner here.

GeS-1_VqyFnDCRvfEAOPyA.text: We've been wanting to try North for a while but we wanted to wait for them to work out the kinks. Unfortunately they are not ready for prime time.  Our server greeted us and took everyone's drink order but mine. As she was walking away I tried to order my wine but she kept walking. She checked back several times for us to place our order but we were chatting and not ready. We ordered mussels, burrata and a house salad. The burrata arrived with bread for my gluten free husband and had to be redone. The house salad and mussels were great  Unfortunately as we were having our second bites of the apps our entrees arrived. My pet peeve. The runner had a deer in a headlight look when I pointed out that we were still eating our salads. The server came over and I asked why our entrees arrived 5 minutes after our appetizers. She gave a blah blah about how she waited to put in our entrees till after our appetizers were served and can't help that they came out quickly.  Really? A restaurant should be able to manage the timing of the food. Well they said they would redo ours. Don't think so. My (med rare) salmon was like a board when it arrived. The broccolini topping was shriveled into nothing. 20 minutes under the heat lamp would do that.

ducbq2xvcNj45S_CzBH5wA.text: Went last night and was seated right away. But after that, nothing. For at least 15 minutes. Our table was near the bar, I watched people come and go as the bartender made drinks. Whoever our server was didn't come by to say hi and introduce themselves or bring water or at least just acknowledge us that we were their table. My party of 2 had time to go through the whole menu, look on Yelp, for pictures to help us decide. We decided to walk out as we were both hungry and no one made any effort to acknowledge us so we didn't know how much longer we would just be sitting around waiting for some service. First time I've walked out of a restaurant. As I was walking out, up, a female employee asked if I was leaving. I said yes, I'm over it. So disappointing. Took my business to Brio down the street where we were seated right away, our server came by to introduce himself while he gave us time to look over drinks and the menu. That's how it should have been. I've been meaning to try your place for so long. I've heard and seen so many wonderful reviews about your restaurant. Sadly, I'll probably still give it another try. That's how much I wanted to eat here. I hope next time is better.

V7Ah--jp4FIVPFpH6pG0lQ.text: The food here is amazing, like no joke the best pasta i have had. But man does it take a while for the food to come out! Service was great but man i could read a 100 page book by the time the food is out lol. Really wish i could give 5 star

5dIEocTcmiON4mq2IxTriQ.text: Love North Italia.  The menu is diverse but still Italian.  And everything is good.  Got to try the zucchini chips.  Awesome!    Also, the bbq rib pizza is amazing but not always on the menu.

OFH0lj7JvG9UBJejPLQjzA.text: Great atmosphere. Very cozy restaurant. Definitely will be back. Something fresh in Las Vegas.

tBfGM8ziv0yO2r5xAj8kpg.text: Nice cozy place with good vibes and ambiance.  Our favorite is the Heirloom Tomato & Burrata.  The Mussels are just plain salty and not the good natural ocean kind.  Mafaldine is good but a tad mushy.  Loved their Caramel Budino for dessert.  We wanted to try one of the flavored dessert drink, but our server couldn't describe the different taste nor tried to find out.  So we got latte instead.  We will be back to sample other menu items and hopefully the dessert drinks.

0_wbcgZqyvRjzwAGi1OPxA.text: Food was awesome, squeezed us in without a reservation. Baby friendly, want to come back and try the brunch.

4mpjPs50TZlj7rA7kyKKow.text: I'm in love with their fungi pizza. Great environment the service is a little slow but to be expected since everything is hand crafted

1OJdHQ2onPfetLkZbr8Pqg.text: Really good food from the northern region of Italy.  Probably the best calamari I've had.  Perfect batter and super fresh.  Squid Ink Mafaldine and Bolognese were also very good.  Pasta is made in house and it was cooked perfectly.  This is a very nice place for a date night or dinner out with the family.  They have a nice kids meal with options to fit your child's taste.

8mHkofwh9PTm0yENnkqxpA.text: Took the family for dinner Sunday night and it was great! Calamari was cooked perfectly, branzino and chicken were very good, the place was busy and they have 50% off bottles of wine which we took advantage of of course.

CHgQmstVqeIYseR6B-EOyw.text: Happy hour sangria and zucca chips YES We each had a different entree for dinner mine was the STROZZAPRETI which was delish. The others seemed to enjoy their dinner Dessert. Salted Carmel gelato was good but the bobolini donuts were faboulous Service was good. She was very attentive. Can't wait for weather to get s but warmer so we can sit on patio for happy hour. The only downside  I think the prices for entrees is on the high side

JPK6VYVonsuGI-fQQMRtEg.text: Good, but nothing great. We liked the squid ink pasta, but I've honestly had way better. Trendy spot, probably not something I'd go back to.

OYFP2RAhMV4tcRJineX9WQ.text: Great food, decent service and reservations are always on time when it is super busy. I like the squid ink pasta and the yucca chips. Their ice tea is really good too. Recommend 9/10

g5J0M3rOsvMpgz0HUvCJrw.text: Keeps getting better and better. Love the artichokes, salmon, and few other plates.  Good staff, good atmosphere   Only thing one needs to learn to order slow. Food flys out of the kitchen and you don't get through your appetizer and the main meal shows up. Manager is cool and said she's working on the folks in the back, think she still has to crack that whip better.   Lol.

R48vIqYsRwt9N2Rfk99AJw.text: I went here with my son and my mom for my son's early birthday dinner. It was fabulous! Oscar, our server was extremely attentive and friendly. We split the arrancini for an appetizer... the sauce was amazing! My son had the kid's portion of spaghetti and meatballs and even had leftovers to go home. I had the arrugula salad which was dressed with a yummy lemon dressing. My mother had eggplant Parmesan which was huge!!! It wasn't on the menu, but our server made it happen! We ended our meal with a hazelnut torte and my son had the vanilla and chocolate gelato which was on the house for his bday. We left very happy and full!

2g9ozOaw-2N0vTtGtCTUAQ.text: Made my reservation on Saturday night. Got here on time only to find 40+ people waiting for tables. The hostess informed me that there is at least a 45 minute wait for my reservation. I asked her what the point of making a reservation is when it is not honored. Obviously they took too many reservations and / or sat too many people without reservations on what is probably one of the busiest dinner celebrations of the year.   This is my first visit to this establishment and will most likely be my last. It's really unprofessional for a restaurant to have no respect for their patron's time.  I'm left with virtually no options but to wait or just go home since every other restaurant out there will be just as busy tonight if not more. Shame on you North Italia!

-3Siw6isLcl0Wi2MwR6MEA.text: Took my mom there and my sister for there first time and went with my dad as well which he absolutely loves and my mom thought it was the best Italian place she's eaten at in her life she had the pizza was she said was the best pizza she's ever had and my sister said it was unbelievable she had the chicken Parmesan and I had the Short rib which I had a couple days ago and just wanted to have it again and my dad got it as well for appetizers we got meatballs which are unbelievable and the Burrata which is the best appetizer in the whole wide world my whole family loved it and My Wife said she wanted to do her birthday there with their family coming in from Miami in California and her birthday is on December 27 so I will probably see you guys again I love this place and I saw somebody famous there last night but I don't want to mention any names but that was pretty unbelievable he was my one of my biggest heroes of my life

5TW0mgkhh1TPw7e0qyo4GA.text: Modern, classy decor in both the indoor and patio seating areas.  Glassed-in kitchen is a nice touch - patrons can see the action without being subjected to the noise.  Great menu - fresh, modern twist on classic Italian fare.    Excellent service - friendly & attentive w/o being obtrusive.

CNfVF8mFzFiQP7lOOFttZw.text: I came on opening day with a client and the food and service was so great I brought my family back today.  The Zucca chips are zucchini chips sliced thin and lightly pan fried.  My husband ordered the chicken parm and it was delicious.  Lighter than the chicken parms I've tasted in the past but with plenty of flavor.  The grilled artichokes were yummy and came with a lemon aioli sauce.  I also tried the cauliflower which had light bread crumbs.  The atmosphere is sort of a farm-to-table feel.    Love this place!

7_NkgNMSjRAkkRXabl69RQ.text: Super good food and awesome atmosphere. I've come a few times and love the food choices, there is something for everyone. Today I LOVED the grilled artichoke. Mussels were good, salads are fresh and unique. The bar is too small for the crowd which is annoying but also adds to the cool vibe so I would not trade the standing room only for the feeling of a crowd on a Saturday night. Love it.

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States

cjIpg_T81qh8BtH1kSSm7Q.text: Gianna is the best! (I hope I have her name right) she always knows exactly what to suggest and remembers even the smallest details. The pastas are insanely good and they have one of the best happy hours around.

B-xjOyyVrr-KiGwG7XvUrA.text: Beautiful restaurant with delicious food! The atmosphere here is amazing! It's the perfect place for a girls night out and a nice family dinner! The restaurant is beautifully decorated and designed. They have an open kitchen so you can see your food being made which is awesome! The staff is also very patient and friendly. We came here for lunch and the place was pretty much dead. But, the next day we stopped by for dinner and the place was PACKED!  Seems like everyone must love the food! Personally, the food was amazing and fresh! All their pasta is homemade which is a major plus! We had ordered a cappuccino, chefs board, zucchini chips, italian farm salad, chicken parmesan, chicken pesto pasta, and Bombolini. We were externally pleased with everything we had ordered! My favorite was the the Italian farm salad, pesto pasta, and the bombolini. I highly recommend this restaurant and I can't wait to dine at North Italia again!

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6v4GvVvvu_wFhU17gdx15g.text: I dined here for lunch with my fiance and we were not disappointed. Bonnie was a phenomenal server and guided us in the right direction with the menu. She explained everything thoroughly and went to great lengths to make sure we understood what the restaurant was about.   For lunch I had the burrata tortelloni. I was impressed by the balance of richness and acidity the sauce and burrata had that complimented each other. My fiance had the strozzapretti. His dish was creamy but no so much that it was overwhelming. We also shared the grilled cauliflower which was light and flavorful. We could taste the char from whatever device it was cooked on and it was delectable. The raspberrycello was shared between us as an after lunch drink and it was the perfect mix of sweet and fruity.   Overall, 10/10 would recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burrata Tortelloni

2V1OYIVSFFlev7HjIL0SXA.text: Have eaten here many times and they are pretty consistent with the food quality.  Their gluten free crust is actually really good and I'm not crazy about a lot of gluten free options.  It is a hot spot to eat because it's a nice and fun atmosphere.

_mVmpODwG6PhHC_HMAeSWQ.text: Third time coming and I am obsessed!  Service  Food Staff totally matches the vibe with look and personality.  Nowadays people like "instagramable" places and yep it's cute here.   I would define the food as chic Italian comfort food. Right now I am all about the: --Prosciutto Bruschetta because it wasn't overtly salty, bread was super soft, and I liked the asparagus which was pretty non traditional for me.   --Bolognese because the meet sauce and perfect al dente pasta is big for me.  --Baked French toast is my heaven because it's a little different with it being softer and I love berries. I didn't even need the syrup.   On a side comment I was convinced to get the artichoke cause it's seasonal. I thought I've dined many a fine places but never had to eat it off the leaf. Ask! Especially if it's your first time so you enjoy it!   1000% will be back when on this side of town for another round of cheat day...

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prosciutto Bruschetta
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bolognese (House Specialty)

D7lIhNy8VePuNl1V4uJSGg.text: North Italia is one of my fave spots! The white truffle garlic bread is to die for & the spaghetti and meatballs are delish.

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. White Truffle Garlic Bread

Alg40CWpfCRqDh-YauTAPg.text: Reminds me of a cute little open and airy cafe on Melrose! The decor is simplistic and it works, the vibe is friendly and welcoming.  We sat outside, the weather was just perfect and they had heaters Incase it got chilly. I was impressed with the menu, they had glutton free and vegan options!  Ordered: Seasonal butternut squash soup: deliciously thick and creamy soup, super comforting.  Roasted Mushroom Tortelloni: fresh pasta and ingredients, a little too al dents for my taste.  Seasonal eggplant parm pizza: crusty and crunch edges and yummy flavor!

mRYtPUuVIS4EvLdGXIgrkA.text: I hate that I have to give North Italia 2 stars-- I wanted to love this place and give it 5. But it was just not a good experience. We went on Sunday and sat on the patio which is very nice.   Our waiter was very nice and told us all of his "favorites" which I found to be really funny because they were all the most expensive things on the menu. I felt like he had never tried anything but was just looking to bump up the bill. He even did this for the wine.  So we ordered the wine which was very good and the Chef's Plate for an appetizer. The Chef's Plate was just okay-- it only had a few pieces of pecorino and a tiny bowl of Italian cream cheese. Usually these have a few more options.   The BF ordered the Bolognese and I ordered the Branzino with a side of white bean ragu.  While we were having our wine and "cream cheese" the table next to us was having all kinds of problems with their food. Their salad was totally screwed up (all the main ingredients were left out) and when their pizza came it was also wrong. I had a bad feeling about our order while listening to this.  Our food came out before we had even finished the Chef's Plate. My Branzino was cold and totally flavorless. It also smelled very fishy. The BF even made a comment that the fish smell was very strong. It was not edible. The white bean ragu on the side was also luke warm and the beans were barely cooked. They were so crunchy. Also not edible. The BF said his was just okay.  Our waiter did not come back to check on us until the BF had almost finished his food. He would have liked to have had some Parm on his pasta but oh well. So the waiter took my food and asked if I wanted something else. Too late, the BF was done and I did not want to make him sit and wait. I def. would have liked something else, I was starving.  The manager apologized and took it off my bill. I am hoping they were just having a bad night. It's just not a good atmosphere when you are waiting for your meal and the table next to you is having all sorts of issues. I would like to try North Italia again, hopefully it will be better.

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. White bean Ragu
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled Branzino*
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States

aAH1ZUtLZyV-qVwOk5kf8w.text: I love, love, love this place. The drinks are amazing, appetizers and entrees, in my experience, have all been fantastic. Service is good and I love how it feels like you're somewhere else (I compared sitting on the patio on a warm-ish day to being back home in Orange County). The short rib radiatori was phenomenal (and I'm not just saying that) - everyone at my table had to try it and loved it. There is a garlic bread for the table with burrata cheese (I believe?) (I'm forgetting what it's called) that is also to die for. They also have a super delicious kale salad if you're looking for something lighter. I think this restaurant is perfect for all sorts of occasions; casual, special occasion, drinks and small bites - you can really do it all here and in style ;)

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short rib radiatori - one of the best things I&#39;ve ever eaten!

qVkE4DSInbFqimG6lNunmw.text: Luckily my family had a RSVP for 7:15pm on a Friday night.  It was packed with people inside/outside & many groups waiting to be seated.  We walked right up and not soon after we were seated right next to the kitchen.  My son had fun watching them prepare food.  I ordered a glass of red sangria & it was delish.  First we ordered the white truffle garlic bread.  It was so good especially with the ricotta spread.  When the food arrived the portions looked small but not after you dig in, it's actually a lot.  I ordered the house specialty- Bolognese & I can see why people love it because it was the best I've ever had.  The pasta is so fresh because it's made there.  My hubby & son had the spaghetti & meatballs & they loved every bite.  Our waitress was really good & made sure to come by constantly to check up on us.  We'll be back especially with our $10 off 20 reward from signing up for emails!

NEinxGnN8iZg95wdBa7d2A.text: SUCH A BEAUTIFUL RESTAURANT HANDS DOWN! It has an open floor plan with open windows & doors. It's very well decorated & food is delicioussssss!! Staff is also very hands on and are great when it comes to recommendations. We tried a solid amount of the menu & I was pleased with all of our choices. I would just wish that the zucchini chips be a little bigger, because they're very small if that is possible. However, the taste is still incredible! The calamari is cooked uniquely, and I actually prefer this way better!

VhGPl46wTMi-DP3PG6KRpQ.text: Some of the best pizza I've ever had, and I eat a lot of pizza! The dough is freshly made in house and you can def taste the difference. I ordered the pig pizza and all of the meats in the pizza tasted so fresh, not like processed cold cuts! I would definitely recommend it, paired with a nice Bellini

W_wrmTVUtu9FG_qT6VQa1w.text: This place is always solid for food quality but can be inconsistent on service. I love the food here the pasta is always amazing. I love the salad the seasonal salad currently has two types of cheese beets and kale lettuce mix. I added salmon for extra protein and it was so good the dressing is light and flavorful. I like wines here there are many and at every price point. I ways opt to sit on the patio they have many heaters and is comfortable all year.

2uxF_InquXqls21pqrOhSA.text: First time here celebrating my girlfriends birthday. We made our reservation for 8 but ended in staying with 14 people, they were so accommodating even down to children's high chairs and booster seats. Food was so delicious! And we didn't have to wait long with our big party. Happy hour is awesome!!!! Gosia  was a great server and she even helped adding people to our reservation she was so pleasant and willing to please! Good experience!

tu5xwW0BGgCjVcPniBTh8Q.text: YUP.  North Italia is fancy-ish Italian food that manages to not be pretentious. I'd call it reasonably upscale. (Did I just create a new restaurant category? You're welcome world.)  Their cocktails are on point - and the bartenders are willing to modify them a bit if you're not into sugar (that's right, we keto all day and night). Same with the food, actually - don't want those starchy carbs? No problem, they'll sub in some broccolini right quick.  Everything we've had here has been solid. I won't get into specific dishes, you can chat up your server, but I've been impressed with all the food we've ordered and shared.  The only downside is that the most recent time we came here, the services was...definitely lacking. Our server went MIA for a solid 15 minutes while we were sitting waiting for the bill to come. (Hey, maybe they're trying to emulate Italy, where you have to seriously flag someone down to get the check.) Aside from that one snafu, all is well with North Italia.   It's a great place for a Sunday evening dinner with friends - not quite the ridiculousness of a Sunday Funday, but like...ok we have work tomorrow so we can't get too crazy, but I'm definitely still taking an Uber home.

eyVMwF5x-j2iRvTiK7039g.text: So I am a little late to the party, but glad I waited for everyone else to check this place out first. What a great new addition to the neighborhood and a fantastic locals spot.   The Birthday Club met up to celebrate again and this was the chosen restaurant. We arrived and scored a nice table towards the back of the large and open dining space. Our server was Keith and he was ready to take our drink order as soon as we sat down. Thanks to Ania K, we enjoyed a pitcher of Sangria. So refreshing and easy to drink on this beautiful Saturday evening.   We decided to have a small appetizer and selected the mushroom risotto arancini. So tasty the red sauce was, just extraordinary. Keith let us know that all the sauces are made in house (Score!). My friends ordered the Strozzapreti pasta and the Chicken Pesto pasta. I specifically ordered the Diver Scallops served on a bed of sweet corn risotto, asparagus, crispy shallots and pancetta gremolata. I had heard that this was really tasty and I was in the mood for scallops!  This place is busy and has a choice of patio seating or indoor seating. It is loud and this is what you would expect from an Italian restaurant. The restaurant is open air but the air conditioning was working fine! I really liked the hustling going on from the staff making sure that everyone had what they needed in terms of food and drink. I sensed a strong team environment which was great to witness.  Our entrees arrived pretty quickly after we ordered and we all chowed down. My entree was so flavorful and the scallops were so juicy! The sweet corn risotto was a nice compliment to the scallops. My only negative comment is that they only gave me four scallops, very little asparagus but a whole lot of risotto. For the price, I would have expected at least six scallops. I still enjoyed my dinner but I have to confess that I was still kinda hungry when I left. My friend loved her dish the Strozzapreti which  featured chicken, roasted mushrooms, spinach, toasted pine nut and parmesan cheese. My other friend did not enjoy her dish as much which was the Chicken Pesto. She expressed it had too much pesto in the sauce for her liking. All the while we were still enjoying the amazing Sangria!  We topped dinner off with dessert of course! I had some yummy chocolate/sea salt caramel gelato and my friends enjoyed the Salted Caramel Budino. The desserts were a winner for all.   I was so glad we sat indoors as a huge dust storm hit right around the time we were enjoying dessert. We just sat back and watched everyone come inside from the patio as dust was everywhere outside.  Will I return? Most definitely! I need to try their HH and experience more of their dishes! Glad you are here North Italia, we have needed a comfortable, hip Italian spot in this part of town for a while!

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HiamqM0wnY9HjEa7y8qCjw.text: The Roasted Cauliflower was great, however the Customer service was a mess. Never got a chance to order after waiting 30min I decided to walk over to P.F.Changs.

CN-1o0AR_isdPiucKU9tvA.text: I have been here for lunch and dinner. The outside seating is absolutely wonderful. The spaghetti was exactly what you would expect, nothing special. I had some issues getting information over the phone, I was placed on hold 3 times and the hostess ended up giving me absolutely wrong information over the phone regarding the menu. Maybe she was new. Sunday's have half off wine, wow! Overall, I would recommend to locals.

5XBiTuzNYRLmmxaQt9eXOg.text: This is the worst experience I have ever came across. More sore cause it was my birthday. I even had balloons from my wife. We were seated fast but the service was horrible. It took ten minutes before some came to the table. She just ask if we been help. Said no then turn around ask the table next to us. She then help them out. At that point my wife and i got up. Right when we dis that a server asked how she can help. Said too late. As we walked out the same host said thank you for coming in. Really

76keLYmLWyAcX7JdLqUxPQ.text: I went here for the first time the other day and I fell in love with North Italia! Between the ambience, food, and service; everything was perfect! We absolutely adored our server, Gosia! She was attentive, fast, and full of personality. Although it was a full house, she personally made sure that we thoroughly enjoyed our time there and our waters were always full! I'm thankful she asked if it was our first time dining there because everything on the menu sounded amazing but she shared her knowledge with us and served as the ideal guide during our experience! We ordered the chef's board (charcuterie board) as an appetizer as it was discounted thanks to the happy hour! I had the burrata tortelloni and my boyfriend ordered the chicken parmesan. The cheese inside of my tortellini and the sauce was out of this world. While the chicken parmesan is something you can find anywhere, North Italia's variation of this dish is the best we've ever had! I like that they served it with a side of pasta in a white, creamy sauce so you get the best of both worlds! The complimentary bread served at this restaurant is top notch as well. Our server recommended a couple of desserts, I was blown away by the tiramisu and salted caramel budino. Considering the extraordinary service and food, we will definitely return as much as possible to try the rest of the menu! I'm already planning what to try next! My boyfriend and I were very impressed!!

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chef&#39;s Board!
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burrata Tortelloni!
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Parmesan!

kEaXJejg18jcugAs7gOuew.text: Never got a chance to try the food because we had a reservation and couldn't be seated. Our reservation was on Valentine's Day for 7:45 PM and we arrived at 7:25 to check in early. They told us we would probably be seated at 8:30 because they were behind because people were not getting up fast enough to accommodate for the reservations coming in. We specifically picked 7:45 because we did not want to get home too late because we had to wake up early the next day.  Basically, we are disappointed with the service we got because the only option that they offered us for the inconvenience is that we could cancel our reservation. They were apologetic, but never took responsibility for the fact that they clearly overbooked their restaurant knowing how busy it would get.   Sadly, we really wanted to try this restaurant but we will not be coming here again due to the unwillingness to right the inconvenience that was created for us. They wanted us to cancel our reservation on Valentine's Day as the only solution! Thankfully Honey Salt was able to get us in pretty quickly and they were also very busy, so we ended up calling and canceling at North Italia without an offer of anything to compensate for the overbooking.

0I7XnWBcUAcVSbW3WTWCLA.text: I stopped by with my boyfriend this past weekend to have a drink before meeting up with friends.  The restaurant is beautifully decorated and is the perfect place to meet up and socialize with friends.  There's plenty of open seating at the bar and the patio and bar area are very welcoming.  We didn't eat, but were told that all of the pasta are made in house.  We definitely look forward to coming back to try out the food!

Br9GyJr9AEa1Xk1GYqQYlw.text: Came here Aug. 28th with my boo for our date night. I have to say I love the setting of the restaurant. From the adorable flowers on the table to how picturesque everything looked. The service was good and the servers were kind and on point with refilling our beverages. We didn't wait long for our food. The food were flavorful and different from other Italian restaurants I've been to. The prices were decent and definitely priced accurately for the service, atmosphere, and food. But the main reason I finally decided to give a review on this place is their truffle bread as a starter! I strongly recommend them. It was a bit too oily but oh my goodness they were absolutely delicious! I couldn't get enough of this tasty dish with so much flavor,  I am still raving about it until now. I also am a "sweet-tooth connoisseur" (jkay, I love sweets) so their desserts were very delicious. I definitely would visit again!   [Side note: TIP YOUR SERVERS! It's common courtesy. When we receive good service and experience, we like to tip our servers more than 20%]

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kFGI-Je9tGAcvAOziyTD7A.text: I rarely use my yelp but I felt this was necessary! Gosia was such an exceptional waitress to our group. We felt she was so patient with us when we weren't sure what to order. She walked us through the menu and made us feel like we were at her own home! Detailed, aware, and filled with hospitality. The food that she recommended was phenomenal, she really understood what we wanted and more! The restaurant was quite busy, however the entrees still came out promptly. The strozzapretti and truffle bread were particularly delicious. Thank you Gosia!

wQw0ywJU_H_cPhiWp7YFLw.text: Last Friday was our first trip to North Italia with friends and we could not be happier. The Happy Hour is absolutely wonderful and the ambience is spectacular. We had the Board and Bottle for Happy Hour and the 4 of us couldn't finish it and the scallops were so tender. Kristal came over to see how we were and was so sweet. We will be back most likely this weekend.

9A-0bDOgFxFG5PB7hT6e0A.text: North Italia is the cutest restaurant with incredible food. A great find on the outskirts of The Strip. I highly recommend. When the waiter tells you that you can't go wrong with anything on the menu, they mean it. The whole menu is delicious. We order the Zucca Chips (amazing), the garlic bread (amazing), Strozzapreti (amazing), and Spaghetti and Meatballs (also amazing). This is Italian the way it should be. They are also accommodating as I got the spaghetti and meatballs without meatballs because I'm vegetarian. In addition, the inside is so cute and artsy, I love it. All in all, a wonderful little find and I highly recommend.

mTXmhzLtIX9IkGMNgE_N4g.text: Food is still delicious but the portions are 1/2 of what the used to be. I ordered the arugula and avocado salad and couldn't find the avocados.

v3XlOlK8w33a8MyifXrgxg.text: As much as I love the food here, everything else sucks. Employees stand around talking to one another, no attention given to customers at ALL. I've been here about 6 or 7 times and always have the same issues but somehow always have a change of heart to give it another try. Nope, probably not coming back again.   Today's experience:  Arrived at 3:10  Three employees walked by with "someone will be with you in a minute" 25 minutes later, it's 3:35 I get a drink order It's now 4:05 and I get someone to finally see us (table of two) and ask if we are ready. YES WE HAVE BEEN READY FOR OVER HALF AN HOUR  I don't know if the service just sucked for us because we are younger or because the employees simply don't care. It's frustrating when your starving and this is the service industry where you get no actual service. Two stars for the food but three missing for the crappy service. The bad outweigh the good here.   Hope this helped someone. If you're starving, don't come here because you'll probably pass out before you get to order.

vgyK3pRT_24Wkw1fj-4iyg.text: Walking in, the ambience was ideal for a date. My boyfriend and I share the same birthday (February 18) so we did a weekend getaway to Vegas and found this gem!!!! The food was divine and the service was prompt! Our server, Sebastian, was able to give us great guidance and was especially helpful in pairing some fun cocktails with our dishes. I highly recommend the "Bolognese pasta" or the funghi pizza, the onions were a perfect addition and the roasted mushrooms topped it off! both were perfectly made! Thanks again Sebastian! We hope to come back soon!

CjJAWoJZNSP2m1qX9J8wdA.text: Nice restaurant.  Food is always well done and service is usually good.  My only complaint is the salad portions.  Came for lunch last week and had the chopped chicken salad for $15.  It was delicious but literally had about 5-6 bites before it was gone.  Left just as hungry as I showed up.  Would be nice if they served a portion that was more like a meal instead of a side.

7UqMrR2Y58Melj2MKv9ZYQ.text: The happy hour is rather amazing and so is their regular menu. Monday through Friday from 3pm-6pm. We stopped in after a friend told us about the great deal. You can get a a pitcher of sangria, or bottle of red/white wine with the chef charcuterie board for $20. The board is huge and is easily worth the price alone.   We had also ordered the margherita pizza, zucc chips, and two more bottles of wine from the happy hour menu. In addition, we ordered the burrata salad and the shaved vegetable salad. It was all delicious. The last salad and the chefs board were the stand outs.   We had also ordered 2 desserts. The hazelnut cake with salted caramel ice cream and the almond tart were both delicious. We also finished with the Last Great Wine Thief and their housemade raspberry lemoncello. If you are not down for solid desserts, the latter items are a perfect substitution.

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chef&#39;s board with wine on happy hour. $20

v2WHcIc3ooER9agxc5x3qQ.text: This place is good, a lot bigger inside then it looks from the outside. Great service

sDEmti6wi5tkIyCzVr2pPg.text: North Italia is amazing! We've heard about this new restaurant for a couple weeks now and haven't had a chance to go until tonight. The atmosphere is calming yet fun with a full bar and tvs. The wine list is impressive (I would recommend the Rose). We ordered the grilled artichoke and mussels for appetizers. I would definitely recommend the grilled artichoke. Tender, juicy, and SO FRESH. For entrees, we got the bolognese and rosemary chicken. Both were flavorful and well prepared. And finally, desert came around and we ordered the hazelnut torta. After talking to the manager, we found out the brownie in the torta was made from almond flour and completely grain free. Overall, North Italia deserves a 10/10 for its amazing service (especially Laura) and tasteful food.

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hazelnut Torta
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rosemary Chicken
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled Artichoke

FeyMtidOgmQxQXw66WSnfQ.text: Fortunately, I wasn't real hungry when we had dinner here on April 16th with some friends. This is not, in my opinion, anything approaching what you would consider as an "Upscale" eatery, but one more "strip mall chain/franchised restaurant".  But, you wouldn't think that was the case based on the food, I was served, nor the bill presented.   While the menu describes what sounds like a typical dinner entre accompanied by some starch and vegetables (check out their menu), what you get (in a "bowl", not on a plate), is skimpy, at best. The food itself was quite good actually, I had the DIVER SCALLOPS which were delicious, but cooked on a grill so hot they were crusted, and a little tough.    I ended up having to order bread in order to get 40-50 Carbohydrates, a necessity.  When I indicated to the waitress that I needed to order some bread for the Carbs, she "up sold" me the WHITE TRUFFLE GARLIC BREAD at $13.50, versus GRILLED BREAD & GOOD OLIVE OIL at $5 (she didn't even offer this choice).   As it turned out, while I probably wouldn't have spent $13.50 for "Bread", I have to say that the White Truffle Garlic Bread was delicious and I probably ate too much of it.    If you've got cash to burn, the food is OK, but if you're hungry, plan on ordering lots of extras.  As for the alcohol, I can't comment on cocktails, but you can buy lots of bottles of good wine for less than they get for a glass of their House wines.    As for the pricing, we love Italian food and dine often at several Non-Franchise/Chain Italian restaurants in the Phoenix, AZ region.  All of these restaurants are equal to, or exceed the quality of the dining area/restaurant, the food, and the ambiance, but none even approach the cost of dining at North Italia.  I know the restaurant business is a tough one, and we'll just have to wait and see if this one survives.  Will we return??  TBD!  UPDATE (4/27/19): Tim Stealing, General Manager of this North Italia location (I presume), reached out as reflected in his comments posted below.  This speaks well as to North Italia's view on customer relations, and how customers view their experience dining here.  I will withhold my decision on returning here until another time, considering Tim's comments, and the likelihood that I would pass along any Gift Card to the friends we dined with here (while we visit friends here often, we are not local to this area), and wait to see what their experience is.  In response to Tim's reaching out, I have updated this Review, and included additional observations, along with correcting a little grammar.

BJ8Tw7xpl9cOCTyCm3qiUQ.text: Had a wonderful experience at this neighborhood restaurant. Great happy hour prices, a bottle of wine and a pizza for $20. The Zucca chips were thinly sliced, crispy and perfectly seasoned. The black mussels were tasty and a hefty portion for the price. Will definitely return to try more menu items because the service was great. The staff were friendly and attentive.

BHjZXEYdtuPSCJqwwmnPkQ.text: My hubby and I stumbled upon this place one Sunday afternoon.  We decided to stop in for a light lunch.    The inside of this place is beautiful.  It is very open, and there is a spacious patio as well.  The kitchen is in a glass room, which is pretty cool.  Service was extremely bland when we came in.  Our server pretty much lacked a personality.  The food was also pretty bland.  We ordered the calamari appetizer.  It was served with greens, which was an interesting twist on a calamari appetizer.  However there was no sauce, which was odd.  So we asked for a side of lemon aioli.  The calamari itself was chewy, not very good.  I ordered the the bacon and egg pizza, which came with asparagus, potatoes, garlic confit, and rosemary.  The rosemary was overpowering which pretty much ruined the dish.  My husband just ordered their daily soup, which was a chicken vegetable soup.  This was the best thing we had.    Maybe we ordered the wrong things.. Who knows! But I see no reason to return.

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lovely ambience
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu

rFhYhd1Y66t8A2eBsTw1Cg.text: Made reservations for Valentines Day on Saturday Night to ensure a decent dinner time...715pm. Upon arrival there was a large crowd outside. As we checked in we where told it would be a 45 min wait for our table. This is a poor way of handling customers and reservations. At this point we either stay and wait or take a gamble of finding any other place on Valentines Night for Dinner.  So far not off to a great start at a customer here. Only explanation is people are sitting longer. I think that sitting tables and collecting money is more of a priority then doing the honorable thing by honoring people's already made reservations. I can understand 15 min but 45 is inexcusable.

VXrIEJ8-jc0C9zbcon_kVw.text: A must for your local rotation! We stumbled upon this restaurant one night when we were headed to another spot in the plaza. We saw that this place was way more lively, so we went in and grabbed a seat at the bar outside - just in time for a happy hour pitcher of sangria. Since then, we've been back four times in two months! The Caesar salad is amazing, the fish is so good, and when we finally had pasta, it was perfection. The cocktails are also really really good. Happy every time!

KCoQga0HzOBpnpBuBjOBmQ.text: I know this is a country-wide chain and I was skeptical because in Houston it just isn't that great. BUT the one here is outstanding! Great location for us in summerlin, excellent indoor/outdoor seating. Food is ALWAYS great and consistent, service is great, happy hour rocks! All about that cheeseboard mmmm

mGqrVmIQZJpKXh_WGFnLGA.text: Went back in hopes of some improvement and well... probably never will again.  Service was significantly better but sadly the food was not. Somehow the kitchen seems to have gotten confused with the crispy calamari. When we used to get it the arugula would be dressed but of course not the calamari and so the calamari would remain crispy. These last two times they have poured the dressing over everything and the result is very soggy calamari. The other items we ordered were also not great, but because the crispy calamari was always our favorite that was the most disappointing.

BDKNh_-G7FNntgvui6jlSw.text: First time here and Bonnie made our visit so special with her amazing customer service skills and awesome personality !!!! She was very informative about the restaurant as well ! Def coming back .. great food and great customer service

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg and bacon pizza
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg and Bacon Pizza !!! Very tasty and light !

VjRUx8FIhUybmOpylFCwAA.text: I've been wanting to come here since they opened and was able to visit, twice, within 2 weeks. The first visit was for dinner with a group of 5 and the second visit was for Sunday brunch. It seems like no matter what time of day, North Italia is always packed.  I love the open seating area and how the bar area opens to the patio. Bathrooms are well lit and clean. Tons of seating on the patio with heaters. The host never wrote down our name but was able to remember who was next and sat us within a reasonable amount of time... although they could have given us a quote. The host just said we'll seat you soon.   I wasn't offered bread my first visit but the second visit, the server did offer. It comes with butter and a side of olive oil and balsamic. What I did not like was that there weren't any plates given for us to eat the bread on. Not a big deal since we just dug right in.   The common theme here seems to be a long wait for food.... no matter how big or small your group or what you order. The most recent visit, my bf and I ordered a short rib hash and short rib pasta. It took 40 minutes for the food to come out and our server apologized multiple times. When the food came out... it was very disappointing.  4/5 short rib hash ($14) if I can remember correctly, it had a few pieces of arugula, some red peppers, 3 pieces of short rib & was seasoned very well. A little on the spicy side. The bf thought it had some chorizo in it but it didn't. The grilled bread that came with the dish was burnt so I didn't try eating it but it looked good (minus being burnt). It had grated Parmesan on top. The short rib was super soft and complimented the mashed potatoes well. The hash wasn't like a traditional hash browns, the potatoes were probably boiled, mashed a bit and then fried.   2/5: short rib pasta ($20)- my bf ordered this and we should have ordered an appetizer and a salad along with it. Not sure if they give out smaller portions during lunch vs dinner or what but it was comparable to a kids portion of pasta at other restaurants. He had 5 pieces of short rib in his pasta which I thought was a decent amount. It was garnished with arugula and shaved Parmesan. I wish our server had told us that the portion size of this dish is on the small side. Their pastas are made fresh daily so it's good! A bit chewy but not over cooked. And the sauce reminded me of an Alfredo sauce but not too creamy.  The first time I came here, my friend ordered the squid ink pasta. He's not allergic to tomatoes but had a strong dislike for it... he had one bite and decided to not eat it because it came with a tomato/wine sauce (per our server). We set it aside and our server did not offer to bring another menu or switch out his dish until after everyone was done eating! I however, did like the squid ink pasta. I love their pastas here even though serving size could be worked on.   Another friend ordered their scallops and I thought the serving size was spot on, but it was too salty for the table to enjoy.   North Italia is a good date spot, and has a really good happy hour. Pizza OR cheese board AND a bottle of wine for only $20?! Count me in for the happy hour but if I had to pay full price for their dishes... I think I'll pass.

3YT-Q7Wefq-lSIjiUa9h2A.text: This is a definite must eat!!  Service and food and drink selection are outstanding.   Make a reservation to guarantee a seat.

JarvMdGqxZqU9oZcI8LMyw.text: This is a pass for me.  After living in NY and having great Italian at your fingertips this is a let down.  This basic Italian with big price tags.  Don't get me wrong basic is important but prosciutto that was dry and salty is old, over cooked pasta, and a flavorless meat sauce left something to desired.  The staff was busy and intermittently helpful. It is fine and some would think it is great but not for me

zLSZTnpLiZDrc-dfJFuqXA.text: My husband and I have gone here twice for date night. Both times were excellent. They have vegetarian options for me and meat options for the husband.  For appetizers, it's hit and miss on whether the one you choose will be available. I've tried and failed twice to get the artichoke appetizer and I really want to try it.  We have tried the zuca chips, which are yummy but the portion is probably enough for 3-4 people. Also their truffle garlic bread is AH-MAZ-ING! You must try it at least once! My husband had some mussels or clams and enjoyed them. You can also get a basket of bread but it's never just brought out, you have to ask.  We both tried the spaghetti and it was delicious and I felt the like portion was perfect when having appetizers too.  The desserts were ok. Nothing terribly special, the wine was good, but my husband wasn't overly excited with the beer selection. He did try an interesting coffee beer though.  Overall, great atmosphere, wonderful staff and delicious food! Worth the visit.

fAfHvQNtkNY6EJkCvb2WXg.text: Came here on a whim for happy hour, but ended up with a lot more than we expected. Started off with the amazing $20 bottle of wine and pizza of the day which was amazing. I always judge how good a pizza is by if i want to eat the crust at the end... well i did, so good sign! Our amazing server entered the wrong item so the chef asked him to go ahead and bring it to us which was this awesome display of deliciousness in the pic. We then ordered the burrata cheese appetizer. I've had burrata at other places before and I will sadly have to say this wasn't my favorite. I can not place my finger on what it was that didn't work well for me with the dish, but it lacked something. We ended our meal with the Carmel dessert. It was amazing!! We literally should have ordered our own. To top it off, I love the venue super trendy and well lit. Good vibe and our server knocked it out of the park! Yes i know... i should have gotten his name.

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UenrVmVckFNnK5jtLZ0LEQ.text: We went to North Italia last night for the first time. We couldn't believe how busy it was due to the fact that they just recently opened. We were seated within 25 minutes. The space is open and fresh. It was bustling with activity inside and so I would not recommend the inside seating if  need a quiet place to discuss business or are looking for a quiet romantic dinner.  HOWEVER, they do have outdoor seating and that would probably be perfect.    My husband and I shared the Chicken Parmesan and the meatball appetizer which comes with the most delicious bread and sauce.  The chicken Parmesan was the best we have ever had. The pasta that they serve with it is creamy and delicious. This is our new favorite place for Italian and we can't wait to go back!  Thank you for opening in Summerlin!

g9lSZjgfG7bhsUfTbw85Ew.text: This was the place to be on Friday night...packed to the gills and the food was best I've had in awhile. We had the garlic truffle bread which is served in a small cast iron skillet, the diver scallops on a bed of lemon risotto with butternut squash and the house bolognese which was load with a ton of meat with good fennel flavor. Lastly we ordered the affogatto with salted caramel, the salted caramel bundino, and a jump start

p-e9E8lrTKS2xyPJwra-RA.text: We've been here twice, first we tried an array of appetizers: White Truffle Bread with house-made ricotta (delish) Arancini, we much prefer the ones from Settebello at Village Square.  Crispy Calamari is good, you need to eat it before it cools so it stays crunchy! Our second visit we tried the house special Bolognese and the Chicken Pesto. The Chicken Pesto was the winner hands down! Incredible, but be forewarned...it is a VERY rich dish. We promised to split the plate next time. Great atmosphere, wonderful service and a nice array of good quality food. You can't lose !

h0AsEgThg-nTmovZaMCv-Q.text: First visit tonight, we picked up a couple things for  dinner and desert. Pleasantly surprised it was all there and packaged nicely. And!! It was great! We had the Pesto chicken pasta, the Bolognese, will have it again but we want to go in next time. Also, we splurged on the Hazelnut Torte and the Bombolinis....3 words...to die for!  I want the Torte for my birthday and the Bombolinis every Sunday morning with coffee!

J-138K2bX16GnOaiS3utbA.text: Holy crap! Just go here. Just shut up and go. Don't bitch about the wait. Hire someone to wait in line for you if you hate waiting, I'm sure there's an app for that. Or make reservations but at least at the moment of writing this review you have to book two weeks out.   I don't throw around the word 'love' loosely. I love my wife, I love making love (to my wife), and I love this restaurant. If I could do all three at the same time without raising the attention of local law enforcement, I would.

mmxbLWEPqnjkpdhKGPPxDw.text: Had great experience the first time with a waiter that unfortunately wasn't there this time... Tonight's dinner, service was mediocre at best. Had a bottle of champagne, waitress opened it and never showed up again to pour. Food served without the forks she had taken away after the appetizer and didn't replace... then she showed up 3 times during dessert asking if we wanted anything else, obviously to give us the check, as if she had a plane to catch, so I asked for the check that came faster than the forks or the pouring ever did. Still gave 15% tip to be decent ...  even 10% would have been too much... we had plenty of attitude tough. No mas...

f949_ajyU-4QphH4VQn72Q.text: Perfect ! Thank you FOX Restaurant Group !! Delightful Happy Hour and excellent customer service . Welcome to the Neighborhood . Fig Pizza , great wine and now dessert  I will be back and back and back

5rqtNm9lsrgWRmRaoW2cYg.text: Stopped in on a Wednesday afternoon, sat at bar and was greeted by bartender. Asked for a house glass of pinot grigrio bartender told me it was not happy hour yet? Odd since I did not ask about happy hour, so ordered a chicken salad and wine. Sat at bar for about 5 minutes with water, finally asked him for my wine and a black napkin. Got the wine never got the black napkin. Salad came asked for bread. As I was eating a server? Not sure really what he was came up to me and said my chef said you got the wrong salad. Mind you I am eating the salad. Told him i was good with the salad i got.  Bartender came over and said oh I like that salad better and I know I ordered the right one as he checks my bill.  Friendly staff, clean place and overall will go back.

GVYy9VaUB9I4Bxgnu-wWGw.text: Horrible manager in an otherwise great restaurant. I brought a party of 12 and spent $900 only to be treated horribly by the manager, Crystal. Our server, Shayda, was excellent. The food and wine were excellent.  Sadly, all of this was soured by an inattentive, unhelpful manager.  To begin with, when I asked Crystal to fix our wobbly table, she disappeared for over 10 minutes. We then fixed the table ourselves after the Prosecco was poured to prevent sloshing drinks. When she finally appeared, she was snippety with us for fixing the table. I had purchased e-gift certificates online and called ahead to confirm I could use them via my smart phone. I had been assured this would not be a problem, so I took screen shots of them. Sadly, Crystal was responsible for processing the certificates for our server and added to the awful experience by taking forever while we waited. Frankly we missed a big part of our Cirque show because of Crystal's slow service. Even worse, Crystal must have inaccurately processed one of the certificates claiming it didn't work. When I insisted she try again, it worked fine. Further, when another certificate only showed the barcode with its number cropped, she refused to process it. Crystal stated they weren't a retail store with a bar code reader. I understand if the certificates were cumbersome for her, however, she just had such an awful attitude about it and toward me that is my biggest issue. She was neither helpful nor friendly about it. Such an awful experience I actually cursed at her at the end which I never do. On a positive note, when I tipped our server in cash while leaving, she was pleasant and apologetic.

ENYKae3cSnxjzMQd8w152A.text: This is probably my favorite spot so far for brunch. You walk in and the restaurant is so calming with neutral decor. They have alfresco dinning so that's a plus for me. We shared the Prosciutto Brucheta appetizer it was so delicious. My husband had the Baked French toast and I had their Egg Sandwich accompanied by a glass of Bellini, It was super yummy. This is the perfect place for a girls day out. Thank you to Jacqueline for the great service. You made our first time here a good great one.
