mwXpxDctSaD-cDAQZethmg.text: The food here is absolutely amazing !!!   Had the squid ink pasta where the pasta dough is mixed with squid ink and cooked in a spicy, tomato base sauce!   The fig prosciutto pizza was my favorite !!! The mix of sweetness from the sauce and figs makes a perfect combination with the goat cheese on top!   Also had the calamari for an appetizer and it was very crunchy and tasty with that zesty flavor!   For desserts the hazelnut torta with salted caramel gelato on top, very very delicious and most of all the Salted caramel budino was to die for !!!  For alcoholic beverages , I tried the julietta (floral light refreshing cocktail ) matched well with the mussels appetizer according to the friend i dined with , the sangria was really tasty and just the right amount of sweetness, apricot cocktail  was refreshing too , and most of all the Apple bourbon cocktail was my favorite !! Very soothing and warms the insides really good and the flavor was just cinnamon and Apple and barely taste the bourbon but will feel it later .   The service was great and the servers were attentive ! Overall I will come back and dine here again !!!

036uPTn_kxhY1J1WL36tjg.text: Im only giving one star because I HAVE TO!  Strike 1 - we waited almost 45 min after the hostess ensured we will only wait 15. NOT COOL   Strike 2 - its my gf birthday and we would of loved a nice romantic dinner with great Italian wine upon arrival to the table the server approached us rushed and almost scared lol. (I remember my first day) given we are easy so we gave em time after almost 20min for even ordering wine the server had no Italian wine knowledge and recomened a domestic wine I forgot what it was but for 80$ I would of rather has something exotic  Strike 3 - our food was cold at this point we were just over it for being a chain restaurant  they sure choked and we almost did too with the chewy Calamari then how is a pizza even cold dont you cook it 1st ? So confused!  Chicken parm was soggy like it was sitting in sauce really disappointed for this place Will post pictures soon!!!!!  I'll have to try the new Italian place at redrock.

6uKDUUIREKnwZ2JtrblniA.text: This restaurant did not disappointed from the excellent service to the excellent food. We got the meatballs which were in this wonderful tomato sauce!! The meatballs consistency was perfect blend. Then we got the garlic truffle bread... omg I cannot express how delicious this garlic bread tasted, then I ordered the margarita pizza which I was so full from the other food I could only eat s couple of bites. But... it was fabulous  I'm going to go back on Sunday to try their Home made pasta and 1/2 price wine bottle. We told the mgr  About our excellent service and we said he was going to buy our server dinner tonight! I love that recognition.

pXwPZTsiz6q7ds_uXkP04w.text: Should've done this review right away, because i forgot what I ordered, but it was pizza and pasta and it was tasty and felt light considering what we were eating. It was very well prepared, the atmosphere was nice and staff was friendly.

FESfF_ZZ2_2ArT50Ky0rAQ.text: Love this place ! Beautiful outdoor covered seating and their happy hour menu is the best ! Pizza and a whole bottle of wine for $20 . Meat and cheese boards for $10. Great food and environment !

jDAWg6MZ2Zzc_EGboATfoQ.text: This place has great ambiance an amazing happy hour the food is so fresh and super yummy our waiter Gabriel was awesome can't wait to go back and try more items on the menu

12X3Wn9XPZPXLSNqvtYkBA.text: Celebrated my wife's 50th for late lunch early dinner today. We were first time visitor because of recommendation from friends. All I can say is WOW! Great wine superb food and wait staff! Prices were also very reasonable! We will be back many times!

oQt0wu43npMpFA058wCPbA.text: We dined here for my mother's birthday and we are completely disappointed by this restaurant in so many ways. We were a party of 10 and ordered appetizers which took 40 mins to come out. It was very slow service for a Thursday night then we waited another 30 mins for 2 meals to be brought out. During all of the waiting our waiter nor the manager came to apologize for the wait and let us know the food would be out shortly. Then they brought out two meals. By the time two more meals were brought out the first two people were done eating. It's no fun to go out to eat and to wait over an hour for food and then have to watch one person eat Bc they don't want to wait any longer. Not to mention the last two meals brought out were the salads. Still no apology for the slow service. We brought our own cake and the server brought out small plates once we already ate the cake then came back later and said my manager would like to give you some complimentary desserts.... we just ate cake ... no thank you. Still no apology. Brought out the bill no apology and took off one little appetizer for the horrible service. Not to mention we had some other waitress who brought us food and was so snotty and rude about the slow service. Anyways ended the night and never once saw or heard from the manager. How the manager handles situations like these speaks volumes of the restaurant. Needless to say we won't be going back. Over priced Italian food with terrible service.

u8BggWjEl1OkA8VXsSmtYw.text: Everything tasted so fresh and handmade. Kind of has a  upscale hipster vibe but still casual enough that I can bring my family too.

Fw9mXWl2-KL6ylKONNzmHg.text: I came here with my coworkers for a work lunch. We were greeted instantly and treated with great service the whole time!!! The atmosphere is great. They have several amazing, lovely plants on several wall, and the outdoor area is very green too!! Food was delicious. The manager, Cole, made sure we felt welcome and taken care of. Would highly recommend eating at North :)

_gj43Io4Awd9-kj-RAtMQA.text: I love Italian style food. This place completely satisfies me. For anyone to give less than a 5 star review must be an anomaly. Our first visit was a total joy and we'll be returning soon.   Started out with the Chef's board...a delightful assortment of cheese, meat, veggies, bread and more and a great way to begin the meal. The short rib radiatori deserves its highly reviewed reputation...really good, and the burrata tortellini is equally delicious.   Decor is modern and open but the large crowd made it a little on the loud side. Service was friendly and prompt considering that it was very busy.   Prices are fair considering the quality of the food and uniqueness of the menu.   As I've told a number of people...you gotta try this place.

9cRIsi7de0e0Sy2mwYSQ8w.text: Good food and a good atmosphere. The staff was very friendly and really liked their jobs!  Need to get some coconut rum in stock!

kPZf4oioIa8ddjrxUIlkPw.text: This was my second time dining at North Italia.  The first time was the week they opened (Dec 2017) and the service was very slow, but my friend & I decided to give it a second chance in hopes that the slow service back then was due to how new they were.  Well, lets just say the service is still slow (entrees were served 1 hour after we were seated) and our server lacked basic customer service.    He was very friendly; however, I ordered the potato, sausage & kale soup as an appetizer (their featured item he told me about), but he brought me tomato soup. While he had the soup in front of me, he explains that the featured items he mentioned were incorrect.  I felt that I was not given a choice to decline the soup (I was really looking forward to the soup I ordered) as he had it in front of me while telling me what happened (keep in mind we were still charged for his mistake).  The food was okay.  Nothing to really rave about.  Usually, a spoon would be served with spaghetti and meatballs; however, we only had forks & knives.  When our server bought us the bill, he placed it right in front of me assuming that I was paying.  I know this review is mainly about an individual's customer service; however, this is when management needs to train better on proper dining etiquette when hiring young servers.  After giving them a second chance, unfortunately, we will not be returning based on the lack of training and low food quality.

Ux0UMeYbyO9E9srhU2jssQ.text: The service staff seemed overwhelmed on a Wednesday evening, so I'd be hesitant to come back on a weekend night. I was with a party of 14 and the service was a little lacking, we really should have had two waiters instead of one. The food and drinks came at different rates making some of us  wonder if our orders were forgotten. I had to remind the server twice about my wine. I guess they don't do bread service? Strange for an Italian restaurant, especially a busy one, where people have a long wait even with reservations. Dessert wasn't offered or mentioned before the checks were arrived, perhaps they were in a hurry to turn the table. And one last thing, they pour wine from little wine carafes into your wine glass which is inefficient for their volume and yet they don't offer freshly grated Parmesan for your pasta at the table. If asked, they will drop off two plastic cups; one of granulated Parmesan and one of dried chili flakes like a common pizza joint. I'm not sure they have their priorities straight and it seems incongruous to their prices and semi high-end menu offerings. All of us at the table were a little surprised by that. But this is a chain restaurant so many things won't really be authentic anyway, I suppose.  Their star specialty, the bolognese pasta was very good. The fresh pasta makes a difference. Everything else I tasted was a little on the salty and oily side. Not sure I'll be back soon, maybe later when/if they've ironed out their service weaknesses.

55bkTSb2SQikhXOoM8G8kg.text: Solid 3 Stars.     Eating at bar.  Bartenders smiling but not looking at empty glasses.    Asking if dinner ok.   Servers lost completely.    Our 5th time here so gonna be fair.    Solid 3/5.    Rosemary chicken dry.  Italian choices kinda "flavorless".   We are probably out in the future as there are better choices nearby.    Probably a great place tho to get a drink and people watch.

Kgs5GqEn9LB5OTgqURTfxQ.text: Excellent service and delicious food! First time here and all 4 of us loved our food! Pasta's, pizza, drinks and dessert! We will definitely be back!

M9X22pm5BneFkQEcZPIVKg.text: Northern style Italian..if you want a good sauce this is not the place in my opinion...Caesar salad awesome..

k_Z5e7XWzyHYfqRi9vX-Xw.text: I really love the food here. The open kitchen is very clean as are the bathrooms.   Now to the three star dings. The service could definitely be improved. It took 40 minutes to get a house cocktail delivered on the table despite asking three times. It was not swamped at this point in the day by any means. They didn't take it off the bill despite saying they would get the manager to do so. The food came out together for the most part. Sadly this bar issue is the second time it's happened.

UD7KsvV3UhKoSGpyDbTpSA.text: Great new spot in summerlin! Great ambience! Food was delicious! Calamari is excellent and the bolognese was fantastic! Red Sangria.....not my fav

YUF7panuQohOV7uklmy5pw.text: Love this place!!!  The service has gotten exponentially better pretty perfect place for a dinner!

tXSSP6PelYlkirtz7yiq2A.text: The food is unbelievable but service is very slow the atmosphere is pretty loud but I cannot tell you enough how good the food was

SZ_87KLVyNBtAieDTWUNLg.text: Lousy service. Sat people a head of us. Took extremely long to get a waiter. Couldn't find the Parmesan cheese. I guess they think they are too good to offer service.

QGnlG-6QvCwvFgvSQ4xuaA.text: Tried this restaurant over the weekend because it supposed to be one of the hottest places to go right now.... we were sat immediately that was a plus since our reservation was almost an hour ltr, our waiter was super nice and  l love the feeling that we were not been rush to leave after eating, now the food is good we ordered soup and caesar salad and and Two pizzas marguerite and bacon and egg everything was tasty and fresh maybe next time I'll try their pasta as for now is just an ok restaurant.

sCQFpeZsaJZNzxAcuClIiw.text: Every dish was excellent. Service was awesome. Will definitely be back. Only one small thing: on the menu it says the sangria comes in a pitcher with oranges and strawberries .., but in reality it is actually only a carafe with one slice of orange on the glass and no other fruit. I was disappointed when the carafe came, but it tasted so amazing even without fresh fruit that I would say order it anyway if you are a sangria lover. We ordered a second carafe for good measure. Regarding the food: Our table ordered many different dishes family style: pasta bolognese, kale salad, Caesar salad, roasted cauliflower, truffle garlic bread... all phenomenal. Tiramisu has crunchy chocolate bits on top - a nice variation on the texture. Love this place. Can't wait to go back.

dOkCrE3H1ec5DCWQzypA-g.text: Loved it! My daughter dropped by for dinner and we sat at the bar since there was a long wait. I usually don't like sitting at the bar but I had a great time. The bartenders were so cool and very accommodating. The food was awesome! I had the chicken pesto with pine nuts and it was a very fresh and zesty dish. My daughter had the bolognese but she was a bit disappointed because the portion was a bit small for the price. We both had a cocktail and they were also deelish. Going back and taking my BF with me.

I90LW0mb5SLta_ikZZkZXg.text: First time I went I liked it a whole lot better than the second. They put salami in almost all their dishes which is sort of odd. I recommend the rice balls and pizza but do not recommend the bolognese. I'll come here for pizza but if want Italian food I'm going to Mastrionis

T3JvOpBTr2-v0axemcuLSw.text: This is now my favorite local Italian restaurant. My Husband and I ordered 2 appetizers, 2 entrees, and 2 kids meals and all were amazing. We went back the very next day for more.

ovy8PPAYnmTBdlUtf4cVOw.text: I've been here a few times but after tonight it will be awhile before I go back.  Definite problems with the kitchen..after waiting almost an hour the first two dishes came out..they were almost finished before the third person was served. We were a party of ten so maybe they can't handle larger groups?? It took forever, the quality of the food has gone down since first opened...maybe it's a new manager?? I don't think she'll last long if tonight is any indication. She couldn't even be bothered to come and check on the situation I mean come on I've had a manager check on us at Chick-fil-a.

PMHZw2S3QwRn1wIGJ_RF2Q.text: This evening we were celebrating my brother-in-law's BD. Cynthia was our waitress. She was so attentive with our needs. I had brought a birthday cake to celebrate my brother-in-law BD. Without been reminded to Cynthia she brought the cake out with candles. How cool is that. We all thank her for her service. North Italia has been our friends and family favorite restaurant since it opened late last year.

V3Mvvg7ix0NHnXnQilwroQ.text: I kept hoping it would be better than the hype, but it wasn't. The food was a 4, decent but not fantastic.  Then the service came and it really was subpar. I kept hoping It would get better but unfortunately it never did. I don't think I would ever come back unless i was invited by someone else. It was too bad really.

tekb_yERegxcAtt9tN8I3w.text: Good italian food. Pizza was delicious, but squid ink pasta was disappointing. Everything else was great!

-Zx_oBjD76O-iZJ0leM8XQ.text: With 2 kids under 2, it is a rare event that my husband and I get to go on a date anymore, so when the grandparents offered to babysit so we could go on an early Valentines outing, I knew I wanted to pick somewhere special, without having to drive to the strip.  I could not believe how many reviews this place had after only being opened a short while, and all very good reviews!  Well let me tell you it was either the fact that a break form stay at home motherhood would have made a McDonalds date night a 5 star experience, or this place truly is amazing, and deserves all of these rave reviews! :-) It was quite busy for arriving at 4:30 and by the time we left at 6 there was already people waiting outside for a table. We started with the truffle garlic bread. I thought, how can garlic bread be any different than from any other italian place?, but oh it oh it can be! This was wonderful! For my main meal I had the short rib pasta which was pretty much perfection, and my husband had the pig pizza and the chicken parm. which he said he really liked. I tried the pasta that came with the chicken and it was great! For dessert we had the hazelnut tart. It was good, but the toffee pieces that came with it were heavenly... I would have preferred a bowl full of that! :-)  The only tiny negative was I had ordered a decaf coffee that I wanted with my dessert. Our dessert came and halfway through they asked if I still wanted it since they were making it fresh, and at that point I did not want it anymore. Really no big deal at all. The service was great, prices pretty decent, and you can tell the waiters really enjoy the food and sharing it with us. This will be our new date not spot (If we ever get to go on one again :-)) Definitely glad we tried it!

s79D4WDktTXf1mlEUpPe7g.text: Nice outdoor seating and best pizza I ever had definitely try eating here you will not regrade it

cv-6Mj9cT-MKZkcAbipYPw.text: North has a lot going for it.  The food is fresh and interesting.  They are willing to customize ingredients and accommodate differing tastes.  We started with a Chef's Board which had a nice selection of nibbles.  The Calamari was tasty and crisp, but more of a beer batter than what you see in most Italian places.  The rice balls were crisp on the outside and pretty good inside, although they could of used a bit more flavor.  Pasta generally are decent sized and overall nice ingredients put together well.  Chick Parm was tender inside and crisp out.  It was served with a pasta with a white cheese sauce.  The cocktail list and wine list were more than adequate.  The problem is service.  Its just very raw.  Our bread came out without any plates.  We ordered drinks when we sat down.  They didn't come out till our starters were almost done, even though we ordered those well after the drinks. The staff was appologetic, but it still required us to raise this three times before they showed up. Our mains came out and even though we were at a table of four with room on each side the runner insisted on passing food over two of us instead of walking around the table.  Server, who was very nice, confused out credit card with another table so paying was delayed. Its not that I expect white glove service at a casual neighborhood place, but I do expect efficiency and basic understanding of things like how to serve food at the table.  I view this place as a strong four star place that get pulled down to 3/4 based on front of house.

37YDi6x4db5-9z6T1cZwVA.text: Love this restaurant. We recently went and shared a few appetizers from the small plates menu and everything was amazing! Sebastian was an amazing server, and made the experience one of the best we've had.

Gz_H8ogswpie6uSLGxp5TQ.text: Great place with great food and great staff.  I know that's a lot of 'great', but I enjoyed the restaurant very much.  Shout out to Chelsea.  She was a wonderful server.  I will go back soon,

0Dn0wmOtcRaQKEnmguXTFA.text: We returned. Great meal. Hubs had salmon and I had a wonderful pasta dish with chicken. Yummy! I'd give it a 5 but very slow on refilling water and tea and taking order. SAt a while before getting menus. Had to take water glass to front of place to get a refill.

uKbFLB4M-vtLhnz0qiccXg.text: Absolute best Italian food in town!!! 5 Star all the way around !!! Service is amazing. The food is amazing. The atmosphere is amazing. Can't wait to go back

NEoO_EG3B3DGx0Tq_Lz9Ew.text: This place needs some work but has potential.  The bottle of White wine they served us was warm.  The place is noisy and loud- tough for dinner conversations.  You have to beg for bread, and then beg for plates to put it on.  Appetizers- none of the 4 we ordered were good.  2 of us liked our entrees, 2 of us hated them.  They forgot it was a birthday celebration so we left without dessert.

13YDniYSc82ynCoF8cUUHg.text: Outstanding food and service.   This is a must try.   Tim the manager is  awesome and really made sure we were treated like VIPs.

oSZ9nMf1J7Z5E1fgG-ojmg.text: The problem was the time we had to wait for EVERYTHING. We were only a party of two and I feel that was the problem. I was celebrating an advancement in my job field and chose this restaurant as the place to enjoy this exciting time and I feel it was a mistake. I asked for a soda before my meal came and they tried to bring it to me 30min later once I got dessert menus. I decided we didn't want dessert here and left. The food was OK and was enjoyable but everything else killed it for me. Even paying the bill once the check was brought took around 30+min. I really feel the problem was my party size again, as I looked around I noticed the owner or manager walking to every table that was 4+ in party size but not us. And they ensured the larger tables were accommodated which makes sense of course but return business is crucial, and I don't see myself returning at this point.

fNcEb49fErT-tqJgTkgttQ.text: Love this place! I was very pleasantly surprised with North! Great ambiance, always busy and bustling. Good service, amazing food. The Bolognese is AMAZING. Pizza crust was perfect. Have an amazing HH too!

Sa3k-q4FFgkJ9qfktTmSzA.text: My latest visit to North Italia showed me that they are greatly improving their service and it definitely shows.  You get the homemade taste in everything they make because they make everything there, including the pasta!  I just love it here and have now been back 5 times!  When you are there try the artichoke appetizer and make sure to request Bonnie as your server.  She provides excellent service in a warm and welcoming fashion!

d5RRw4cfDNPbkGV8JZtXDQ.text: This place is located in heart of summerlin. We love going here; especially for brunch.

4vi9CZqsaZdk3nRv9Igpdw.text: We went to North Italia for the first time today for lunch and it was amazing.  Zucca chips were so tasty as was the chicken Caesar.  My kids had breakfast and the potatoes were so good.  The lemon donuts were fantastic.  We will definitely be back.

CZL-ptlhC4djfD0hfs-vRg.text: Love! The $20 board and bottle on happy hour is an incredible deal! I am obsessed with the ricotta truffle garlic bread, as well! Yum!

7xfa-BHG1pj3iBzd5NVJ-A.text: Very classie place very orderly. But I wish that  servest would just b3 alittle more quicker with the food and drinks. But over all It is a very beatiful place.

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Mr3EMRC2F9rUMCn1XF8e9g.text: Was able to get seated quickly without a reservation. Atmosphere was light and it's always a good sign when you can hear laughter coming from every corner of the restaurant.  Food was outstanding. Hoping they add some Veg entrees but I found my way around the appetizer menu and was full by the end!! The Burrata was amazing!! Our waitress was super friendly as well.  Table was a little small though. With 4 people and multiple plates it was a balancing act to keep drinks from spilling off.  Agreed it was a little slow. The entire pace of the place was slow. Not painfully just moved at a slower pace. We were never neglected for attention though. So we were starving by the time our food came out (we were never offered bread for the table).  We will 100% be back.

l32yBK8cdXYr2hfwJWjp7A.text: Upon arriving at the restaurant on a Friday night noticed it was very busy but suprisingly was seated immediately for a party of 2.  Although within the first 10 minutes we were not acknowledge by any server so I than informed the person at the hostess stand who sincerely apologized than Kristal (manager) overheard and immediately came to our table to take our drink and dinner orders.  She also did the same with the table next to us who was seated almost the same time we were and was also waiting to be assisted.  Kristal and Amanda was very attentive to our needs throughout our dining experience.  The food was great!  It was our first time dining here but we were already a fan since dining at the california location.  Thank you to Kristal for her prompt attention and service after being aware that we weren't attended to, we will definitely return!

mfPC1GX2WQft9MuVWosPrw.text: This place had horrible service!   Did not even acknowledge us.  We sat down and waited for 15 minutes and not a single person that worked at the restaurant noticed us.  we left

cSR6-Kp_Vs1jdKh6c7I3ng.text: So after my previous review I decided to give North Italia another try.  An email from the Manager got me thinking about another visit. I respect his determination. Anyway, what a difference a week makes. No negatives this visit. The server and supporting wait staff were all on point. Attentive, friendly and professional.  The food was very good and fresh. I had the Salmon and my Husband had the Pesto pasta. Happy to say fresh basil was used.   Not overly garlicky. Overall, quite a nice experience. Good job. Now you should all give it a go!!

Xo0bZpX-fZmHgOsuvLePTA.text: This was our second visit to North Italia. The first time was to see what they have to offer, (2 weeks ago) we just had appetizers that day and it was delicious. On this date 11/18 we had dinner. We started with an appetizer, we ordered the Chefs Board and it was fabulous! For dinner I had the Bolognese and the wife had the Grilled Branzino. The Bolognese was excellent, good portion. The sauce was not overpowering and good portion of meat. The Grilled Branzino was sooo good! Grilled perfectly, good size fish. I had Merlot with my dinner, fantastic tasting. On both occasions the wait staff service was excellent. We will definitely be back again. Nice atmosphere.

YgxlYbrWQ4UkLef3wgQt9Q.text: This place is really good, authentic, and overall delicious. Make a reservation.  For appetizers, we started with a chef's board, which was REALLY good. There was actually a lot of food, and after asking for some extra bread, we cleaned it up (family of 5, 3 teenage boys). We got an arugula and fennel salad, which was very good and had a nice lemon flavor. We also ordered the crispy calamari, which was the BEST calamari I've ever tried. Absolutely fantastic. We added on some mushroom tortellini, which was good and tasted very fresh. Definitely 5-star appetizers.  For entree, we ordered 1 bolognese, a fungi pizza, shortrib, strozzapreti, and a squid ink pasta. The bolognese was good- traditional and hearty. The squid ink pasta was not too good. It was weirdly spicy (but not excessively so) but really did not have much flavor. Don't get it. The strozzapreti was AWESOME- so flavorful and delicious. The shortrib was excellent. It was deliciously soft and flavored well with red wine, and the polenta it came with was sooooo good. Also got a fungi pizza, which was a lot. 5-Star entrees if you know what to order- just avoid the squid ink. Entrees are good sized- not like most good restaurants. They give medium-large portions.  4 appetizers, 3 entrees, and 3 desserts was a bit much, again for family of 5 which 3 teenage boys.   For dessert, we ordered a tiramisu, affogato, and bordini. The tiramisu was good, but the bordini was AMAZING. Absolutely FABULOUS. Among the best desserts I've had and will ever have- like a salted caramel milkshake that's super creamy in a single AMAZING bite that's just so elevated. The affogato was ok. Solely the bordini was so good it was worth it.  awesome 5-Star meal, definitely will come back for happy hour. Awesome service, expensive (but reasonably so) prices, good portions, 10 minutes wait time, and DELICIOUS meal.

Mj6tV82ddPwcU4f2lZ2rfA.text: Went here for a birthday brunch. When we first got there were a few tables seated. Waitress quotes incorrectly for the sangria....no big deal. We ended up ordering champagne and cranberry juice. We ended up having 7ppl....it took over an hour to get our food. And when the food finally came one person had to wait another 5-10 minutes for their pizza. Food was delicious as usual but every time I have been there with a large group...it takes over an hour to get the food. Highly recommend for the food but be prepared to wait for food.

eGjX6gwgLTt4Otc6sMgQQg.text: We went on opening weekend (waitress said it was their first weekend to be fully open). I've been to many restaurants on opening week/weekend and so much was lacking here and I was so excited to try this place.   We got there and had reservations and were seated immediately. Our waitress was very sweet and helpful so no complaints there. We ordered an appetizer that came out very quickly and tasted great (garlic should have been in much smaller pieces). It then took another 45 minutes to get our food. Our kids were unmanageable by the time our food got to the table and by that point it was hard to enjoy much.  We were brought bread about 30 minutes into the wait because the food was taking so much longer than anticipated. The food was mediocre. The potato and spinach daily special pizza was WAY too spicy and had barely any potatoes. The fig and goat cheese pizza with prosciutto was good, but way too many figs and not enough goat cheese, leaving the pizza just way too sweet. Super chewy and doughy spots on the pizzas, leaving other spots charred and too crispy to eat.   I can completely understand opening weekend can be rough, but we weren't even offered a gesture of kindness for having to sit and wait forever and it even took the same 45 minutes to bring the kid's food out. Just unacceptable to me for a restaurant that's not necessarily cheap. Most places would offer an appetizer comp or maybe a dessert comp even for the wait and frustration, but nothing.   I think we might go back and try it again, but it would have been nice to see management walking around to tables having to wait for extended amounts of time explaining the slow food situation etc. If we go again, it'll be sans kids just in case the wait is always this bad for food.  Long story not so short, the food is probably normally much better when things aren't so fast and furious in the kitchen and the waitress was very nice, but was just really hoping for a better experience.

gAK-TaShgizAk498mFw-5Q.text: This place is one of the best Italian restaurants! All of the food here is great very tasty and full of flavor. The atmosphere in the restaurant is great very nice. It has a full bar and you can see the kitchen. You can choose to sit inside or outside. Our server Ben was excellent he was very attentive and explained the menu for us definitely coming back to try different things.

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MzP08wN69QRQTHJPnMcpBg.text: It's so great what North Italia and Flower Child have done to the renovated Bocca Park corner! Both of these restaurants (which I think are owned by the same company) have great attention to detail to the service and the food entree's. I have been to both over 10 times, and the best part is their consistency to deliver! They have not let us down yet - I just hope they keep it up!   The ingredients are fresh, the portions are perfect, and the service is warm and not overbearing! Love it!

nLzQSc8Rssijwr3oiigE1w.text: In a nutshell: the food is very good. We had lunch here twice. The crispy Calamari is different from any other fried calamari I have ever had.  Very crisp and slightly sweet served on a bed of arugula - interesting.  The pizzas and pastas are also spot on. Service is friendly and accommodating. The bar is relaxing and comfortable. Even the restrooms are attractive and super clean.  But if you are in a hurry, pick another place. The kitchen just can't seem to keep pace with the orders. The last time we were there, it took 15 minutes for the appetizer and 20 minutes after the appetizer was finished for our main course. If they can overcome that one problem, this would be a five star restaurant

GJzYo-qIHzaz3x3OVnT3BA.text: I took my daughter to North Italia for her birthday dinner with the rest of my family, and had an excellent dinner!  I had the best tasting fish I have ever eaten and the rest of my family had one of the many delicious pasta dishes which were all fantastic!  Don't miss out on Desert because life is short, and therefore perhaps eat it first!  You won't be disappointed!   The atmosphere is great at North Italia, and if I didn't know better, one would think they were having dinner on the wharf!  Our waiter was so friendly and helpful, with the menu and in making our selections! I will definitely be back, and would definitely recommend anyone to dine at North Italia!

eLZq-6hBnXE3Rl4ztwu-gQ.text: My first time here and I was very disappointed. I ordered the calamari was overcooked and chewy.  The scallops were flavorless.

Xbu-5wZGGzih_rXUtJmWHg.text: Service was good ...... food was NOT good, especially not worth the price ..... go to BRIO trust me

1qwjivoktNvZH4m3sAY77w.text: So I came here with my nana who thought it was a great place, but upon looking at the menu, I was somewhat disappointed with the lack of variety. I couldn't really find anything that spoke to me so I ended up getting their Caesar salad with chicken. I was expecting it to be slightly larger and more filling for $15 price tag.   The service was friendly which is the reason why I didn't rate it 2 stars or less. Sadly I will not be coming back unless they add to their menu.

pXvnQOYjvPg_dkdQmGEUQg.text: They sat us and forgot about us. Finally a server came by and asked us if we had been helped. Ordered wine the chefs plater, meatballs and arancini for appetizers. They brought the appetizers and forgot the wine. Had to ask two people for the wine again before getting it. All the appetizers were tastey. Orded the scallops for entree which was also good. My kids had fettuccini alfredo w chicken and spaghetti and meatballs. The alfredos chicken was cold and dry. My kids didn't like it. I feel like i am being generous with the 4 stars but i liked the food i had and the staff was nice even though they forgot us a few times.

Ah1cuDlZZIeGaAWjkVsRag.text: My Mom and I wanted to try a new place today and North Italia popped up on Yelp. Done! First of all I am stoked to see Flower Child is finally coming to Vegas in the same shopping center, but that's a review for another time! This area is undergoing a huge facelift, and North Italia is one of the new tenants. We were greeted with a warm welcome and the decor and atmosphere are very modern and relaxed. It feels super hipster but not pretentious. You can see the hustle and bustle of the kitchen through windows, and the kitchen is just as nice as the rest of the restaurant.  We started with the garlic truffle bread. It was heavenly! We ate about half of it (it was a generous portion) and I took the rest home to my husband, who devoured it. Mom got the chicken pesto and I got the spaghetti and meatballs. Mine was good. You can tell the noodles are fresh made. But that chicken pesto was out of this world! It is VERY green and looked a little off putting at first glance but it's tasty. There was a very generous amount of chicken-seriously it was a whole breast. The pine nuts and capers added a nice crunch. The service was good and we we'll definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spaghetti &amp; Meatballs

2sLPnu9oAQ1Uv6NTq9jHiw.text: Service was amazing. The food was really good.  You gotta try the salted caramel budino. Thanks you. We will be back !!   #livlovcupcakes #northitalia

FGfphnLf78AUhEcxw6kV5g.text: Can't think of anything bad to say about this place. The food is fantastic and the ambiance is top notch. Perfect restaurant for Vegas on a warm night, hopefully you can sit outside. Prices are steep but I wouldn't say it's too overpriced to not deem a 5-star.

9hL3zQfPB-78WjhNnybrsQ.text: Once again I try this place and food and atmosphere is fantastic but the service horrible again. Our waiter young guy outside seating tonight . I ask him what wine my wife was drinking for $21 a glass  because she liked it and he said Skyfall Cabernet and you can get it at total wine. So look on google and it's $15 a bottle . I asked him this is it for $15 a bottle and you charge $21 a glass ? I get sarcasm and "don't you know restaurants mark up bottles" I  eat dinner out four days a week it's not my first time out . Well he charged me for the higher priced wine$21  and gave me $16 as I see on your menu now that I am home and still pissed off. It's only $10 but the attitude ruined my nice night out with friends.                            Management contacted me and sent a $25 gift card . I returned and had great service and a great Meal

hlH9Vwv2I1guNmJKFJuX2Q.text: One of the worst Italian restaurant whatsoever service was horrible and food was nasty. I don't recommend this place at all.

xG04IjsYfkvssay3bueUpw.text: What a great first-time experience! The food, service, and atmosphere are excellent. We thoroughly enjoyed it and will definitely be back. Thanks, Team North Italia!

Iw58plxYkKJh3h1DsBNeiQ.text: We came here earlier in the year for our first time....food and service was great. Today though...This is our new weekend spot for brunch. The Chefs platter was a great start. The apricot mostrada on the platter was fantastic. The short rib hash was delicious. The short rib is like butter and the hash has a little fire to it and it comes with eggs sunny side up.  The prosciutto and fig pizza is to die for.    Sebastian is a great server, he is new to the city so come show him love. The manager, Kaye is a sweetheart.  We have to try dinner now

ZCh4rgfMwbj-SLAQ5aNhag.text: Not coming back.  Food was 3 stars and there was no service.  We were greeted and seated immediately by the hostess.  At first glance, the decor was simple, open, and soft lighting seems inviting and welcoming, but it stops there.  Don't get me wrong, there are a ton of staff and no one was particularly idle.  The failure on the service comes from a lack of training and perhaps the way the teams were structured.  From the time we were sat with a menu, it took 11mins for the server to come by and identify himself, as he was already walking away with his head turned to say "I'll be right with you okkkkaayyy?"  Another 4 minutes go by, he comes back to ask us if we wanted to order drinks, still no water in hand or on the table.  We asked for water and was about to order when he turned to leave so we actually had to stop him from running away to get the orders in and to not course it.  Now there are tables being set all around us that are assigned to various servers and our server got additional table at this point.  Everyone else did not seem to have to wait long to be greeted, get drinks, or have their orders taken.  We know this because the table that got sat 20mins after us in his section got their drinks and food first.  Not only that, our server never brought us bread until when my entree arrived and my husband asked if we needed to place an order for a bread basket.  You read that right.  My lone plate of pasta arrived first, ahead of the complimentary bread and our other plates, which were the arancini and a pizza.  When one requests to not course a meal, it is assumed to be brought out together, not one at a time.  By the time my husband's pizza and arancini arrived, my pasta dish was lukewarm.  Our bread with the olive oil and vinegar arrived last.  Server dropped it off and ran off without giving us bread plates.  We had to flag down someone else to get it.  Our water were never refilled.  We were almost through the meal when the server came by to ask "how are things going?" rather than when the food was delivered to see if we required condiments or if the food were to our liking.  I guess it's impossible when plates were spaced so far apart so that it was like we were eating separate meals.  About the food and flavors: - Arancini was delicious and comes in 3's on a cast iron plate, except the dish was not even hot when we got it.  It was filled with once melted but now has resolidified cheese - special of the day eggplant pizza was overly salty and the skin of the eggplant made it so when you took a bite, the entire topping came off with it and was messy to eat by hand.  You should fork and knife every bite - Squid Ink mafaldine was tomato and basil forward with a lot of heat to the spice.  While it's a unique dish, it was not great tasting and the portion was small for $20. The sauce to pasta ratio was good, but the amount of seafood was meager.  The 4 small shrimps and squid strips were not cooked in the sauce so it came out very bland  While I was still eating, the server started cleaning up my plate while I was mid bite to ask if we wanted dessert.  My husband had to stop the server and ask him to put the plate down because I was still eating.  My meal would have been no different if we ordered at a self serving kiosk and got our own water, utensils, and napkin with a number on an extension stand.  It was a ridiculous experience and a waste of time and money!  For the many Italian and Italian American options available in Summerlin (e.g. Trattoria Reggiano, Honey Salt, Masso Osteria, Spedini), I'm going to tell everyone to pass on North Italia.

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggplant pizza. Salty.  Huge slices of eggplant does not come apart because of the tough skin so you will wear the topping on your face
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Arancini were good  but ours arrived almost cold
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Squid Ink Mafaldine $20.  Tiny portion and not good.  4 small shrimp and bland tasting squid strips.

ddyl3A4RkxSX6vWzVCPCJg.text: Ehh. It's okay but not what I hoped for. One and done.   I had the squid ink pasta with shrimp and squid. Very good sauce and spicy, which I love, but the pasta was pretty under cooked and the fish portions were minimal at best. No bread. No amenities. I also had the soup. It was okay, a little salty but it has salami in it so somewhat expected. What was disappointing was the fairly heavy layer of oil or grease on top of the soup. So, ehh. Sorry!  I gave them the three stars largely due to the sauce but truly underwhelmed otherwise.

e_s6qj5g6lRvRXC69occbQ.text: The first time I tried this place I liked it so much, I went back the very next day.  The food is amazing and the service, top-notch.  You can get spaghetti Bolognese  made it sweet potato pasta...no carbs and it's delicious.  The roasted veggie salad with pine nuts is also amazing.  They have a large outdoor patio with a fireplace.  The restrooms are clean and well-maintained.  It's a great place for a nice leisurely lunch.

Bm1OU1NjoimCkkULy4A1uA.text: I've passed by this place multiple times while in Boca Park and I am so happy to finally try it. Such a cute little place. It definitely has a more a contemporary feel but with home-y feeling. I was there for Sunday brunch so it was packed.   I ordered their breakfast wrap and my girls and I shared a pitcher of their red sangria. The breakfast wrap was so good! I literally inhaled it the moment I took my first bite of it. It had Italian sausage, mushrooms, smoked mozzarella, scrambled eggs, and roasted pepper. It came with this cream sauce on the side. I'm not entirely sure what it was but it complemented the wrap really well. It was so nicely made, it wasn't messy or greasy, and it was filling. The perfect amount of flavor and I was impressed that their was a good amount of sausage and mushrooms. Other breakfast wraps or burritos I've had in the past consisted mostly of scrambled eggs and not much of anything else. So this had a good ratio of everything. The sangria was nice and refreshing and between 4 girls, we were able to have 2 glasses each out of the pitcher. The pitcher is $28 which I feel is a deal instead of each girl getting bottomless mimosas.   The service was great and timely! Our service was very accommodating and sweet. I will definitely be back to try their other menu items!

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast Wrap

m-KfHUGFjT8lyITPrqLjUA.text: I have been here weekend after weekend with family and friends and the food is always outstanding. My husband and I came for dinner and sat at the bar last night, and after this experience, I don't know how this restaurant stays in business with horrible service. Our server was great and apologized, however, we waited over 1 hour for our food. The manager said it took this long because they were waiting for us to finish our first course (zucca chips and a small Caesar for my husband, I had nothing). This is not a first course, and I never have had this type of issue eating at fine dining restaurants. Admitting you put an H on my receipt because you were waiting for us to finish the "first course" and that the food never got put in is unacceptable. People make mistakes and I appreciate the server trying to make up for it and apologizing. But the manager, trying to justify that we were hungry, and then only comping the salad and zucca chips, that's a slap in the face. I didn't wait for the chips or the salad, I waited over an hour for a pizza and chicken parm. Bad management at its finest, especially when the server says, I wanted to comp your drink too, the chips and salad just isn't enough. That's not how you treat customers, let alone regulars.   Updated review on 6/10/19 - a huge thank you to the manager Cole who resolved our complaints, he is a wonderful manager and made our most recent North Italia dining experience very special. Thank you for everything, and we will be back.

76i3W0MLeGQYtUyARD8XSQ.text: I really liked this place when it first opened. We went first in January of this year. We went again last week and I wasn't as impressed with the quality of the food.   Possibly if we didn't go on a Saturday, it would have been better since it was so busy and took awhile for the food to come out.  We both ordered the bolognese and it wasn't as good as it was when they first opened.  Our server was great just everything was slowed down due the dinner rush.  Hopefully the quality of the food goes back to how it was when they first opened or I sadly won't be returning.  Still adore the decor and inviting feeling both times we visited.

NbWv0KuvwkNcsWiPj0RSBw.text: Nice place. I've gone to the North Italia in Irvine, CA, and it's pretty much the same feel, ambiance, service, etc. The food is consistently good. There is outside dining for cooler days in Las Vegas. The pasta dishes are my favorite, but my companions really enjoyed their pizza selection as well. No complaints about our waitress, but we waited nearly 15 minutes for someone to 'clean up' and outdoor table for us to be seated, even though the restaurant wasn't busy. One of our party members followed up after a 10 minute wait and was told that there is only one hostess available to prep the table. It's a little concerning that during a slow part of a late lunch hour there is still such a delay in busing. But other than that, it was an enjoyable experience.

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jnmuN1Z3ioBC8gfILBwwyg.text: We had a great lunch and was able to sit outside and enjoy the day. The wine list is very reasonable. For lunch, I got the fig and prosciutto pizza. It was amazing. My friend pasta and liked her meal too. Our server was very attentive and friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prosciutto pizza is amazing
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious dessert... Nutella torta

Lbs88GKM5T7TRKhEj0Icyg.text: Came during happy hour and ordered the apricot lemonade and spaghetti and meatballs. The spaghetti and meatballs was absolutely delicious, I am already wanting another bowl of it. Will definitely be back!

ZRcp92-4IxNUILFyIoJOLQ.text: OH. EM. G! I've been hearing so many good things about this place so I've finally decided to make a reservation to go! Definitely make a reservation is your best bet, since they seem to be busy all the time. I went on a Monday night around 7pm and it was filled!   I went with my friend for her birthday and we started off with a glass of wine. I ordered the house Pinot Grigio, the 2nd one on the wine list- which was sweeter, they say. They brought out bread, which how could you say no?! I wish it was hot when they delivered it. But, the oil and vinegar just made it all better.   I then shared the Mediterranean mussels and margherita pizza, which was the perfect amount. The mussels were ok, it was definitely better towards the middle of the pot since the sauce was stirred and simmered on to the mussels. As for the margherita pizza, AMAZING! Perfect amount of cheese and a basil leaf to balance it out.   And last but not least, the salted caramel bundino for dessert, talk about never wanting it to end. It was soooo good!   Definitely must go back, would love to check out happy hour next time!

qDW9uEXUWlHk8WVu5dMedA.text: Went on Friday night, 4/26/2019. We had a reservation at 7:15 through the open table app. However, we didn't get seated for nearly 23 minutes. Once we got seated, we had slightly less people than what we made the reservation for and the waitress seemed annoyed by that. The dinner was very good but it was our friend's birthday and it took 17 minutes to get the birthday girl her dessert even though we told the waitress from the outset. It was not a bad experience but it could have been better.

g62zArmosBkHsM1pqcmFig.text: Went in for dinner on Easter. Super chill place with modern decor. Food was great. We had pizza, salad and strozzapretti pasta. The pasta needed salt but overall tasted great. Will def go back

kw0xkXA6X7kN9RuKRE-mZA.text: My current local obsession is this place. Very esthetically pleasing. They have patio seating, which I always prefer. The fig goat cheese prosciutto pizza is my faaaaaaavorite!!!!! The calamari is a great choice for a starter. I also recommend the sangria pitcher.

zckQx6PV2S0RMNpFDerd-w.text: Wow! Everything on the menu looked so good. I ordered brunch today- the short rib hash- and the meat was so tender it fell right off.  The zucchini chips are a must for appetizer. I will go again next time and try their Italian board!

S8Y_-naG8pe-w2NKCVla1g.text: The boyfriend and I enjoy this restaurant very much, one of our faves! We have never had anything we didn't like, the food is amazing and so is the service! We had Mathew as our server who was friendly, attentive and knows his stuff! With years of customer service experience, it's hard to impress me and although he was very busy, he always had a smile on his face. He's a keeper, North Italia!

68g7LIOis0l7fgURsTy2mQ.text: Had a night out with friends and made it in time for happy hour and got the bottle and board special which is a bottle of red or white house wine and either a pizza and plate of bruschetta or and board of cheese and meats. We got one of each between 4 of us. Food is wonderful and feels homemade and not from a box (which they don't do box stuff). This place has outdoor and indoor seating. Come enjoy some really good Italian treats and a bottle of vino with your friends (if you like to share)!

olUfd_6j-LRM75YcGiDk0Q.text: I wish this place was much closer but regardless still worth going out of my way for. I've been here twice and no matter what you order, their food is just so rich with flavor. You can tell they put effort and thought into their recipes. Last time, I had the pesto without the chicken and absolutely loved how the capers added such a unique taste to it. Also it wasn't as creamy like many pastas, which was nice. This time, I had the funghi pizza as well as the bruschetta for happy hour. Prices are on the higher end but no regrets! They also have seating outside and inside. Can't wait to bring my boyfriend here next!

rsCbd9ceA9mFD0xqxl6jpA.text: This place is awesome!  We go every weekend now for brunch/lunch.  The chicken parmigiana is amazing!  Great beer selection and the service is top notch!  Highly recommend!

BHCmHNm-_gcMJANgiQXopg.text: This place is always good! Nice, but small menu, persistently good and service is always excellent!   Tonight, Valentine's Day, we managed to get in without trouble. We where seated at a small table, for us, that's usually a bad choice because we tend to order a lot of food and a small table doesn't have enough room for all of our food! But, being Valentine's Day, they needed to maximize space! We understand!  We ordered the Tuscan kale salad-crispy pancetta, charred grape, apple, pistachio, breadcrumb, parmesan vinaigrette ale; the chef's board-prosciutto di parma, artisan cheese, marinated eggplant, roasted pepper, castelvetrano olive, marcona almond; and the arancini-crispy mushroom risotto stuffed with scamorza cheese & served with red sauce. All where excellent! Highly recommend all three!   For main entree, we had the chicken Parmesan- crushed tomato, aged provolone, mozzarella, parmesan rigatoni. Large portion, crispy breaded chicken, large portion of pasta! And the diver scallops-parmesan risotto, roasted butternut squash, brussels leaf, crispy shallot, pancetta. They where cooked perfectly!   To finish off a great meal and to celebrate Valentine's Day, we got almond & mascarpone tart- cranberry orange compote, basil, saba very creamy and we had specialty dessert, chocolate cream, hazelnut with toffee bits, caramel sauce. Both where so creamy good!  Good meal, excellent service, great ambiance, a recommended experience!

yGxU1AZdpGZrhz1n9A58XA.text: WOW! Please come here. Absolutely amazing. Excellent food, service, ambiance. Everything was amazing!

ZHz84qSQG57IqTSjhdL1tQ.text: North Italia is a gem!    Coincidentally our server was Gem! She gave us outstanding service throughout.  Her pleasant demeanor certainly enhanced the lovely ambiance of the restaurant.  The decor was modern yet inviting to for the dining patrons.    Since I was visiting with two foodies, we were able to experience a little bit of everything.  To start we shared the Arancini.  The three crispy fried balls consisted of mushroom risotto stuffed with scamorza cheese.  Outstanding.  The fresh red sauce is house made and definitely stands out.    For our entrees we shared the chicken parmesan, stozzapreti & Margherita pizza.  Again all of their sauces are house made.  It makes every dish uniquely fantastic.  The Margherita pizza was baked to perfection.  Their crust is also house made fresh.  The chicken parmesan is a very large portion.  The parmesan rigatoni accompanies the chicken for a great combination.  This gives you a little white sauce and red sauce on one plate.  I absolutely loved the Strozzapreti.  The twisted pasta is tossed in a delightful parmesan cream sauce and combined with chicken, roasted mushrooms, spinach and toasted pine nuts.  I could not get enough of this dish.   Even with all of that great food in my stomach, we powered through for some tasty treats.  We ordered the lemon donuts as well as the Almond & Mascarpone tart.  The 3 donuts were warm little bites of heaven.  The lemon sauce also has some dabs of vanilla. The tart was the absolute winner.  The unique dessert is plated with cranberry orange compote, basil and saba.  It's so creamy with the punch of the almond crust.    I would recommend North Italia every day of the week!

Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Parmesan
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strozzapreti

_kyo9HNG0V7hpi6rYSOLaQ.text: North Italia has a very relaxed, casual and laid back atmosphere...   I usually come for dinner or lunch and the food is consistently delicious and flavorful... For appetizers I have tried the white truffle garlic break which is super filling/heavy but super yummy nonetheless. If I'm not in the mood for something super heavy I get the calamari which is a must!!! I always get the chicken Parmesan for my entree, which also happens to be their house special, and I like how the pasta comes out al dente naturally. For drinks, I usually get the jumpstart which is a chocolate-y coffee drink. Service is always good! I would come here for a cute dinner with friends because of the casual yet tasteful atmosphere/decor or a date night.

xiD4mNQY-FfQO88WFbPcsw.text: Located in the snazzy corner of Charleston and Rampart by Flower Child and Honey Salt, North Italia is a lovely eatery that's perfect for lunch or dinner. They have a nice covered outdoor patio with a full bar separating the inside seating. Modern and yet warm, there's ample seating and the menu has something for everyone.  Have eaten at the North Italia in Santa Monica and enjoying our lunch at that location, my daughter and I decided to give this location a try.  We were promptly seated and menus given. Our waitress came over and took drink orders and my daughter put in an order for bruschetta (they have two variations, she got the traditional one of tomato and basil). We then ordered,  I selected the chicken farm greens salad and my daughter chose the chicken parm.  My salad was fantastic (field greens, tomatoes, toasted pine nuts, grilled chicken, gorgonzola crumbles). My daughter liked the chicken parm, but the accompanying pasta was far too over salted and buttery. She ate two bites and couldn't eat anymore.  Service is wonderful, attentive and friendly. Decor is attractive and is good for all types of social engagements.

MBiNIGplCTYJ7HJg33xDHQ.text: I've always passed by this restaurant everytime I was in the plaza to do some Williams Sonoma shopping. There was not one weekend where I have not seen this place slow or steady.. It is ALWAYS busy. I hate lines or having to wait long so I never bothered to dine here until a few weeks ago. I decided to make reservations and just take a chance on not having to wait so long when arriving. I really think it was meant to be because we were seated immediately after checking in with the hostess and our orders were taken not too long after given the menu. Service here is quick and the food is good. We sat out in the patio and I was quite surprised that it felt much cooler outside than it did inside the restaurant. The misting system they have is great for the Vegas heat. I will rate the food & service here a total of 3.5 stars. I'm glad I got to try this place out. The location is convenient for me when I do my retail therapy next door and get hungry. I wouldnt mind dining here again if it isn't a long wait. But if not i'll just pass and come back another time.

0E27HWBfxk1WvOGDYYqapA.text: My boyfriend and I decided to eat here on a Sunday afternoon! We were fortunate enough to get Gerardo as our server. We got white truffle garlic bread, zucc chips, bolognese and chicken Parmesan. (Yes we were hungry lol)   We didn't even ask Gerardo to split our main meals and he did it automatically. It was great. He even had a little surprise for us at the end just from listening to what we were considering for dessert!   We already knew North Italia had delicious food but Gerardo elevated the whole experience even more! Thank you Gerardo!!

EKoWFN-C8H5Dm-nOYxsadw.text: North Italia is a pleasant lunch destination in Summerlin with tasty food and spirited drinks. This was my first trip to North Italia, but my friend, Suki, had been here before. They offer both indoor and outdoor seating. Due to the chilly weather, we chose to dine inside.  The decor is nice, and the staff were extremely friendly. My main issue was the size of our table. We were only a party of two, and we were seated along the left wall. The table was so tiny, and also I felt we were too close to the tables on either side of us. Next, since we were so close to our neighbors --- I found myself super conscious of what I was saying because I didn't want strangers hearing my entire conversation!   After getting over my small table and close seating arrangements, I took in the menu. They offer many items for a variety of tastes which was nice. I decided to go with a sandwich, while Suki ordered a hearty seafood pasta. Both of our orders were prepared brilliantly, and I definitely couldn't finish my meal due to the size of it.  Our waitress was extremely efficient and pleasant. I liked the fact that she had filled my drink before I even asked for another one!  Overall, I liked North Italia and I would return. However, next time I would request to sit either at a larger table or in area with a bit more personal space. Solid lunch though!

Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wdfGq-J9t2vHukvbj-IqvQ.text: Literally MY FAVE!  They have an amazing happy hour where you get a bottle of wine and a chef board for $20!  They have a bar outside which is always packed and has a great vibe.  I've sat inside each time and recommend making a reservation because they are always busy!  We always start with the Chef Board.  I have an eggplant allergy and they always accommodate me and change the board to ensure no eggplant.    I've tried the Squid Ink Pasta but be warned it has a kick to it.  Definitely worth it if you can handle the spice.  I've had the Bolognese which was good but my favorite is their pasta with Chicken and veggies with a white sauce!  I love that all of their pasta is made in house.  We usually get the garlic bread with our meal which is SO DELISH!  For dessert they have the Affogato!  YUMMMM!!!  Who doesn't love Espresso and Ice Cream!  Their most popular dessert is probably the Salted Caramel Bambino!  It's very heavy but nice to try a few bites!  Their Lemoncello is the perfect way to end your experience!  As long as you're willing to spend the money, they have everything you could need to make the perfect meal.

Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chef Board.  To die for!
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bolognese

srpxv61IDAgwixLJzxmY2A.text: This place is kinda hit or miss.   I've eaten here before and had a great time. Previously my friend and I shared a pizza and a chef's board...both great. I like that the chef's board is more than just cheese...all kinds of goodies. I also love their salads...I've had them several times and they're always good.   The cocktail menu is great and the sangria is always yummy.   Now for today... First time I've come here for brunch. I ordered breakfast and my friend ordered a pizza. My food was ok. I was starving so I ate it. That said, it was super greasy...like dripping. The potatoes are also not breakfast potatoes. They're more like fried blobs of mashed potatoes without a lot of flavor.   My friend said her pizza wasn't good - the sauce tasted canned and the cheese was gloopy.  The waiter took her pizza off the bill because she barely ate any of it.   Anyways, I'll probably come back because I've had good experiences here before, but brunch was a let down.

SfyIAkavMZodlIdNYiF5kQ.text: Best quality food and such a good happy hour! I haven't had one thing there that I haven't liked between the chef's board, zucca chips (that melt in your mouth), heirloom tomato and burrata (must for an appetizer), the pig pizza, short rib radiatori, and the bolognese (house specialty). They use such fresh ingredients and the pasta is made from scratch. The only downside is that we usually experience slow service.

x-VZSKzEEPvdhQ4uM1nd2g.text: My family has been here a few times and the service is usually pretty good. The food though... is amazing. I love the fresh tastes they offer. The salads are always spot on! The ingredients are always fresh and in season.  The gluten free pasta has a great taste and the sauces taste like they were made fresh that afternoon.

YtUcqm36Gpwqx0kqjMzGEQ.text: It was tempting to just stay in Henderson and not drive 45 minutes across town on a Friday evening. BUT, we had to try this place and I'll never pass up a good Italian restaurant.   I'm so glad we made the journey! There's a nice toasty fireplace out front and outdoor seating with heaters. We opted to sit indoors as much as I would have enjoyed the heat. It's very open and spacious inside and the kitchen can be seen through a huge glass window.   There was so many good things to choose from in the menu but we ended up ordering the meatballs, white truffle garlic bread, arancini, and a margherita pizza. Also, a kids cheese pizza for the kiddo. The initial wait was a little long but I was starving so it could have just been me. All the small plates came out first. I thoroughly enjoyed it all. I had never had arancini before but you can bet it's my new favorite. The sauce on that and the meatballs was so amazing. We were using the bread to scoop up ever last bit of it. The pizza was perfect as well and very seasoned. The crust was just right.   For dessert we had the chocolate hazelnut torta and a scoop of chocolate and hazelnut gelato. It really liked the torta but the gelato wasn't as sweet as I'm used to. Still good, nonetheless!   The bathroom handles are labeled hot and cold which made my daughter happy, the small things in life.   I will for sure venture to dine here again. But the need one in Henderson!

Lx2n5oUgVVNa79a5BqWZ0w.text: A perfect place to eat real yummy italian food. Great ambience to add to the Italian vibe. A very laid back resto to go to and enjoy the food and company of family and friends while sipping a mimosa or wine from their wide selection. Come and visit!

M2jHQ10VAlQMqf96R1GkBw.text: Love the vibe of this little spot and will be coming back!   The cute decor made me feel like it was a great place for date night.  We started with white wine and a watermelon beer and from there ordered their pesto with zucchini and sweet potato noodles. I liked it but will go with regular noodles next time.  We also had margarita pizza and a salami pizza, both were awesome!  For 4 of us these 3 dishes were enough, good size portions.

XRjJ2Wv4TJoDlz-BoRtYWA.text: Great brunch spot, indoor and outdoor seating, food may take a while to come out but it's worth it!

kJD0a8SuhkuoIE7k3uDrUw.text: This is our favorite local Italian spot! The heirloom and burrata, grilled cauliflower and chicken parm are our gotos. The service is always amazing, but today we had Bonnie as our server. Let me just say, If only every restaurant had servers like her! She made the experience. We will definitely return and ask for her!

bYLkdge9urbBvJs-QYMzrA.text: The food here is really good.  Had the calamari arugula appetizer to start off (no pictures, already eaten) but trust me, if you will, it won't dissapoint.  The arugula and calamari blended flavor with a little bit of lemon juice gives it a nice sweet, sour, deep fried aroma.  Then the fish and our pasta short ribs followed.  The fish skin was crispy.  And the ribs was tender, and flavorful.   The pasta was also cooked perfectly.    Really nothing to complain about.  I did order the salted caramel dessert which was really too salty for me so I'd pass on that but my wife liked it.

1j6JT-UA2EBFheU3gY4_iw.text: Booked a work dinner with David Delci Event Coordinator and all was exceptional. From the booking with David to the service at the restaurant everything was truly fabulous.  We had an assortment of wonderful items starting with the mussels, meatball sandwiches, chicken Parm, and several of the pizzas. Nothing disappointed us. I highly recommend this as a great stop while you're in Vegas. Enjoy!

h1kwFPEKSKzoPdyHVwHHWw.text: New gem in Summerlin area!! Truffle Garlic Bread was a bomb yet a bit pricy. Clean environment with friendly servers. The open kitchen looks great cause you get to see how they make fresh noodles from scratch. We tried the farm salad and absolutely loved it! Delicious dressing that would encourage you to eat more vege!! The short rib pasta was good but not to the point that I would jump screaming wow. I do like our dessert choice Tiramisu - perfect texture and just the right amount of flavors. Next time we'll come back to try dinner menu. Eyeing on the risotto and perhaps different dessert choice! Whoever loves Italian food - come out and give it a try!!

27VSlTgD9AJZxc1WbmVXRA.text: We had a wonderful time dining at this restaurant... food was excellent... atmosphere and ambience were pleasant and inviting... the service by Jordyn was extremely good... looking forward to our next visit... thank you very much indeed...

Mr3EAgqz7rphJ_EQ_NaDvA.text: Everything about this restaurant is fantastic. The servers are attentive and cheerful, and the food is some of the best Italian I've ever had. Highly recommend the roasted chicken as well as the short rib pasta with white sauce.

K8NY6aexutC5ctH-ESxaGA.text: Great food!   Great Service!   Hostess recommended the chicken parm., so one of us hot that dish, then we also got a special eggplant parm pizza, and spaghetti and meatballs.  Pasta was fresh, made at the restaurant, plus they are generous with the sauce.  Husband really liked the meatballs; great flavor and moist.  My son really liked the chicken parm.  Pizza is large enough to share between 2, loved the crust.  Only downside is that it is very loud, so hard to talk.  But the food and service made up for any problems.  Definitely would come back if staying nearby, and would recommend to others.

opBEqCoCir0AshGC3iE_rg.text: One of the best Italian restaurants in Vegas next to Pasta Mia . I had the spaghetti  and meatballs The red sauce was perfect which made the dish overall everything I expected.

dSdtgUH7C89xO1FBWJ7qSA.text: Second time here and certainly not the last. This place is hands down my favorite restaurant in Summerlin.  I'd murder a bus load of nuns for that salted caramel buddino dessert.

uc1RdNcKn5v-T2CWAoQFNw.text: We have visited this restaurant many times but they need to change up the menu.  It's same same food all the time.  Food was good but service was bit lacking.

LO8fa3nRfoKwlPASVhgjXA.text: My wife and I ate at North Italia just last week. First off the food was impeccable. North really stands True to the homemade ideal. We started off with meatballs and calamari and I finished with a bolognese, my wife had the Strozzapreti. Let me tell you all the dishes were excellent, some of the best we've had in our 45 years of dining- and we have been to Italy! Our waitress Gosia was delightful very knowledgeable about wine and extremely helpful. I highly recommend going to North Italia!!!

P0CasgFgl2Ct1hqGW8ZCRg.text: Real italian strombolli and tortelleni. Short rib is great!!!. Great service. Except bartenders seem like there too busy. Overly nice. Dont be extra when i ask you a simple question. She repeated 'i will be with you shortly'. Like i didn't hear her?   My waiter was Keith and he was great. Outstanding service from him. He should be a manager with all the knowledge he has off the top of his  !

YK3tfvk042cuJsJQQ60xeg.text: Heard great things about this place inside to check it out try the chef appetizer board it is so good and fresh

6R0DApE0Jdnb54Ke6CzYtw.text: Best place to eat in Las Veags!!! The pizza was outstanding!!!  Service was just as it should be!!  AWESOME!!  When your in Vegas EAT HERE AT LEAST Once! Have to ask for Bunny as your server!!  She rocks

3v1gTQRPiH5_gYrCw3Kw5A.text: Best Italian food I've had in a long time had burrata for appetizer omg it was life melt in ur mouth delicious!!!! For my main I had the short rib pasta soooooooo good meat so tender

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short rib pasta is life

scaYCUC1Ap6qRcJpbTI14Q.text: As always, this restaurant delivers excellent service and delicious food. It is funny because the tables are close to each other but we still enjoyed our conversation.  The managers stopped by our table on a couple of occasions. The drinks were quickly refilled. You can see into one of the kitchen areas and it bustles along and is shiny and bright.  The craft cocktails are delicious.  Oh. And I am gluten free. They served delicious warm GF bread.

tHeZwhOiqzmFcPrPsPdq9A.text: Great restaurant off the Strip in Las Vegas. It was our first visit, so our party of four decided to follow the recommendations given by our server, Gerardo. From start to finish, every single bite was excellent. Squid ink pasta, "The Pig" pizza, short rib pasta, and the salmon were our choices. Short rib pasta with the white cream sauce was particularly good. Couldn't get enough!  After the main course, we had the tiramisu and hazelnut torta, paired with a "Jump Start" coffee. Again, Gerardo's recommendations were top notch!  Ambience is great. Love the decor - transitional modern with rustic, yet elegant, features consistently throughout. Service was exceptional as well.  Definitely coming back!!

2M-pPCMRIQ4rSn903zVLyg.text: My boyfriend and I went to North Italia right after Carbon or whatever that place is called in Aria, which I don't even bother looking up the name because the experience here was beyond terrible and cost us $500, the only reason I'm bringing that up is because going to North Italia a week later was such night and day experience! The food was beyond amazing and reasonable when it comes to price! We usually share everything that way we can taste multiple dishes and their serving sizes are perfect. And let's not talk about their service 5 star, no questions!

jmR_JqWVKb64DoPBQh4_cQ.text: When it is 50 degrees outside, there is absolutely no reason to have both doors and the partition between the bar and patio open. The manager refused to close the doors when we asked. Also, someone arrived after us, without reservation, and was seated before us. We haven't even got to the food yet; what a beginning to the meal!  Update: the manager, German, and waitress were great. The food was flavorful: I recommend the garlic bread as well as the spaghetti and meatballs. We will go back...when the temperature outside is higher.

nc2IKsmYSWiybDoWv-e2Uw.text: I can't say enough about the food, service,  ambiance and wine selection. We celebrated my birthday with a decadent dessert. Will return for lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best way to sit on a patio, next to a fireplace to relax and eat healthy.
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ambient and a feeling of being away. Love it here.
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegetable salad, that was decadent, with  roasted cauliflower,  squash and laden with nuts, dried fruit and a spattering of white vinegar.

XbV4IrK64EEBIptbkaPGKQ.text: These guys are onto something good.   Large energetic room.  Menu for everyone.  Nice wine list and cocktails.  Called ahead and they knew we were coming. So no wait for a table.   The kitchen was slammed. But this being the first week that's not uncommon.   The manager brought us out an amazing charcuterie platter as a Comp for the long wait. This thing was huge.   The food was amazing and the portioned were large.   We will be back.

a1HNxsNfTmf6pju28cddxg.text: This could be the best Italian spot in Vegas, everything I've had from here is next level. It's a go to spot for me, the pizza is full of flavor, the chicken parm is the best in Vegas and the Pasta is perfect. The vibe and atmosphere are fresh. This place rocks

CIcFAkf7x6O6VGzt-KKngw.text: First time here and was entirely impressed by the service, ambiance and the food. North Italia has very authentic food for the price.  I have been to Italy twice already and since then my expectations for Italian cuisine have gone really high. Fortunately, North Italia met my standards and I wouldn't mind coming back.

jRcRu84Faq_h13PgWXv_tQ.text: Dogs, dogs, dogs!!! Literally dogs everywhere you could see. Our waitress kept going over rubbing a dogs belly, then immediately bringing out food. Another table kept letting the dog ON THE TABLE. So disgusting.   Food was average. Service was average. I was really looking forward to a fun new neighborhood spot

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PSrz_Ojahe_nKxQxtasaeA.text: Someone cue "On An Evening In Rome" by Dean Martin.   I haven't been to Rome (yet), but this place gave me a little taste of what I vision it to be.  It's located in the little shopping area off the corner of Rampart and Charleston. You'll see a Pottery Barn and Honey Salt. The exterior of this place is super cute - Instagram worthy, if you ask me. They have an outdoor patio with a huge fireplace. I'm sure it looks gorgeous at night.   My friend and I went early on a Sunday afternoon. It was pretty packed, but we were seated right away. We had requested to sit outdoors and I'm glad we did. It was slightly windy, but it didn't take away from the experience. Our sever (I wish I remembered her name) was the sweetest. She gave us a rundown of the menu and even recommended her favorite items. One of options we chose was the Chef's Board. The part that stuck out the most was when the cheese was being described. The male server who gave it to us described it as "The rebellious cousin of Parmesan cheese."  All in all, this place was amazing. My friend and I have already planned to return and order strictly pizza this time.
