PuxJhXWLn9WToBbetne6hA.text: You can tell the food here is good. But the menu offers not even one vegan entree option and few appetizer options. Which was pretty disappointing. Service and atmosphere were good.

SCsI0iqs3ooZlmpU_fgq4A.text: We had gone there last night around 7:30pm for dinner. We were seated right away but didn't get to eat for almost 2 hours. This has happened to us last time we came here. Very disappointing. Food was good, a little overpriced. I don't think we'll come back here.

Pcp80ph5SjSP3eDrRty9yw.text: I wish I can give 0 stars to this place my wife and I decided to to go have a dinner there for the first time so we went and sat down waited for 10min for someone to come by to see if we ready to order anything we didn't even get offered any drinks from the host so we wait another couple comes and seats right next to us they get helped and I see the waitress is looking straight at us but doesn't bother to say I'll be with you guys soon or something instead she walks over to the table that was behind us she might of not been our server but to keep your customers happy she could of walked over and asked if we need anything until our server would show up so we got up and left not planning on returning I'll take my business else where

wMyOD-4ggLI6ANNmF5WQww.text: Normally I don't like to rate a place lower than 4 stars because it just doesn't feel right to me. Sadly my hubby was disappointed on his birthday. We came here because we really wanted to try the food, but we didn't get to have that experience. We were greeted and seated promptly by the host, but a server didn't look in our direction in the ten minutes we were sitting at the table. Several servers passed us, but none stopped to greet. We both work in the restaurant industry and have patience and understanding when it comes to restaurants being busy during lunch hours. If someone would've stopped to communicate with us, we would have waited. Hopefully I can convince my husband to give this place another try, but it's very disappointing to have your high hopes crushed on your birthday.

gCJyqEBHdtqB2geHD02KMg.text: Another great addition in Boca park area.  Clean. Sleek. Great service. Fresh pasta. Great desserts.   Go hungry. Good size serving.

CA9xEiMoYiwWqKdqvXyp_g.text: Went with 2 colleagues from work. We waited 30 minutes for a table even though there was ample seating available I was craving white sangria which they didn't have, so I ordered the tea which was passion fruit and delicious.   Appetizers:  The charcuterie board was insane and was a smorgasbord of treats. It had: Perfect bread, a soft and hard cheese, prosciutto, olives, apricots, almonds, asparagus and eggplant puree.  The meatballs were delicious too! The sauce was perfect!   I loved the salad I had which was the farm salad and had Italian lunch meats and was perfectly dressed.  The colleagues I was doing with both got the chicken Parm and they loved it. The pasta it came with had some type of truffle oil and smelled delicious.   The service was fantastic also!

PdzLvVGvbhqIhmZfTk05IQ.text: I came here for my birthday and it was amazing. First, the ambiance and decor was very nice. I love the bar and whole vibe they had going on. We had the zuccachips for an appetizer. They were so good, nice and crispy, which is a nice texture. For my main dish I had the pesto chicken. My dish was probably one of the most excellent dishes I have had in a while. I have a go to Italian restaurant, but I think that North Italia really blew me away. It was so good, and everything was on par, I really enjoyed it. Service was a little slow, but I'd come here again, one of the best experiences I've had in a while.

gBfLC1IGyPPe_nE5lzRSpw.text: The food over all is very good and I have gone in 5 times and always find something else that is good. My wife home made chicken parmigiana and holy hell it was awesome. The rosado balls are a must and do not for get about the dessert that was amazing always so they have salted caramel omg!!! I did the The squid ink pasta and it was ok! I was disposed in it. THE big thing I would change about service is very slow on nights when you should busting your ass. We at place for dinner and it was 45 min wait and 1:30 minutes to get all of are food and it wasn't the waiter fault it was a organize kitchen everyone wait lot that night!!! So my recommendation would be to go at lunchtime when it's not so crazy!!!

dpgfpl6OLaEFR81ozYI0EA.text: Amazing! Came back to give this place a try and everything was super good. Fast service, good food and great ambiance. We even sat next to the golden knights ;) Our server was amazing, food came out promptly, reservation process was easy the hosts were really nice and friendly.  Nice place.

fJSBjv7MYIEqE9VLTWcBQw.text: It's just too rare. Finding great food blended with good service, sprinkle an amazing ambiance on there and you've got North Italia. Italian food is all the same around vegas! So boring! Not the case with this restaurant at all. 5 stars for being unique across the board. Can't wait to go back. The first time we had a server that was awesome but I can't remember his name! Brought my wife back a second time and we had Emily. Outstanding service. Attentive, kind, upbeat. This staff makes sure you have a great time. Bravo

m-Lyf2sl8HKCRPkhkhVPXQ.text: Nice restaurant with a cool patio and fireplace, and reasonably good service. They didn't bring out any bread with our drinks which we thought was weird.  The chicken parm was good, crispy, and comes with rigatoni alfredo. The spaghetti with meatballs was also very good, nice thick pasta, good meatballs,  probably could have used a little more sauce. The players could have come out with higher temperature,  they were not really hot.   The kids cheese pizza was great but you're going to pay $10 and higher for kids meals with drinks FYI. I would give them 3.5 star rating if it was possible on Yelp , but not a 4.0 since they didn't offer bread and bc they charge full price $3.50 for a kids drink. It was pretty good but not amazing. For comparison, Carrabba's has great beer prices on happy hour, low price kids meals, and their soups are amazing, easy to rate them higher from a family perspective.

G2usJj8xfn9iOcKov7EJLA.text: Not safe for celiacs. Came for dinner, and got in right away on the heated patio. Heat is an understatement - there are overhead heat lamps as well as the movable stands. We were roasting at our table in the middle of the patio.   Our server was pleasant and helpful. We chose a modified gluten free veggie appetizer which came pretty quickly. Our pizza took another 40 minutes- they did alert us about a delay but it had already been over 30 minutes.   At this point I was not feeling well so we left pretty quickly. Needless to say I was glutened - so if you too have celiac please reconsider eating here.

DmNtJacqyyTpjSiQ0FOvsA.text: Came here with my wife. Everything we ordered was great. You can really taste the freshness. The staff was incredibly friendly and we had a really good time. We'll be coming back for sure.

GAa04-m49fhgSKnPl6TbAA.text: It was an amazing dining experience! We came in around 9pm with a reservation and were seated immediately!  Our usual go to plate is the Chicken Parmesan which will send you through space with the delicious flavors!  Service was top notch, the waiters came by several times to make sure we were ok. The food came out pretty quick too!   My favorite part about North Italia is the cool hip atmosphere!   Definitely coming back!

Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Front
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Parmesan AMAZING! To die for!

ksjEVLBBRHC4xD_j-e1OiA.text: Love the food! A very good Italian Restaurant.Had Great service and we felt very welcomed! Good experience!

lTS4wOdEd_fPMZO08Y4c_Q.text: Looks like this is the new happening place so decided to give it a shot. Nice contemporary decor, very lively ambiance.  The best part, half price wine by the bottle on Sundays!! We got a bottle of prosecco for $18!! What a deal. This will be my new fav Sunday dinner place. We started with their signature truffle ricotta bread which was delicious, however a bit pricy for $11.  They even have a kids menu with all of the kids favorites. My kids tried the Alfredo pasta with grilled chicken which was delicious. My husband tried the strozzapreti, interesting name, our server told us that means "strangle the priest"  It was pasta with Parmesan cream sauce, chicken, pine nuts and mushrooms. He loved it. I tried the burrata tortellini served in a light mushroom sauce. I thought it was just ok. I don't think I want to repeat that.  For dessert we had their tiramisu which was absolutely delicious. Loved the little chocolate balls on top, added a nice crunch.  One thing I didn't like was that there is no bread on the house, you don't expect that from an Italian restaurant. The only bread option is the $11 truffle bread.   Updated : Gave a second try... 5 Star all the way!! All credit goes to our fantastic server Cynthia. Took care of every single detail throughout our dinner. Was so kind to my kids. Food was fantastic, tried Aranchini this time, perfectly crisp on the outside, soft gooey mushroom risotto on the inside, red sauce complemented the dish very well. Also, they serve bread now!! That was my disappointment at first visit, so happy to see fresh bread and butter.

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Arancini

MuENLRHtwz8thAa5cF8EqA.text: Food was outstanding. Very creative menu very nice change from most Italian places. Service was friendly however a bit slow. Will definitely be returning.

ShmDA_rjLFv140ulothKug.text: HAPPY HOUR is where it's at!!!  Got the Bottle + Board for $20! Where you get a bottle of wine + a choice of either pizza, bruschetta, or chef's board (We couldn't make up our mind so got pizza and an extra order of the chefs board :) for another $10)  I kept it Keto by omitting the bread and jam so you can do it too!!   It was sooo delicious and we enjoyed our time here, Oscar, our bartender also recommended Le Volte-- and boyy I love him for this!! Not on happy hour but prob my new fav!! Has a long leave in your palette that enhances all the deliciousness with time  Make sure you stop by North Italia + hit up the bar for happy hour!!

OTHnmyZ6sFqXZxrjzthguw.text: We've been coming here since the day they opened. Each time is absolutely wonderful! We bring our family here for birthday dinners (if you sign up with your email you get to pick a free dessert!) and we also come here just my boyfriend and I.   Lately we have been sitting at the bar and watching the sports games on Thursday nights. One of my favorite things is the inside/outside concept that allows you to feel the fresh air while sitting inside on hotter temp nights. Last week we both tried new cocktails including the Ginger Blossom Margarita and Apricot Limonata, they did not disappoint!  My Favorites from the menu are: Spaghetti and meatballs  Truffle Garlic Bread "The Pig" Pizza (with extra spicy sauce!)  Already looking forward to our next visit.

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ginger Blossom Margarita + Apricot Limonata

wWMa85xUjVDzDRvJFymYDQ.text: I'm only giving a two-star because I've eaten here before and for the most part, this restaurant used to been consistent. Not that the food is anything to write home about but, for the most part, the atmosphere is wonderful and the outdoor patio is very comfortable (until today). I took a friend to eat here. She just moved back to Vegas and wanted me to suggest good places for lunch. We sat down on the patio and waited quite a while before anyone approached us. It's wasn't that busy at the time. Our waiter was pleasant enough and we ordered the Heirloom Tomato & Burrata, the Grilled Artichoke and the Crispy Calamari. The Tomato and Burrata was delicious. We each took a bite of the calamari and both looked at each other and kinda wanted to spit it out. It was fishy, cold, oily and way too much breading on it. Not good. We wanted to tell the waiter about it, but never saw him again until toward the end of our meal. Then we tried the grilled artichoke. It was not cooked enough, full of oil and very hard to eat. We ended up picking the leaves off and just ate the heart.   In the mean time, a bee came flying by the table and my friend, who is deathly allergic to bees, got a bit panicky because she didn't have her epipen with her. As both of us watched where this bee was heading, it landed in our tomato & burrata and got stuck in the burrata. I put my napkin over the plate and tried to call someone to remove the plate. About 10 minutes later we finally saw a busboy and asked him to remove the plate as there was a bee underneath the napkin (still alive). We told him that we didn't get to finish this dish and would he please find our waiter. He walked away with the plate and stopped by the bar about 10 ft. from us and took off the napkin and let the poor bee live. However, this bee decided that he wasn't finished with us and flew back and landed on the table, where I was brave enough to smash my napkin on it. We still haven't seen our waiter and at this point we were just ready to get the heck out of there.   Finally, the waiter came to our table and asked how was everything. He was obviously clueless as we didn't even touch our calamari and the artichokes were a huge pile of uneaten leaves sitting on our 4" plates, we both just looked at each other, shook our heads and asked for the check. I didn't want to make a scene as that is not my style. I probably should have, but actually, that moment when we got our check, another bee buzzed around us.   Sorry North Italia, I will never be going back to your restaurant. Also, might I suggest that you remove all the foliage in the patio area that attracts bees. It's very sad when a half decent restaurant just gets bad. I hope for your sake that your managers read these reviews and actually do something about it.

fVghafxqKRWcBrjtWLrt6A.text: Absolutely my new fav brunch restaurant in town.  I can't say enough good thing about this restaurant.    This place has good seating for both indoor and outdoor.  The outdoor area had mist fan and shades which made it more comfortable on the hot days.  We went on a super hot day and decided to sit indoor.  Very welcoming and laid back ambiance dining area.    Food: We had zucca chips, white truffle garlic bread, black Mediterranean mussels, Italian meatballs and squid ink mafaldine.    Zucca chips was a little bit on the oily side, but the seasoning was on point, and my toddler and I could not stop eating them.    The white truffle garlic bread was served in a cast iron pan, toasted with a generous amount of butter , shaved mozzarella cheese and homemade ricotta.  It was more on the rich and heavy side.  I was amazed how they turned toasts into a dish.     Italian meatballs was yummy and had all the traditional flavors, 3 huge meatballs laid on top of a bed of creamy polenta.  Squid ink mafaldine had it's unique flavor, probably from the fennal and calabrian chili.    Our least favorite dish was the mussels, they were very small and skinny, and half of them the shells were not opened.    Service: Leonard was our server.  He was extremely helpful.  Ask for him!   Definitely going back and I cant wait to take my friends there next time.  I heard they have good happy hours too I cant wait to try it!

Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. White Truffle Garlic Bread

_b_xl5Nn3bF1gxBL7YQgig.text: Came in on a Friday night it was quiet busy. I think all of Summerlin was there. I looked around and I noticed a funny thing. El Jefe and I were the only poc. Lol! Felt like zebras among lions, from all the stares we were getting.   Back to the food and drinks, got the Last great wine thief, it's a mix of gin, wine honey, and no shame, it's delicious.   Then the Strozzapretti, it's chicken, mushroom, spinach, pine nuts, creaminess and I opted for the gluten-free pasta which was fusilli. It was a big dish, I had left overs, I had it boxed, I took it home, I reheated it and it was oh so delicious all over again!!

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ginger vanilla greyhound

6FMBulHkB2k4ZG6QVwWkhA.text: Went to my first choice always to find a good Italian restaurant near my hotel. Yelpers got it right once again! I ordered what many Yelpers liked- the strozzapretti. I thought the translation of " strangle the priest" an odd name for a dish and I still don't get it?! But it was delicious with a light cream sauce, a bit of spinach and hearty sliced mushrooms and chicken. If you like Alfredo, this is superior to this and you will like this. My 14 yo son loved it!   Both of these pasta dishes came out in heaping bowls which I liked. We had enough to take back to the hotel for another meal even so a good amount.  The Bolognese is their specialty dish. With hearty tagatelle noodles and lots of Parmesan cheese mixed in I believe, which made it too salty. I think leaving the cheese out and grate it freshly over this dish to your preference would have been better and would not have made it so salty. My son thought this dish was salty as well.  The appetizer of crispy calamari was a different kind and not very crispy but more breaded very lightly and then grilled with a light lemony vinaigrette. This was different than your normal expected fried calamari but it was very good in its own right and served over a platter of arugula which is an acquired taste for some, but I love arugula so good for me! My son loved this dish as well. They don't have a side dipping sauce with this, but you can ask for a marinara sauce on the side if you want.   Oh, we soooo wanted to try the desserts that Yelpers recommended, but we were just too full! Darn!  From the charming entrance of a patio cafe setting, with misting sprays which felt so good during the 106 degree heat, with a fireplace outside and a beautiful ocean and dock mural- aesthetics hits all the bells and whistles! Loved that you can see the kitchen with the saying on the wall( look at my pictures), the wooden slat ceilings, big balls of gold lighting- just a fresh, modern, chic and hip place to meet with friends.  Then the staff...from the host who was just as stylish and very nice to our waiter Carl who was extremely busy but always found time to check if we were doing okay! He was awesome and all the staff we encountered were very friendly and helpful. We appreciated them even more, knowing they were so busy. Thank you! Loved the VIBE of this place!

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Loved the balls of light.
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The kitchen and the saying above it.
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Loved the ceiling even- everything just worked together.

d0O8yoJDzMnRTIgzPI0m7g.text: Simple meal...kept it simple this time around pre movie appetizer.  Sat at the bar and decided on a Stella, along with the soup of the day, tomato bisque; served with some house bread and dipping oil! I was set. Services as on point and the view from the bar was awesome.

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ZYXBm6eT3bjjXwZXJnwrGw.text: PROS: -Beautiful decor with large outdoor window (reminds me of the restaurants/bars in San Diego), it gives  the restaurant a wider space & I loved looking at the sunset from my seat -Friendly staff, delicious food, & strong drinks ;)  DRINKS 5/5: -Rosemary & lime ($12): vodka with rosemary & lime, it was the right amount of strong but also tasted delicious -Ginger blossom margarita ($14): my friend got this & it was delicious! I loved the ginger, cucumber & lime flavor  FOOD 5/5: -White truffle garlic bread ($13.5): bread with ricotta, Barbarella & herbs. This was such an amazing appetizer! -Prosciutto bruschetta ($13): lots of bruschetta and it was topped with grilled asparagus; this was delicious.  -Squid ink mafaldine ($22): shrimp, calamari, with squid ink. This had such amazing flavors! I loved the texture of the pastas  DESSERTS 5/5: -Salted caramel budino ($8.50): this was so delicious, its a soft thick cream :) -Tiramisu ($9): MY FAVORITE DESSERT! They did such a fabulous job with the tiramisu. It is literally to die for.  -Overall, I highly recommend this place if you're craving for REAL Italian food :) This restaurant went above my expectations & I want to come back for their happy hour :)

Opa0VXXf2kYHZf1ziEoQtQ.text: Love North Italia...but this is the fourth time in a row we have come to the restaurant for wine and tiramisu and they have been out. We even came earlier this time as to not arrive an hour before closing. Argh!!! Wonderful staff, great food, pleasant atmosphere. I think we need to rethink the dessert and how many we make if we deep running our before closing. And yes...their tiramisu is wonderful!! Get there early if you're having dessert!

X-xo6UkID6eTGpxuHEBYdw.text: I was so excited to try this place after my friend recommended we lunch there. We sat outside on the patio and waited. The server seemed nice enough to me just not trained at all as it took 10-15 for water.  We ordered the burrata, artichokes which we not cooked enough at all and over oiled. The presentation was nice the food was not edible. We also ordered the calamari which was oily and super breaded (adding arugula doesn't disguise low quality)The burrata looked really nice but unfortunately we got dive bombed by a bee. We hadn't even gotten to really eat our plate because of the bees.  Our server took our bee plate away and never even asked if he could make us a new one. We left hungry and thirsty. Worst meal I've ever had in Vegas.

7hD0waOZaenUzziSxIawCA.text: Nice neighborhood restaurant ... food was good but did not blow me away like I was hoping and expecting. A group of 4 ladies and we like to sample each other's choices. Apps: calamari, strangely unique with a thicker than usual coating which was good if you ate it immediately. Arancini, eh it was just ok but would not order again. Zucca chips ... very good selection but sliced a bit too thin to eat gracefully. Bread with olive oil ... $8 ?? Hmmmm was expecting more for 4 slices of bread.   Drinks were kinda overpriced. This is not the strip so stop charging strip prices. Glass of wine with an 8 ounce pour was reasonably priced at $18.   Moving onto the entrees. I chose a simple meatballs and spaghetti option. Pasta was good, meatballs were just good and the sauce was just good .. nothing about this dish was mind blowing. Was hoping it was a wow but it wasn't. One friend had the scallops with risotto and another chicken Parmesan.   Dessert was the best course ... with a scoop of lemon sorbet leading the pack. Tiramisu was very good as well as the Italian donuts. I had a latte and my friend had a cappuccino...both were served lukewarm.   All dishes were good but not one of us had the omg wow factor we were hoping for. Will I be back ?? Hmmm .. the jury is out.

ItkaYGTq7vrv8flaMsn2pg.text: It was my first time here we ordered a pasta dish and a Caesar salad. The pasta dish was delicious it had mushrooms and seeds, very earthy that's how I love it.  The Caesar salad was good, my bf added chicken to it but it was $20! I'm not usually one to complain about price but it just wasn't a $20 salad. Anyways I definitely won't be ordering any salads here, pastas yes.

EHTOB1qLkieoFdl9_dL9GA.text: Food was okay, service was okay, whole experience here was just okay for me.   I came here with my 2 cousins for my birthday dinner and the food was pretty pricey for what it is and how it tastes in my opinion. We ordered the arancini ($11), bolognese ($20), braised short rib ($31), and margherita pizza ($18).   Arancini - the middle was kind of cold when I broke into it and ate it (and we ate it right when it came to the table too)... the flavor was alright and the texture was alright as well. The tomato sauce that was under the arancini wasn't anything to write home about.   Bolognese - tasted like chef boyardee ravioli, but the pasta noodles itself were really good and had a nice bite to it.   Braised short rib - for the price and portion of this short rib, I expected it to melt in my mouth. Unfortunately, it was a dry and was pretty mediocre compared to all of the other braised short ribs I've had. The polenta under it was delicious though.   Margherita pizza - the mozzarella was rubbery, marinara didn't have much taste to it, and the bottom of the pizza was BURNT. Extremely disappointed in this margherita pizza as it is so simple, yet they ruined it.   I got to choose a dessert for my birthday on the house, which was very nice of them. I got the hazelnut torta, and although decent, I definitely would not have paid $ for it.   ALSO, when we left there was a HUGE cockroach coming out from behind our booth. Which was disgusting, but I definitely understood because it was hot out and the waitress told us pest control comes every 3 months. BUT, STILL WOW GLAD WE SAW THE COCKROACH AFTER WE LEFT

WVKeLoRJl4kufzfjsXolLQ.text: This was a first for me at the North Italia and it was a great experience. A little more attention to a couple small details and it would've been perfect.   The night started with our good friends booking through Opentable. We walked in about 15 min early and were seated right away on a busy Friday night. It was a little unfortunate but the candle on our table was not lit (small detail) nor did it ever get lit the rest of the meal. Not a big deal but literally everyone else's was lit. We were promptly greeted with the menus and drink orders were taken. The waitress did not tell us about the soup of the day, the pizza of the day or any specials. Fortunately I saw it written on the board on the way in and nobody else seemed interested anyway.   Drinks showed up promptly and shortly after the appetizers came in. The appetizers we got for the table included the calamari - perfectly battered and fried - the batter had a tiny bit of sweetness which was quite nice, the grilled cauliflower - topped with a nice runny egg was also quite nice, and also the white truffle garlic bread - amazing. We are off to a good start!  The main courses seemed to take a little long to come out and the waitress was nowhere to be found, nor did she ever come and give us any update. When the main courses finally did come out - they did not come out at the same time, which was very unfortunate. Our friend's steak was getting cold while the rest of us were waiting.   Diver scallops were seasoned perfectly and had a beautiful sear. The short rib radiatori was very tender and flavorful and while the pasta was also beautifully cooked, the portion size seemed a little bit small for the price.   After we finished the entrees, dessert menus were handed out - unfortunately the waitress did not take the time to explain or recommend anything so I found myself googling on my phone what a budino and a torta was. The desserts we ordered were all visually appealing and quite rich/sweet - I'd suggest getting a black coffee to go with the tiramisu or the budino if you get any of those.  All in all a wonderful meal in a great atmosphere but a little more care and attention to detail from the waitress would've just made it perfect. For an upscale casual dining atmosphere I would definitely come back - but I'd probably do a little more of my own research on what to order before I come.

vHiB2icSxm5yPyDxxdnOgw.text: North Italia never disappoints.  I know when I leave, I will be more than happy with the food and service, and today was no different.  Ben assisted us, and he was great.  Friendly, professional and efficient.  We each had the soup of the day which was tomato bisque, it was delicious, so creamy and good, with croutons and cheese, fabulous.  I had my favorite Burrata salad, which is toasted bread, lots of Burrata, and a variety of heirloom tomatoes and arugula, I love it. My friend had the Italian Grinder sandwich, with a side salad, she loved them both. We were stuffed, no room for dessert. Start to finish, everything was wonderful.  Highly recommend.

EcdJENN3MRgOX27VLGpygw.text: Great place to hang out on patio! Good food and good service everytime I have been there. Prices are reasonable. Gets busy and great for people watching. I'll be back.

4hPQC2cYqPqZJjB5jrn7EA.text: I have been dying to try out this place for a while and it is defiantly worth the hype! This is such a cute spot in the Summerlin area.   I love the atmosphere, very open, green, young, fresh, etc.! It is very loud with the open atmosphere, however it wasn't bothersome and I could still here the group of people I was with.  I got the chicken pesto pasta and it was amazing! Very fresh tasting which I love. Will come back to this spot again!

chipnjX39ud3uOQWPx2Low.text: I went for the pasta but got so full after the happy hour. It's a great open environment with tasty food! My boyfriend and I had the charcuterie board and pizza. I could probably have that charcuterie every day. The happy hour had such great prices you could try multiple dishes without disappointment.

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States

a4JBsmPMcv4thTQ5IB0AIA.text: Some friends were in town from Calgary and we decided to try North Italia for something new.  I made a reservation and we were seated at the time reserved.  Since it was a pleasant early evening, we opted for the patio which made for a great dining experience--and the heaters were on.  First, we ordered their Chef's Board--happy hour priced at $10.  The menu says it's "meat, cheese & some other goodies."  I forgot to take a photo of the board we dived in so quickly.  The prosciutto was good, there was enough cheese to each have some, and the almonds were a nice addition.  It was a very good starter.  We thought we were ordering the regular Chef's board--we didn't look at the Happy Hour menu.  I wonder if there would have been more prosciutto with the regular menu our server automatically got us the Happy Hour board although we were ordering from the main menu.  After that start, we looked at the menus we had kept for round 2.  We ordered their pizza they call The Pig.  Toppings are spicy pepperoni, soppressata, and Italian sausage.  This gave us time to space out our meal and spend more time catching up on news.  It was 6 months since I last saw them.  The pig is good.  The crust was thin and the pizza was the bendable kind.   Fold it in half to eat rather than losing toppings sliding off.  We didn't get dessert.  I reapply would recommend the patio.  It was so pleasant!

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Pig pizza.
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fireplace in waiting area and patio.
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Exterior.

r2KsrkcX8DuoNebwjDq6wQ.text: This restaurant has a great outdoor area and has beautiful decor. However the menu is so limited there isn't much I want to order. I have ordered the margharita pizza twice and both times was disappointed. The crust seemed over cooked and the pizza was soggy. The second time the same thing. It just wasn't good. My friend also ordered the pizza and didn't like hers either. We ended up just eating a bunch of bread and olive oil. The bread was good. I can say that. I also tried one of the soups. It was $8 for a small bowl and wasn't very good. It should have cost about $4 I think for the amount I got. Maybe it would be nice to just sit outside and have a drink but I don't think I'd order any food here again.

hwlQQfMOorLaKm2_ZpYm0A.text: First time at North Italia. Food was excellent! For a Wednesday, it was pretty busy! The host was wonderful and even when we requested specific seating after he had given us a 30-40 minute wait, he got us those seats in less than 10 minutes. Another server was super sweet and trying to help us out as well!  Food was delicious! We started with the meatballs, then shared family style the arancini, prosciutto bruschetta, and the strozzapreti (?).   My only negative would be that service was a little slow. With that being said, a manager was great for coming around with refills, answering questions, and helping his staff. I am in the industry and understand how tough it can be when it's a crazy busy night, especially on a day that isn't usually very busy. I have to praise for the teamwork, food, and how friendly the staff was. We can't wait to go back and try all the things!

g1r4FkzDfTitqXNPN7DsAQ.text: Their customers service is slow and not very good. I got splashed twice at the table, and I thought I was in an cirque "O" show. We sat down and it took the waitress 20 minutes to come and say hi. We waited another 30 minutes for the food arrived, by then I was so starved that I have to asked for bread. Then the waitress asked how was the food, I said" it was bland." She just said "oh" and walked away. I dont think we will go back there, no thank you.

0q7TrMr5pGF4LRhM7qK3AA.text: Love this place! Everything we ordered was good. Appetizer plate had fresh meat, cheese and nuts. So good. Also ordered a pizza and some pasta dish.  Excellent!

Ucnm1IIO7SNtqLMtSM14JA.text: Went for a Sunday brunch with group of friends who meet once a month at different restaurants. Being at 1130 in the day wanted something light. Another friend and I chose the Italian salad. Well you would , for $14, expect a decent size salad. If I were to take regular size salad bites, it would have been gone in 4 bites! Trying to make it last while others were eating, I took itty bites and still was gone before you knew it. Maybe gave me and my other friend a half portion by mistake. That must be it! No, when got the bill -$14. Will never go back. My friend and I both agreed ridiculous price for what was served.

Dut9d2x2NBWkfC0RkqyGPA.text: I'm Italian. My wife is allergic to garlic. This Italian never gets out to Italian restaurants. But, my wife wanted to try this place after seeing pictures online. They customized her dishes to have zero garlic, so a big thank you to them!  Our waitress was also excellent and personable. A big recommend.

olBRf95RHKkRk4C8R_j9gg.text: I heard about this place from a friend and I am so happy I checked it out. Our server recommended the arincini balls.. OH..MY..GOSH.. and then their squid pasta was unlike anything I've ever tried. Highly recommend it. The service was amazing. Our server, Eli, was super kind and really funny...also really tall lol.. I don't remember laughing with servers at other places as much as we did with eli. Anyways, awesome place, awesome service, AWESOME food. Will definitely be back

miO3gonOSuScWLB82vLEjg.text: Stellar service and experience! I ordered the Burrata Tortelloni and my girl got the Eggplant Pizza. Both were fresh and delicious! We finished with the Salted Caramel Budino and Hazelnut Torta for desert. So good... Thank you to our server Brenda and manager Gabe for taking care of us and making sure our first visit was rad

G9HfXs50SA7IV139sU_Kuw.text: Marie and Tacie..omg they are amazing.. what a fun night with my amazing friend Nicole celebrating her bday!!. We Will come back for the food but continue to come back for the servers and their service.. thank you ladies for an amazing night!!

HWpg0sgrEIrUCmvWQ6UloQ.text: First timer and I had the best experience very friendly staff I will be going there again and recommending it to friends and family

m5uK5UxVp8IrCXbenmIN7g.text: Wow, the food has amazing flavor that i can taste it through my stuffy nose. We had the calamari( love the grilled lemon), the Chef's Board had so many flavors and textures, the Strazzapreti and Bolognese were delicious. My husband declared this is his new favorite Italian restaurant.

yTPTTFCY8k8fmEWmAZnrlA.text: This is probably one of the best Italian restaurants in Vegas !!! The food is soo good. I always get the burrata and the Italian grinder is amazing !! I 100% recommend this place !!

OF0tnr_h6EKNhUouDFP4-g.text: This is the new hotspot in Summerlin. Years back everyone would go to Kona Grill across the street before their remodel and now this is the best local spot outside of Red Rock casino in the area. Food is great, ambiance is stellar and very lively. Great spot to go to on the weekends!

7kEsmqYEMo1ZukvqaUdtzg.text: Service is amazing at the bar. Sometimes they are so busy it's hard to get fast food. Take your time and enjoy the atmosphere and food. It's worth it! Very good food but limited me use.

-OLS5RY46Cqu0KS_SMMTLA.text: Just moved to Vegas and found this great restaurant. The food is delicious and apparently everything is made fresh each day. We had a stellar server, Bonnie, who was so sweet and friendly. She really enhanced our guest experience. We left with a full stomach and a smile on our faces. This will be a restaurant we go to regularly.

_hrBhqnbSWWxzlihFjm11g.text: I love this place, the food is delicious and the atmosphere is very nice and chill. This place is always busy, so if you go plan about 15 min wait time, but it is totally worth it. Last time we were there our server Valentino was amazing. Great service!

6iU-rD8cPnmhrSu_Orgezg.text: My favorite place to go in summerlin! I go frequently; The food is amazing but the service is even better, Tacie in particular is the best! She is so attentive to detail regardless of how busy it is, her energy always lightens my night. Marie and Jen have also been AMAZING to me when I come in. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone in Vegas.

VCVURJqT7kscVpyb-v1ymg.text: pleasantly surprised with this place. first time to eat here and yes we finally have a go to place for Italia food in Summerlin.

z317_H-LlLIm7RjAsdBkdQ.text: It didn't disappoint. It is on my list of favorite Italian restaurants. The food was very delicious.  Only thing i can point out, is the service does need improvement.

-1YTY3EwozpsylDgHSPCkw.text: Love this place! We ordered the zucca chips that was so good that we had to ordered another serving, chef board is definitely a must to order we love everything in it. SQUID INK MAFALDINE-(white shrimp, calamari, acqua pazza, mint, fennel pollen, calabrian chili) just perfect! SHORT RIB RADIATORI-(parmesan cream, fresh horseradish, wilted arugula, herbed breadcrumb) this pasta is so flavorful, the beef is so tender. BOLOGNESE (HOUSE SPECIALTY-traditional meat sauce, tagliatelle noodle & grana padano cheese) this is the best bolognese I've ever had. We were so full to have dessert. We just love everything we had. Service is really good too.

udY15gGgWPQP2deO-8y3hg.text: I dined here last night and I'm not quite sure why everyone is raving about this place. We ordered the Chefs Board which was very good. It took an inordinate amount of time to arrive at our table (20+ minutes). We were not even halfway through our appetizer when our entrees were unceremoniously slapped down on our table. We were not even asked if there was anything we needed. The server that delivered the food disappeared as quickly as she appeared. The Bolognese was very dry with little to no meat. In hindsight I should have sent it back. Once our entrees were served our server was like a ghost until it was time to pay. I felt like I was putting the server out when I asked her for some Parmesan cheese for our pastas. When the cheese was delivered we were only given enough cheese for one serving of pasta so we asked for Parmesan cheese for the the other bowl of pasta. I won't be returning. For $115 dinner I felt like the service was definitely lacking and the food was subpar. Wolfgang Puck at Downtown Summerlin is far superior with much better service, a nicer atmosphere and excellent food. Super disappointed, maybe I just went on an off night?

_RXvTA4tYIJT-kFlXlkFdQ.text: My friends and I went there yesterday for happy hour. At first we didn't expect much but it turn out to be such a fun evening. We end up finish 2 bottles of wines and some drinks lol. Great atmosphere, good food and friendly service.

xQ7W7DPsZ4kfgPMmMBtXaw.text: I love this place . We needed something like this in Vegas. Atmosphere was great , food delish , servers are awesome . Our server was nick , he is great very  welcoming and friendly . We had the chef broad , calamari and pizza . Everything was tasty . By the way I've been there twice this week . I just loved it

HjIRA1PhM5tA_9XggdaWPA.text: This is a place with very refined food in a very modern and open setting. The food is elegant and very good, and the ambiance is more casual. It is quite noisy here, so you will have to speak up. Now, the food. The truffle bread was very cheesy and decadent, without overdoing it on the truffles, which some restaurants seem to have a hard time with. My entree was the squid ink pasta, which I got because I wanted to see what squid ink tasted like. It, surprisingly, had earthy notes instead of a sea flavor. There was also squid in the pasta, gave it a good combination of flavors. Make sure to get dessert, as the donuts are light and delicious.

oKUZs-hE3RiMd2hjUdaJxg.text: It is a great testaurant! Good food, great service, fun place! The pasta is home made, the salads are fresh and large.   We enjoyed it very much!

cF_uU2goAP7i_O4-KY2tww.text: Brand new, great food, service was fantastic! Sit at the bar and ask for Tacey;, she took fantastic care of us!   Lemon donuts- yes! Prosciutto bruschetta- yes! Homemade pasta- yes, yes! Half off bottles of wine on Sunday FTW!  It is a restaurant from a restaurant group, so we were concerned. They really have an attention to detail and it was above and beyond what we expected.

_AAz_EzLldxqNZ0musC6rQ.text: We went here for my boyfriends birthday and it was the best dining experience we've had in ages. We loved the open layout and ambiance, service was exceptional and the food was delicious. We started with a few items off the happy hour menu including the "chefs board" and a bottle of wine for $20 which was such a great value and so good. We then shared the diver scallops with risotto entree and tiramisu fo dessert which were both amazing. All high quality, fresh ingredients and the prices were very reasonable. We will definitely be back

HGZlOI5yMOi0_UpeYinuLA.text: Got theMargarita pizza and was very pleased. I was halfway done with my pie and decided to try my daughters gluten free pizza. Surprisingly, I couldn't tell that it was GF. She loved it and fought me off from eating more. The tiramisu was awesome and was a nice finish to our dinner!

kISkte17xCOOlSqIfCWU7g.text: This is a fun neighborhood Italian place.  For the price the food is great.  I would highly recommend the meatball app and the Bolognese. There are very generous happy hour deals.  The bar is lively and staffed by fun people who provide excellent service.  Last night a large Thursday night crowd was handled with ease by Marie, Casey and Jennifer.  Give this place a try.  You will not be disappointed.

dm6j0GaGTxP7aM3Qe07_RA.text: I went here with 3 friends for a Sunday brunch. One friend ordered "The Pig", a three meat pizza. The crust was perfectly fluffy and not too thin. Another ordered the " Short Rib Hash". Which is only available on weekends and was delicious.   Suffice to say we will be returning at some time in the near future.

8vJXsDHrueQKx3SqwA1uQg.text: I had a large party of 30 people here, and everyone was so impressed with the food and the service! Alix, the district manager, and David, the restaurant's event coordinator, helped me to plan the menu and make it perfect. When I realized that one of my guests was vegan just a few minutes before the event started, David helped me to organize an entree for my vegan guest from Flower Child (owned by the same company) at no charge. It was so nice to have all the help that David and our servers (Bonnie and one young man who was very helpful) provided. We'll definitely be coming back for more parties!

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States

W4AapNd__TOMdbbk3X5r0A.text: Anticipating a relaxing glass of wine after a day of shopping my cousin and I were looking forward to trying North Italia In Rampart Commons. We arrived at 5pm and the outdoor space was well occupied so we opted for the bar inside since we only wanted a drink. We were seated and presented with menus by the bartender. That was the last we saw of her. Another bartender arrived to work as another closed out at the register and left. The new arrival served guests  who arrived after we did, but after some time it became apparent that we had been overlooked. We left, unnoticed. We are 70 something ladies and it would be easy to plead age discrimination. But I don't think that's what happened here. Better training and communication for staff is what is needed at this establishment.

5GSN4oqMx4AFXu3AQh8kxg.text: I've been here many times, food is always delicious, service is always great.  This is my go-to pho place for this area.

qfarmGy8Ob831Th8Hm5qBQ.text: This was my first visit to North Italia and it certainly won't be my last! The food was absolutely delicious and the service was to match. Our server was Bonnie and she legitimately was the nicest and most attentive server we've ever had at any restaurant. My girlfriend and I had the Italian grinder and the meatball sandwich, respectively, and both were amazing. All the food was very fresh and it showed. We will definitely be back here again and I'd recommend anyone thinking of coming to do so.

T3xXr5z3obcvT3YxEFMtqg.text: This is by far my favorite restaurant in town! To be honest mainly thanks to Nick, our waiter, he made sure we were taken very good care of, he was very attentive and made amazing suggestions. He was very professional yet funny and easy going. The food was beyond amazing, everything we tried exceeded our expectations. He helped us with wine recommendations as well and of course loved that!  Price wise, I feel it was very reasonable . I highly recommend this place and can't wait to be back there again soon.

EAOqdfQaOYMXYox1E_oOuQ.text: Came for Italian cuisine but fell in love with the atmosphere, between watching a determined Lebron battle the warriors, to chatting it up with a manager that goes above and beyond to make everything special, Gabriel has won my loyalty to this amazing restaurant and all future recommendations for Italian cuisine.

RapgOwIoT7EJrAJfHrf73A.text: Great service and awesome interior but food was meh. Squid ink pasta was bland along with their other dishes.

I0EmR9hejDwn_9ebwiWkxg.text: My 5 stars take in to consideration price, ambiance, and quality. I had lunch that consisted of Tuscan tomato soup, tagliatelle Bolognese, and chicken parmesan. The soup was rich and wonderful, the bolognese was one of the better ones I've had in Vegas, and the chicken parm actually had some crunch. The parmesan pasta side with the chicken was not an afterthought, but very tasty. I look forward to going back again for dinner.

Sd1hgsMGiTabIgn5bFy6XQ.text: Tried this place this past weekend, I didn't get the full experience because I didn't actually sit down for dinner instead i put in a order for pick up so this review is solely based on the food and the amount of time it took for the food to be ready which was very reasonable (about 20-25 min). I'm so glad I actually tried this place because everything I got was incredibly tasty. From the margarita pizza to the tortellini, I also ordered the arugula & roasted fennel salad and the heirloom tomato and burrata which were both so light yet so pleasing. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone wanting to try a new Italian restaurant, you won't be disappointed as far as how the food tastes!

EhCJkWblTuyEZHhYRB26WQ.text: Love it! The ambiance was so chill and welcoming and service was on point.  Came here with my husband for Sunday brunch, I was not feeling to good as I was recovering from a massive hangover so I needed food ASAP.  As appetizers we ordered the seasonal soup which had potato, sausage and kale soup and we also ordered the prosciutto bruschetta.  The soup was so good and comforting and the bruschetta was on point too.  For my entree I decided to order the Bolognese and my husband had the Squid Ink Mafaldine.  My bolognese very good and the pasta was cooked perfectly (BTW this pasta cured my hangover).  My husband's pasta was really good too, the flavors were really unique and tasty.  For dessert we had the hazelnut torta, very good as well.  Can't wait to go back and try some pizza and other pasta dishes.

rrRAfTXtMWDUXdJc-w7How.text: We were seated without reservations within 5 minutes.  The hostess asked for a phone number; when I refused she was fine with locating me. My dining companion ordered the Caesar salad while I had the onion soup.  Both were exceptional. Strozzapreti was the special that my friend ordered.  He loved the meal so much that he decided he was going to make it upon his return to Boise.  I took him to a Cost Plus World Market to make sure that he returned home with the correct pasta. I ordered the chicken rosemary.  Everything was fresh, well-seasoned, served at the right temperature, and prompt.  The restaurant was pretty well-packed and there were many patrons who had opted to dine al fresco. Our waiter was familiar with the dishes, how they were prepared, and what most people enjoyed.  He was engaging and present when his services was requested. While it is not on the Strip or anywhere near downtown Las Vegas, I would strongly recommend this restaurant as a good value for your dollar as well as an excellent source of genuine Northern Italian fare.

gKT0IjnOl_OtoG1yGXKumw.text: By far the best Italian restaurant I've tried hands down!! Wonderful customer service and unbelievably delicious food! Ryan at the bar was so helpful with educating us on recommendations as well as accommodating exceptional hospitality. Try the White Truffle Garlic Bread, its the best garlic bread especially with the ricotta cheese!!

YK8R6PwUofp2eQfLXB1bgg.text: The happy hour can't be beat! Bottle and cheese board for 20 dollars?! And pizza of the day is always a good call. My co-workers go here frequently after work and are always happy about their choice. Also, away from the HH menu, the overall food quality is on point.

kTGuWjTTYqVYSdjqYVpABg.text: My wife wanted to go out for lunch so I said we should try North Italia in Summerlin.  It was our first time to try their food and service and we were not disappointed.  We were seated as soon as we arrived my wife had a view of the restaurant and I was able to observe the kitchen staff prepare our meal.    Joe was our waiter and he was most helpful with suggestions on what to eat, we shared a caesar salad, my wife ordered the mushroom pizza with smoked mozzarella and I ordered the pig pizza.  The food came all at once and it was outstanding.  We even tried one of the desserts a bombolini which was one of the best things I have ever tasted.  Thanks to Joe we will be back again very soon to try their Brunch menu.

_CZ2D09979pTxK8660v5-g.text: Seriously the best pasta I've ever had in my life. Hands down the most fresh ingredients yet the best blends of seasonings that they have created to each and every single dish! The best recipes I swear! Every single pasta I've had is just mind blowing how great and packed of wonderful flavors put into one plate are. Never ever disappoints at all . It's always packed full and very busy but the wait is so worth it. It's not just because it's new that I love it , its really mainly how freshly things are made here you can tell just in the taste. The place inside is just decorated beautifully and the tables are not crammed by one another. Great staff everyone's very nice and friendly from the second you step in and just full of smiles. Thank you for the great food north!

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HOv6f3627ytYI6SSCrHjNA.text: Had a wonderful night here.  All the servers were friendly with great suggestions.  We tried the calamari, chicken pesto pasta, Short rib pasta, margarita pizza, tiramisu and Italian coffee.  Everything was delicious, Short rib pasta and calamari were my faves.  Can't wait to go back and try other dishes.

0n7HUIycRoUOIwMfJI3nuQ.text: Came here for the soft opening and I will definitely return! Super cute Atmosphere and decor. Very friendly staff. We started off with the kale salad and it was a good portion. My boyfriend ordered the ckn parm and it was pretty good but the short rib pasta was Amazing, melt in your mouth deliciousness. Heard Sunday's will be half off bottles of wine and I'm pretty excited about that. Very open floor plan with a great patio! Thanks for the great dining experience! Will be back  :)

MPexPz8xWF1A8DFHN0ABgQ.text: Just excellent! Friendly and attentive staff, space is beautiful, and food is delicious! Arancini balls, handmade tortelloni, short rib, and tiramisu......all spot on. Even the biscotti that came with my friend's panna cotta was one of the best I've ever had. Unfortunately, they were out of a bottle of wine that we wanted, and one of the desserts. We'll forgive them this time ;) Definitely recommend.

0yUKdooo6pf7lGPuH3MEiw.text: Very enjoyable experience. This place is busy so make reservations. Food was fun and service was friendly.

zIaLu2wFqmVtkExNWebMnw.text: We heard the reviews.  Did not disappoint.. one of the new restaurants in our neighborhood... ..great ambiance.. bit busy on a Thursday.. so service  slightly slow. ..nonetheless  it was great experience.  Great food.. pasta freshly made. You can see behind the counter how it's  made. squind ink malfadine was too die for.. . Strozzapetti was delish too.  For app we had arancini and calamari.  Different take on calamari seems like it has balsamic reduction but it was lemon vinaigrette  which is good. Arancini .. gotta say had better.. lack mozzarella.. one I'm  used to My friends had pizzas.. they were good too..burrata appetizer was awesome!  For dessert.. the tart and hazelnut torta are my fave.  Tiramisu is different  but good. Bombolini with lemon sauce.. i dont care for..but that's  just me .. too tart... will come back and try their other dishes

C6D52oTNCwmqgefbJejE5Q.text: Love this place! Wonderful service, delicious food and great ambiance. North Italia never disappoints - apps to dessert is spot on and hour hour is great too!!!

J7Ph_jeYVl1phRieoOpKkA.text: This was my second visit to North Italia.  I was treating my friend to drinks and apps for her birthday.  I knew they didn't offer happy hour on Friday's but loved the food before so thought it was still a good choice for Fri afternoon.  The atmosphere is great!  The bar area is fun and inviting- not all crammed in like some places.   Our server Rita was amazing!  Always there at the perfect time.  I ordered a bottle of an Oregon Pinot that sounded interesting and it was amazing!  Rita was very knowledgeable about the wine and told us to save some for desert because she knew the perfect pairing.   she did not disappoint and brought us a delectable piece of mascarpone cheesecake on the house!  What a treat and perfect with the Ribbon Ridge Oregon Pinot!! We were not disappointed with our appetizers.  Grilled artichokes are stupendous although I think they could put a little more effort into the dipping sauce.  Plain mayo?  How about some aioli please!  We also had meatballs that were absolutely delicious and if your a bread lover you must have the Truffle bread it's sinfully scrumptious!!    I'm holding back on the fifth star due to the size of the cocktail glasses.  2 friends joined us and had cocktails served in oversize shot glasses.  Really??  Come on North Italia!!  The prices warrant a real glass please!!  Overall a lovely place; thank you Rita for your excellent service!!

QZBv9awTp3jai4Zyq_HjWg.text: I ate at North Italia in Irvine, CA where I lived at the time.  Thought I was going to miss it now that I live in Summerlin.  Merry Christmas to me!  North Italia is now in Summerlin!  Not to be missed. Pizza is delicious and the drinks and food is great. The staff is beyond wonderful. Cole, the AM was attentive and friendly. I love the hip vibe of the place. There is also a heated patio with a fireplace. Can't wait to hang with my friends there!

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SCKKDBJK8v79idW9H5qTqQ.text: Food was good, nice environment but honestly one of the worst services I experienced. Asked for cheese multiple times and never received it, when I finally got someone's attention they just brought the check. If you want to get rid of us just let us know and we won't come again!

wXDmS3AqkqL4ZpTZjbzE5A.text: Everything is perfect, from the ambiance to the food. We were presently surprised at how well the menu was priced and how generous the servings were. Their food is by far one of the best Italian that I've had and having celiac disease, their gluten free pasta was to die for. We are already looking forward to going back and trying new things! (Pictured: Chicken Parm and Gluten Free Pesto Chicken with a side of grilled asparagus and Brussels sprouts)

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wjVKM80-XNVAGWOEAKHBTw.text: Stopped in last night with friends for another fantastic meal. The food is always great and I love the atmosphere. We had an especially good time last night due to our server Gianna. She was sweet, attentive and funny. Request her if you go there, she made our night!

9ypq7V7MzWoIlIjscju8eg.text: It is the first week and training and over staffing are always an issue, especially in Las Vegas where the competition for a good meal and returning guests is at a premium.    But honestly four hostesses at the front of the house and a manager(?) having to identify a guest as either a reservation or walk-in put me off from the start....so the walk-ins must be placed in a different area (?) then being placed between a husband and wife couple who had two unattended children legitimately jumping and screaming for the first half of my meal and a party of 4.5 if you include the baby carrier that was placed in the seat where I had been sitting ...before getting up to go to the bathroom..it is those little lapses that cause me to choose somewhere else. Be consistent and respectful of all of your guests.   I would give them 4.5 stars for the food and the energy of the venue. The presentation is solid, the food is good and the service is attentive.   I am sure I will return.

HYJN84oRtgPfdYyoki588w.text: Good food good people. Dessert is unreal! The appetizers are all very tasty. I usually get the short rib hash for brunch. For dinner the Bolognese did not disappoint. Meat balls come w 6 so that's a perfect amount for sharing.

RCOsT2Ab3yjc31f_rNu31w.text: This restaurant is my new go to for Italian. The atmosphere is comfortable and the food is excellent! Jen R. Is a great server. Must try short rib pasta!

WuuyxeWkReC11GRm4yadwQ.text: First class happy hour in a pleasant setting.  Wide variety of Italian food at moderate prices.

Fm5aDgK5FHPYHduaEgWnEw.text: The best Italian restaurant in town by far. Weekly dinners here, and it's amazing!!! Try everything.

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States

RcMjSzoRPaw-KLlJdoHSAw.text: Really good food and the server was excellent!!!price point is spot on.... wine list nice and the ambience makes you feel welcome

r5uLD8eCnkqTq8QkbmN8Kg.text: The food taste good, but the menu is limited. Wish they had some lighter options.

vqYrkaGkvc9zCSdxQ38xgg.text: It's a pleasant new hot spot in Summerlin. Definitely will be back there again. Service and food choices are amazing and out/in bar set up is fun. Give this place a try.

BqoEsGLUcTnBid1QTBKkXg.text: Love this place for brunch, and happy hour! Drinks, service and food have all been amazing!   We've had their short rib pasta, breakfast pizza, meatballs, chicken parm, summer vegetable salad with salmon happy hour chefs board and hazelnut dessert. Everything has been phenomenal!

yTPrjhHjRAgQby6gRZXyTw.text: Great food.... customer service is excellent. Seating is tight but once your food comes you don't think about

U-1_LRR_mUmyM48vCgqqgQ.text: Last night was my second time going to North Italia and I'm glad I decided to go back to try it again after a disappointing first visit. On my first visit the food was good but the service was slow and disorganized.  Last night our meal was great and our server, Jenn was outstanding. She totally redeemed this restaurant for me. Without having to ask she brought us samples of wine, made sure our water glasses were full and took time to describe menu items to a tee. She also told us about what sounds like an amazing brunch and weekday happy hours. Before leaving, she brought us a brunch menu and info on happy hour to take with us. We had a wonderful dining experience because of her friendly attentiveness. Try the calamari appetizer and the house made pasta dishes. The gelato was great!

Bh9-9VDiHKLhNVk6kaK7OA.text: What a fun place to go lots of gluten-free friendly choices. The place is loud and buzzing everybody's happy the service is at 10 the food is yummy keep up the good work

lDx5L3vKb5HSiupglrcdeA.text: Our new favorite Italian food restaurant to come to..... we loved the ambience, the food,,,,,,, the service!!!   Chelsey was our server, and she was great!  Her attention to detail, prompt service and genuine concern in meeting our diet needs was much appreciated....  ( We will be back soon!!

MsEGKOSb78wJq3ttDOJELA.text: My new favorite restaurant. I agree with others. When you walk in you wonder how long it may take to be seated. The place is busy. Only took a few minutes.  Update: This place has only gotten better. It's my favorite now. Ambience is outstanding.  Service friendly and knowledgeable. Food great. Luv this restaurant

uihbMb2gaTZ6SEcL39R7Cw.text: Very nice decor with both outdoor and indoor seating  Service was prompt and attentive.  Our first dish was Calamari which was excellent, but the portion was very meager.  We ordered a bottle of Chardonay, which was fine.  The wine list is very pricy.  Bread was never brought to the table. We had to ask for some bread. Two  people at the table ordered the pasta bolongese which was excellent. Two ordered the pasta with short ribs. The beef was fine. but the sauce was a little rich.  The desserts were excellent.  All and All a nice experience for a chain restaurant.

YfrpQ1mEeSUL1prueQdmSQ.text: Everything was great ! Got the mussels , octopus , and pizza was all amazing . Desert was great except the Nutella one not the best . Drinks are excellent and coffees

ij9CxJzMayqVnd9g5O0wDQ.text: First time at North Italia-we made a reservation ahead of time which I recommend-the place is packed, unless you go after 9 am. Server-Olivia-was excellent, knew the menu very well and was very nice and helpful. Food was also very good-we ordered salmon and chicken. I certainly recommend this restaurant, we had a good time.

9IlaycCSHNQo580HRqZ7Rw.text: This was our first time in and I'll have to say we are joyed to see a new fresh restaurant on the west side of town.  The wife and I are giving North Italia a thumbs up and look forward to our next visit.  -Enjoy

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is how good the Bolognese was...bowl cleaning good.  We love this place
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Visit number two this time I decided on chicken in a white sauce and brought friends.   Everyone agrees that North Italia is a great find.

-HSyEvFuQGtECRvexUX0AA.text: Went here for a date night a few days ago and I can't wait to go back. We had the garlic truffle bread (delish!) to start and had ordered the chicken Parmesan and spaghetti and meatballs but when they brought our dishes out it was the Bolognese instead of spaghetti and meatballs so we sent it back to get the correct food but after about 10 or 15 minutes we realized maybe they had forgotten about the spaghetti and meatballs so we just told them don't worry about and cancelled it since we ended up being really full from the truffle bread and chicken parm(which was also SO GOOD) . We are easy going people so we didn't throw a fit(what's the point, life is too short and you can't trust people who yell at waiters anyway) the manager was wonderful and gave us a dessert on the house, which after learning the salted caramel one wasn't available(lol of course) he told us to try the hazelnut dessert which was heavenly.   The inside is really pretty and modern. The floors are slippery so be careful if you're trying to wear cute heals ya may fall.   Go eat here it's delicious!

fsn1wfLy841uyyAyVAn5SA.text: I went there for the first time.. And i have to say OMG.. Awesome.. Very clean.. Extremely nice wait staff.. My server GARIEL.. was so informitive extremely friendly such great service!!! Will be telling everyone!!!!

lWtnfafQkfBPb0ogZQroTQ.text: Very impressive pasta dishes and salads.  Pizzas are good but not gr8.  Menu has tasty small plates and sandwiches.   Love the ambiance and service.  Super bar menu and craft cocktails.  Spacious indoor and outdoor seating.  Gluten free available.  The bolonese and pesto pasta dishes are my favorites.

lgka_7CsXiCnjMnTixqr4Q.text: Really great first experience at North Italia. Had the bolognese and spaghetti and meatballs - both really good and fresh ingredients. Our waiter was Mason and he was attentive, helpful and really knowledgable. Thank you!

W7lNmHuhJy5Owq7hx2WxVA.text: I had to take a moment to write a review for this fantastic restaurant. I don't write many reviews but, the service and quality of food stands out! Great decor and good vibes! We were seated with smiles immediately for our reservation. My only regret is that I didn't take photos but,  I'll sure be back to revisit my favorite dishes! I had family in town and we decided to dine "family style" to get more flavors on the table as recommended by our friendly and informative server,  Giana. She gave us an awesome tour of the menu and we proceeded with her recommendations. Arugula salad, cauliflower, chefs meats and cheese, and all beef meatballs- so good! We decided to share a few pitchers of delicious sangria ! For the main course we had seafood pasta-spicy, bolonesse-meaty, branzino-light and flakey, and short rib- tender! I must say all equally delicious. Perfect amount for our fam. We couldn't resist dessert. We said send out the best 3! Donuts, tart, & hazelnut cake. We were curious about Italian after dinner drinks and she sent 2 out, hard to pronounce never mind spelling but, what an experience! All staff was personable, even the manager stopped by our table! We be back North Italia!

WtoQ2XBjAYlifqPaRaIzQQ.text: Great experience overall. Great food, great service, and the vibes of the restaurant were phenomenal.

whtm04rS8wHqANgwI2M1_w.text: I have eaten twice at North Italia and can highly recommend the food as well as our server, Mel. She was fantastic.

WX3PUA_TwCOeX1rHU-3r3Q.text: First time I fell in LOVE with this place was in Cali. When I heard it was in Vegas I was Ecstatic!! I cannot give this place enough stars.  They have the best happy hour; chefs board and a bottle of wine for $20, pizzas, salads, sangria. All the best stuff is on their happy hour.  The atmosphere is soooo adorable, this is reason enough to come here!!

We also ordered this amazing calamari and a nice margarita pizza. Our waitress was super nice and helpful. She gave us tips and ideas of what went well with your wine and the type of wine. The drinks were crafted perfectly. Great balance, great flavors. There was some kind of delay with my pasta, but both the bartender and the manager apologized to me multiple times. I wasn't in any kind of rush, so it was no bother to me. I took a star off for the pricing - kind of expensive for lunch, though they only have a dinner menu. dKVXhfqzm_hGUFS4ZGW-cg.text: Finally got around to trying this new place after hearing much hub bub... and it did not disappoint!   From top to bottom, the experience was great.    Warm, casual vibe ... huge alfresco deck... inside/outside bar area... display kitchen in the back... great overall dining room that simmers with energy.   The food was really good!  The fried calamari was excellent. The batter is a lighter tempura type and not deeply breaded... delicious. Had the short rib with pasta in a parmesan cream sauce... a bit rich and indulgent... but very good.  Almond mascarpone tart for desert was the perfect burst of freshness after the richness of the pasta.   Servers and hosts were friendly and helpful... couldn't be happier.    Can't wait for warmer weather to enjoy the alfresco dining!  Best west side dinner in a long while.

8Tht8RN7Q5kxQDx48zLSlQ.text: Love this place! Food, service, and ambiance here are amazing! Been to this restaurant both lunch and dinner time and all the menus we've tried were all delicious!
