spspY43GItbjv-w37NtxyA.text: I like the classy and clean feel of this place. The staff seem professional and to try. I need to come back and try more food, as I didn't find anything I particularly wanted. I did enjoy the lemon/ pastry I had.

qDHOkhtOUqtrGDswcfn1vQ.text: The vibe, decor and service pushes this place up to 4 stars.  Food wasnt bad but you can avoid the chicken parmesan and stick with a pizza or pasta.  The cheese bread appetizer was bomb and their pasta was cooked just right.  Save room for dessert so you can end your night with a little sugar if you aint gettin any after your date here because thats probably why youre coming here.

NS-0ffqAZg6C27zejgrLMg.text: My partner and I dropped by this place on the way to the cinema and caught the happy hour for a charcuterie board, some pizza and wine and we were SO impressed! The variety was great, the prices for Happy Hour were amazing and the all around vibe was so relaxing. We were outside where the atmosphere was so pretty and felt so authentic with cute inside/outside bar, fireplace and mosaic tile. Although there were quite a few tables outside, you still felt like you had your own privacy and the service was also incredible with any questions I had about the menu being well explained.

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States

o79m3vFPA_rHjMsKErXIWg.text: Soooo glad I decided to try this place out! My husband & I thoroughly enjoyed our entire experience here with the decor, ambiance, food & service.   We ordered a little bit of everything, since it was our first time here. For drinks we got the margarita & sangria. Both had blood orange in them and were delicious. For appetizers we got the calamari & white truffle garlic bread. The calamari was good. I really enjoyed the arugula and lemon with it. The bread with the truffle butter was absolutely incredible. Probably my favorite item there.   For our entrees we ordered The Pig pizza, which had a great airy crust and the spicy pepperoni had the perfect amount of heat & flavor. For a thin crust pizza is was fantastic because the crust never got soggy, like most. We also had the burrata tortelloni, which was really good. I loved the creaminess of the filling. I just wish there was a thicker sauce with it. The sauce was watery, so it was hard to have it with the pasta. It was more like a soup afterwards. Lastly for entrees, we got the chicken Parmesan and it did not disappoint. It was thin and crispy, without being greasy or dry. The pasta with it was fresh and light.   Next up was dessert. We ordered the affogato, which was my favorite. The espresso was smooth and the vanilla ice cream was the perfect amount of sweetness to it. On top of the ice cream were crunchy pieces of what seemed like crushed up chocolate espresso beans. Whatever they were, it was an amazing taste & texture to the affogato. Last for the night were the little donuts with this lemon custard sauce on bottom. I want to say they were called bombinos or bombilinis...something along those lines. They were warm, doughy & delicious. I could eat the lemon custard all by itself. It was amazing!   The thing I loved most was the service here! Our server was Jazmine and she was lovely. Super friendly. She recommended items and gave her honest opinion when we asked about certain options. She checked up on us consistently without being on top of us during our dining experience. Due to the incredible food and even more incredible service from Jazmine, my husband & I will definitely be back and we've already told friends they have to check it out!

AWHCoftVE0ObSWNPjuo03w.text: Busy on a Friday night! Found a few seats at the bar and enjoyed some delicious cocktails. Sangria wasn't good, luckily the bartender gave me a sample before I made the mistake of ordering a glass! Great customer service.

2lobvE1agFl3z_llmiwu8A.text: Waited over an hour for our food when the restaurant wasn't very busy. Manager came and apologized to us and it still took a long time to get our food. They still asked if we wanted more drinks during the extra time it took to bring out our food. Food wasn't as good as it usually is. We ordered the bolognese which was overpowered by the amount of lemon zest they put on it. I've had some long wait times here before but this time was exceptionally long. If they don't have the staff to keep up with customers than they might want to think about not opening the patio area.  This was previously a 2 star review but after the restaurant reached out to me I had a great interaction with them and their restaurant and changed my review accordingly. I understand even the best restaurants have bad days but overall I have enjoyed this place and would recommend it.

H5rLTJCwGzECPEG6x6d9fw.text: This place was really great. The service was superb and they treated my family and I well. We got the cheese and meat plate - that was kind of expensive for what we got, but it was yummy. We had a bottle of prosecco which was delightful. I ordered the kale salad and it was very good but nothing over the top. We were comped a dessert due to the long wait which was a sweet gesture they didn't have to do. The donuts were so delicious but if I were to had to pay for them - another slight overpriced. Great place but a little expensive.

OahaeP1nuTcCcDWI82ZUkg.text: Nothing special, while the entrees were good, the service was lackluster at best. Soup and meals came out at same time. No bread & olive oil or butter up front, an Italian must. Predominately geared at the millennial drinking crowd. Nice patio area, but the interior has all the ambiance of a bowling alley, just another cold chain restaurant.

0JkUN5lMt38XVel3t1fClw.text: Went for Sunday brunch. Restaurant was really busy. The server would forget small things that we had to repeatedly ask for. We ordered and had asked for everything to come out all at once but one thing that never came out was our pizza. The server had to constantly check on it and eventually told us that the chefs didn't make it right the first time so they had to redo it. We couldn't wait on the pizza or else the other food would get cold. We waited 30 minute total for the fresh pizza. I think they never even made it because we sat right next to the kitchen and never saw the first one come out "wrong". Honestly, the pizza should've been comped but it never was and that was the real bummer. The restaurant messed up and they didn't do anything about it. Food was good otherwise but I hope to have a different server and experience when I come back again.

_xd1EPHt2QzLp7cCNKXrzg.text: We had a wonderful lunch here. I had the meatball sandwich and my daughter had the seasonal vegetable salad. We'll be back to try some of the homemade pasta entrees. Our waitress was very friendly and explained how everything was made fresh. We liked her enthusiasm.

KvZi7-aMBRmRstlJqIFPPw.text: I've been wanting to have Sunday brunch at this place. Let me just start by saying it was excellent! I wish I could rate higher then a five . My husband had I the short rib hash and I had the nonna casserole. Which was so delicious and had to taste my husbands short rib hash which was also delicious. And the lemon donuts so good. If you want a great place to have brunch go there you will not be disappointed. If you are a foodie good there. I will go back to try something else. Service was also very good. The food is different not your usual brunch. It was awesome. Beautiful decor very rustic and modern beautiful patio. Great restaurant.

KyWfBxo2r62AfgbKVUuxTw.text: Okay so let me start with: YES, expect a wait! But they text you when you're tables gonna be ready so you can wait in your car! score! The food here is amazing, it's a little menu, but has a lil something for everyone! Leonard is the best server, so funny and gives A+ recommendations! Def one of my new favorite places in Vegas! 10/10 would indulge again

Z_txWF3TciPzyo2oTLkFmg.text: Pretty good menu, they have an excellent wine list also. Service is usually pretty good although lately it has been a little hit and miss. If you would like to sit on the patio deafly make reservations ahead of time.  I've only once but able to get a seat at the bar.

C1une7Y8r6gOLlBkm6wOVw.text: I would normally review a newer restaurant that I enjoyed to help jumpstart their business. This is not the case as North has already taken off on its own merit. The menu is not extremely extensive but is varied enough that I would order something different each time I return. We were a group of 9 so I did have the luxury of tasting many items. They were all very good, the pizzas, pasta, and salmon. The above sensational service provided to us by Gianna is what motivated me to write this. She made us feel as though we were the only table she was servicing. Whether it was a suggestion on what  and how to order for a group, to making certain our drinks were topped off, to making sure there were always enough appetizer plates for us. This was all done with a pleasant smile. She made a special occasion that much more joyous for us all. Thank you North and thank you Gianna!!!

MxdeFt6t9p0EXbHfawnIuA.text: Great flavorful Italian, modern look restaurant, the food would make me come back.  We had prosciutto bruschetta for an appetizer, chicken parmesan (wow) and bolognese (delicious). Entrees run about 18-22 - service was attentive.  To be honest I was worried about coming to a restaurant that only opened a week ago. I was pleasantly surprised.

GqeoVQBYVfJ_Q9377bnrPg.text: What a pleasant surprise! This restaurant is tucked in the shopping area off of Charleston and Rampart. There is a PF Chang on the corner and North Italia is located on the west side. Four of us stopped in for lunch and it was delicious. The Italian Grinder sandwich is large enough to split but don't do it! You will want the whole sandwich for yourself. It does come with either a small salad or potatoes- both delicious. Two of us shared the cheese board that had two cheeses olives, peppers, and spreads for the toasted French bread slices. One person ordered the Caesar salad. All very tasty and fresh.  This restaurant is known for the meatball sandwich so on the second visit (only two of us) we ordered that and the grinder sandwich. Unfortunately we were informed by the server that the meatballs were not ready. Apparently the very particular chef discarded the first batch of meatballs because they were not up to his standard. Wow, that is impressive and it underscores the attention to quality and fresh ingredients! We were impressed that the manager came by to explain. We ate our Grinder sandwich and took a meatball to go since it was ready by the time we finished our meal. My husband enjoyed the meatball sandwich and declared it delicious.  We ordered ice tea and our glasses were refilled frequently.  We sat inside on the first trip and outside on the second trip. The patio is lovely, comfortable and cool. This restaurant is a welcome addition to Summerlin and we will return soon.

vGj_kos_TCRj4Mereibvjw.text: I was excited for this restaurant as the same Fox concept restaurant is amazing in Phoenix and Austin. The food is good. The drinks are creative and there is a good variety of options.  Solid happy hour menu as well. They are lacking the friendly and timely staff for a restaurant like this that I hope improves over time as it is relatively new spot.  The patio is a good size and covered for those rainy Vegas nights.

_GAxfHulsIjIpGtX4Vj8rg.text: Went with my husband for dinner Saturday night. Had reservations and we were seated very quickly once we arrived. Everyone was polite and attentive. Waitress was very helpful and sweet. Had the white truffle garlic bread, meatballs, Cesar salad and short rib pasta along with a spinach chicken mushroom pasta and all were spectacular! We will def be back.

XLdocIRGFQhU-5uTdG6PjQ.text: North Italia was highly recommend to us, so we were very excited to go. The sangria was very good as was the mixed drink my husband got. Food came out quick and our waiter was attentive. The truffle garlic bread was highly recommend by friends so we were very anxious to try. Was swimming in grease. Not my favorite. The chefs board was good; however, was lacking on the amount of cheese we have grown to expect from chefs boards. The pizza was amazing!! It was topped with figs, goat cheese, and arugula and was something I'd order again. My husband didn't really enjoy it on the other hand. Overall, it's pretty good. Dessert wasn't great. We would skip it next time. Would return for happy hour and the beautiful outside seating.

We end up not ordering more because food was so disappointing. I would definitely not give this place a try for a while. The menus need to be reviewed and the food quality need to improve for the price.

WACTnOKwHu9XNuSxE3LEeQ.text: Can not believe this is a chain. Some of the best pasta I have ever had and I am Italian.

Q-4u0CHSuOBjDEmo274A_w.text: The food is great and the prices are hard to beat.  The service is not consistent, unfortunately.

iIvvoVP088JP58OhGXE8vw.text: Great service and the food is amazing!!  I'm so happy to have a great Italian restaurant back in the neighborhood.  Mangia!!

HsJXbseTkHFqv00DrhhuDA.text: One of our favorites! Been here numerous times and although I've never had a bad meal, unfortunately the service is usually always the same...slow and not that great. Not sure what the deal is but it's hard not to come back because all of the food is so fresh and delicious. Typically always get one of the specials because they always sound so good and no surprise, they always are! Good ambience and great drinks and food, just prepare to sit there for awhile due to slow service.

E8EU-48Py4r6SNvZSZReuQ.text: I ordered the Short Rib Radiatori & my friend had the Strozzapreti. Both had good flavor, but I'd advise not ordering their short rib dishes unless you enjoy fatty meat. Service was good. I'll give it another shot.

pEXNvGCXOPM8GEDgY16yjg.text: I couldn't be happier that vegas is getting more cute places like this!   I have been several times since opening. Brrunch and Dinner and I have to say I have enjoyed both equally. For brunch the veggie scramble and baked french toast are to die for. For dinner I am a fan of Bolognese and the meatballs.   The only complaint I have is that several times I have gone to the bar to grab a glass of wine before getting sat and the bartenders arent very attentive. I had to wait 15 minutes (real time, not an exageration) for the bartender to even acknowledge that we had even sat down directly infront of her ... Closing our tab was the same time frame.   Table service has always been great and the waiters/waitresses are very friendly.

YvNNXw-0jC9Uj32L5G1QRw.text: We have consistently found North Italia a favorite of ours. We love the energetic "vibe" each time we've eaten there ( ~ 4-5 times now, since they opened). Pizzas are a must, actually everything we had on the menu has been great. If the weather is nice, we enjoy the alfresco outdoor space for dining.  Sitting at the bar with the games on TV have also been nice. Pleasant staff, friendly customers, overall definitely recommend!

8ZuVPYAVN0Jb_HzaAb1fqw.text: Best Italian by far in Vegas. VALUE. That's why I keep coming back. The prices are half to a third what you would pay for lackluster Italian food on the strip. North Italia's dishes are creative and no expense is spared on the quality of ingredients. I have tried the entire menu and my favorites are the Short Rib Radiatori, Prosciutto pizza and Chicken Parm.

z1MxGhVLpWQoJMJlM5m4kA.text: Dear Sam Fox,  Please bring us a Henry!!!!!!   Literally probably two 5 best restaurants in all of Vegas.   Sam Fox could never disappoint. Only disappointing thing about Fox is that he doesn't have every confer in Vegas!  The artichoke to start is a must!   The branzino is my favorite main. And I've literally had every pasta and recommend them all.   If you haven't been yet, what are you waiting for!

avWmaPqfzQPSUGe6kJoONw.text: Been into North Italia a few times because it's our favorite Italian in town. We bring our out of town guests here for their delicious and fresh cuisine. Our lunch visit yesterday stood out among the past experiences, mostly because of the attentive and friendly service. Our servers name was Sydney: she was knowledgeable and bubbly. We felt as though we were guests in her home. She recommended the short rib radiatori and it was phenomenal. I was going to order a San Peligrino but was persuaded to opt for the red sangria, which was a perfect drink the gloomy weather we had. She was a delight and the food was fantastic. Thank you!

uh3N4xbNJNGqo1NPF604VA.text: Came for lunch today, as it is my new tradition to try a new restaurant every Monday. It helps ease the transition between the weekend and the work week. That being said, with only an hour to spare (including travel time) I come prepared with my exact order. The only reason I am giving North Italia a 4 star and not a 5 star is because I really wanted to try their Burrata appetizer (I'm OBSESSED with burrata) only to be told it was sold out. :( So sad...especially since it was just after 12pm. And because my mind was already made, I struggled to decide on my new order. I ended up getting the strozzapreti pasta which was very flavorful and came with lots of chicken, mushrooms, toasted pine nuts (it could have used a tiny bit more spinach for this veggie loving girl). A side note to anyone reading this though..the leftovers do not heat up very well, try to finish it at the restaurant. Now all that being said....the staff was WONDERFUL. Absolutely spectacular. So very tentative and I actually didn't feel like I was dining along. When you go, ask the bartender to tell you his scarecrow joke...hilarious. I may have already posted it on Facebook. A big bravo to all of you...I'll be back, hopefully for some buratta (and that truffle garlic bread).

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. STROZZAPRETI pasta...yum!

0HXXvILTRmkmtH4Mw2riRw.text: Very very good food, unique drink list. Very detached and unattentive staff - both at the tables and at the bar. I often dine solo and prefer warmth  from the staff and feeling tended to (and I don't mean chatty by any means!). The indifference on more than one occasion has led me to cease dining here, despite the excellent food and nice ambiance.

qOxYAgqBckru0eOnptwprQ.text: Wonderful place... very clean, cozy and delicious food. I like that you can see what goes on in the kitchen while preparing your order. Location is great. Well.

ywspfF1mnwdTs_S3Tfp3hA.text: Terrible food! Undercooked vegetables, over salted entrees, and tiny portions for hefty prices. The only good thing about this place is the ambiance, but that doesn't cover for the horrible food. We ordered bruschetta, cauliflower, calamari, and two pasta dishes. The people giving this place five stars don't know what real, authentic, tasty Italian food is. If you're looking for the best Italian food in Las Vegas, go to Esters Kitchen instead!

uyKpkcIMC2SLYmvG20gU8Q.text: Been hearing a lot about this place and try it out today I order my typical Bruscheta, Pasta with tomato and basil with added goats cheese of course Perino on the side. Good job Chealsea good customer service and she nailed my pasta order. Definitely I will be back and tell my pasta loving friends about this place it is crowded though so be ready to wait to be seated if your showing up as a group or better yet make a reservation.

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My Pasta Tomato and Basil with Goats Cheese the Best
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My Bruscheta Prosciutto with Grilled Asparagus and Truffle, Peroni on top and my best friend!

uybIsLkMDaXlTyLgzHNPMg.text: Such a cute experience! Had a great waitress and I regret not getting her name. A girlfriend and I shared a pitcher of sangria, chef's board, and an all meat pizza. It was a perfect late lunch and everything was delicious. Definitely recommend the chef's board (picture attached). It was a perfect little starter and such yummy options.

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hw5LMhxnScve87O55duTNw.text: The Bianca was an absolutely beautiful experience, (I opted to omit the arugala) best pizza I have ever had !

5qVznjH0FwA9w3RTJHwbjw.text: I started composing this review by thinking of anything that would take it down from a 5 star level - and I couldn't think of anything.  It definitely deserves all those stars.  It is not fancy or pretentious - it just nails everything they are there to do.  Atmosphere is casual but very comfortable and pleasant.  Staff is super.  Food is varied, well prepared, and beautifully presented.  And they do all this at affordable prices, with welcoming smiles and truly caring service.

PcVK9WJd1hgJty_B3keM0Q.text: My husband and I came here for the first time last week and it will definitely not be our last!! All of the food was simply phenomenal and such great value. The highlight of our experience, however, was our waitress - the beautiful, British Melanie! She was exceptionally outstanding and made us feel as if we were the only guests in the whole restaurant, even though it was super busy. She was so informative about every single menu item and went above and beyond ensure we were happy. Absolutely sensational.  Cannot wait to return and try every single dish!  Service, Food, Value - 20/10!

CwEdjWM0IoA1DW3HyB3Qpg.text: Probably one of the most eloquent flavorful wonderful places we have been in Vegas, kudos to the chef and all the people from the door to the kitchen.   Fabulous atmosphere, fabulous food, fantastic staff.....  It's a 5 from us to you keep it up.

bziciLLhFdPxs4mvXH89Rg.text: I was so excited to dine here since I loved the one in Cali! We came for lunch and ordered the Chef's Board, the Bacon and Egg Pizza, and The Pig pizza. The Chefs Board was great and had a variety of different items so there were many variations I could try with the bread, which I loved! The Bacon and Egg pizza was good as well. It felt like it was missing something so we threw on some crushed red pepper for a kick and it was amazing. I remember loving the Pig pizza in Cali, so I knew I'd like it here, and it didn't disappoint. Lots of meat in each bite which made it really flavorful.  I knocked off one star because it took awhile to get water refills, and our server asked my friend and I if we wanted dessert while we were in the middle of eating. Literally still had a few slices left so it made us feel rushed.  Everything else was awesome though, and I will definitely be back for dinner to try everything else on the menu!

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon and Egg pizza (good) and The Pig pizza (great)

1NVE4AGQx6wa53tWie-bPQ.text: I loved every single part of it. The food, the service, the atmosphere. This place is a hidden gem in the city. Will definitely be back. I'll specially be back for their incredible happy hour menu!

XV09vnyogkY8cgCO3voh3Q.text: I had such high hopes. A Friday night, starting at the outside bar then moving indoors.  We had to flag down someone at the bar after a full 15 minutes of zero eye contact. While waiting for a table that was to take 10 minutes, the host also avoided us until we stepped up to ask for an update. The bartender that did eventually help us knew her stuff, and is a big part of us sticking around. Great info and great recommendation. Over 40 minutes later, and staying because of the great bartender, we finally sat down.  The area is great and the layout is fun - love the huge patio! - but overall it was... meh. Our main server (we seemed to have a server and a million runners) was personable and *seemed* knowledgeable at first, but there were too many corrections to the information she was giving us on wines and dishes that it became a problem. Asking for help from others during long periods of her absence garnered a lot of "someone will be right with you".  Again, most staff were personable but for being sloooow, and the atmosphere was as expected (in the best way). The food was fine, but unremarkable based on the pricing and serving for this area.   We felt there were quite a few - we THINK - unintentional bait-and-switch moments with specials/features and wines. Sell us on something... but then so much was out or changed or not as advertised.   I want to try again because it's close by/convenient and I love the space, but after the actual experience I'm reticent to try again.

tMYIH8URRxhLFoIAiKD-dA.text: Really inviting atmosphere. The white truffle garlic bread was pretty amazing. Our server Jennifer was upbeat and helpful in guiding us around the menu and wine list. Over all great experience. Can't wait to go back again!

4lykWhFnZq8yjmX9-DqPxA.text: My new little eatery!  Good vibe, great location, great food, staff is courteous and things as slow or faster as you request

1C5eN2P-hgqNJzD4tKjUCw.text: The service was amazing and the food was fantastic. Had a great time such a nice atmosphere .

UDt7FPXjhS4k9ESWdzAsmQ.text: Alissa was our waitress and was phenomenal! We frequently eat out and this will certainly be our new regular spot. Great menu, service and environment. It is often after bad service that you jump to write a review as it is noteworthy. This was so good that it made me go to write this immediately. Strongly recommend!

8ATqqb76G6lsP1SYSKuKgw.text: The food, service, and atmosphere were all great. Unfortunately my boyfriend and I both got an upset stoafter eating the food. (Even the leftovers the following day). I got the funghi pizza and he got the pig pizza. I'm not sure if the dough had something wrong with it or what, but it wasn't very fun at all. This doesn't mean I wouldn't return, I'd just be a bit more cautious. Other than that my pizza was awesome. Seriously, I loved it, it was delicious. Things just got horrible after we digested.

YU3mP24jO9y-laiJgQenrA.text: Awesome atmosphere, very friendly service. The wine selection was good for a chain. Definitely put this on my list as a place to come back to.

UU-tOYXxv8lzqUlxSX7k6g.text: Food is good but the the service is so slow! Maybe the waiter was new but we waited over 10 min until the server came and then it took forever to just get our drinks. For the price service should be better. He just seemed like he didn't care. And it was 3 in the afternoon, he hardly had any tables.

WYhchVLEWWlzLGvDHupHNQ.text: Our second time dining here... First time was excellent and went back searching for that great experience once more. But it didn't quite work out.  We had reservations, however when we arrived, our table wasn't available so we sat at the bar. After 30 minutes we checked back with the hostess and they claimed they 'looked everywhere' but also said 'I forgot you were at the bar.'  No biggie since we weren't in a hurry, but definitely something in the servics the restaurant can improve upon.   And then dinner... I mentioned to our server that I couldn't have cheese, and I ordered the Strozzapreti prepared the exact same way as in my first visit where they replaced the parmesan cream with a delicious olive oil and garlic sauce. To our group's surprise, it came out with the creamiest, cheesiest, parmesan cream. My husband asked our waitress to confirm it had no cheese and she said it may taste cheesy but had no cheese. Seriously?   We both tasted it..and fortunately I was able to swap dishes with my husband since we both agreed I couldn't have this dish -super cheesy, the aged parmesan was definetly present.  Sad to see that our experience was tainted and our favorite spot with great ambiance,  has fallen off our list because of a non-caring staff member that didn't even offer to prepare a new dish. Sad all around.  Even if the food is great, if they aren't able to cater to customer's needs, then it's a place we can't go to.

uwwXuo-57j1SmmEC3XbUwQ.text: We wanted to see what the buzz was about. It always appears to be hopping even mid week. Had the arroncini delicious, tried the meatballs very good. I suggest save room for dessert the salted Carmel is awesome !  The restaurant is high energy fills up fast great for gatherings. They have patio dining also.

Iavj3sEf52_ffFNKsnWLUQ.text: This place has some of the best pizza and pasta in all of Summerlin. Eric makes the best cocktails and very professional which is rare for Las Vegas

zGhfu9whGqQfftVI3F1yAg.text: Bad experience!  I was eating dinner with friends outside on the patio & 60 degrees. All the heat lamps were on along with fans. Let me tell you my face/checks and hair were so HOT from the lamps that I was over heating. During my stay, the fans were turned off twice with their blazing heat lamps were on. I asked a male server who was so nice to please put the fans back on, because it was so hot. After a couple of mins the fans were turned off again. I didn't get a chance to cool off yet from the 1st time of the fans being on. I was dying from the heat to where I was feeling nauseous. The girl manager didn't even care and said you can sit inside the restaurant. I asked what's the use of sitting outside when it's suppose to be cooler outside. I told the manager I would just leave to please give me a plastic cup for my ice tea, because it's so hot with the lamps outside without the fans on that I was feeling sick. You would think that 60 degrees it would be cooler and breezy. Nope!They didn't care...maybe the person that was complaining about the fans sitting outside should have gone inside the restaurant. I wasn't even dressed in winter clothes. I had thin sweat pants on with a tank top & light weight sweater. I took off my sweater which of course didn't help. Definitely would not go back!

yWKYqOljcbbM1kqKRfryKw.text: Great food, great service.  Nice patio for outdoor dining.  Awesome bar. Fun atmosphere.

BKkHcHyQh0d7E5aJ6cQtfA.text: Technically this is a chain restaurant which we usually avoid here in Vegas because of the abundance of local places but the Food here is so fabulous that we have to eat here at least once a month. The garlic truffle bread is my favorite appetizer and my go to entree is the short rib radiatori (spelling?). We love going on Sundays.. half price wine!

O-X-2O38O32aGfMb0FGP0w.text: We have dined at North several times. However last night we went there for a Birthday celebration. The service was horrible. While the waiter was very nice I believe they had something going on with the kitchen. It look over an hour for our food to come out and when it finally did my pizza was cold. Additionally all of our food for the table didn't come out together. It took another 10 minutes for 2 people in our party of 7 to receive their meals. I asked to speak to the manager who was nice and apologetic. We then ordered dessert which you would think would have come out faster after complaining but that took about 30 minutes. We arrived at 6:30 and didn't leave until 9:30. I'm all about having a nice dinning experience but 3 hours was a bit ridiculous! I hope that North can turn around their service so they will last. We also had dinner there 3 days before and while the service wasn't as bad as last night we did have to send food back for being cold and it did take a long time to get our food. Good luck  North there are a lot of dinning options in Vegas I hope you can fix your issues quickly before you alienate your Summerlin customers.

V5b5GD35pl7fywm_jvqqgA.text: Nice atmosphere. Food is pretty good. I've been there for lunch and dinner. Maybe would go back. Didn't love anything enough to crave it b

sMrGFV1GkD-ttow9siLesQ.text: Went there to eat on a Sunday afternoon around 2pm and we were hungry.  This is my second time eating at this establishment. Service was terribble for the low volume of customers in the restaurant.  Had to wait an unreasonably long time for our food.  I ordered ice tea with my meal and because the glass is small, I had to repeatedly ask for refills and no straw or sugar provided. Ordered calamari and it was petrified.  We were offered bread the first time we tried the restaurant and never offered bread this time and a server told us it is because it is up to the descretion of the server. There were just two of us and the total bill was over $70 for lunch. Fortunately, there are many other options for good italian food here in Summerlin (Pasta Idea) that is less pricey. Will not be going back.

I3zl8cBBHtWgcgS5yERz6w.text: Had the Pizza.  Crust under cooked.  Service was good but food and prices don't match.  Two drinks and a subpar pizza should be under $20.  As it was, I was around $40.  Definitely not worth the visit.  Skip this place.  More hype than substance.

y7EG8XrXoz2wvHG0Q3aMEg.text: The only down side is that they're in Las Vegas, alas too far to make it my new best place to enjoy very savory Italian food. The chicken pesto was delicious!!! The Margherita pizza was spectacular!!! The spaghetti and meat balls has been redefined!!! I know I'm going overboard with the exclamations, but try it and see why. I'm from LA, so sadly this one or two times before I leave will have to do for a while. The tiramisu was very tasteful too. Stop by, it's amazing.

VV8zWVWz9oek1XwPqpBN1A.text: Our server was Kalina, she made our visit absolutely great! We decided to try this place for our anniversary and I'm so happy we did. The food was really good but her service was the best part of our experience. She was very friendly and so attentive. This will definitely become a top choice for the future. Thank you Kalina!

bYxuX9-npmHsi6ylEd8dEw.text: Service it's amazing, they are quick on everything. This place for dinner is a must, love their wine list

YXfilj6PAfxlpY_v2X1_9Q.text: This is one of our favorite spots! We never have to wait, and our food comes out pretty quick.  The menu is small but everything we've had has been amazing. My favorite is the roasted mushroom tortellini    There's a lot of staff for the amount of customers at least every time we've been so the service is always great too!!

cpa1vKUdlr2Y0QFqK26uSA.text: Nice new hot spot. Friendly staff, food is great. My go too dishes are the mushroom pizza as an appetizer and the branzino

820lYXIj3Vj476ZZOzLC9Q.text: I've been there twice and the gluten free pizza crust is very tough and difficult to chew - did not enjoy it. Most everything else is great! Except the salmon wasn't that good either :(   wish they would change the gluten free crust they use. It is super tough and nearly impossible to chew. Next time I won't be having pizza since I have gluten allergies and this crust just won't cut it.   5+ stars for customer service!!! Super fast service and the entire staff is so friendly:)

1O17W-Al7CGC-55_WQ86AA.text: I was very excited to try this place. We made a reservation which is good because it was quite busy. I really enjoyed their calamari as an appetizer. Their spaghetti and meatballs are good. Their gelato is also tasty! The service was very friendly.

LewtANQy-HrXBAyLEZvP_g.text: The food here was amazing. They have an excellent menu with lots of healthy choices. When the food was brought to our table it was hot and fresh. The meatballs were delicious and whatever they seasoned them with was incredible. The atmosphere is casual-nice and the airy open dining room reminded me of dining at an upscale restaurant at the beach(without the ocean)   I was particularly impressed with the service, our waitress gave us good food suggestions and I'm especially glad she suggested the dessert, the dish was like donuts, so yummy! I will definitely be back!

TJvRbbv28zGIH-fO54aSlg.text: Just had the most amazing meal. We had a special invite for a decadent, fantastic and most of all delicious meal courtesy of North Italia in Summerlin tonight. Diver scallops tender and moist. Short ribs were torn apart and flavorful. Polenta yummy. Calamari and arugula was crunchy and spicy. Arachini balls were crunch and rice was cheesy deliciousness. Desserts were to die for. Share one at least.  Thank you Jennifer, our attentive server. Special personality and graciousness about her. Ryan enjoy your trips around Vegas for special findings and German for the hazelnut toffee. We ate like ballers and that's a fact Jack. Omg... no food for the next two days. Lol

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1lnbjDsOko7CtqbrTPgFQw.text: Place was crowed on a Thursday evening. Food is OK. The atmosphere is what will keep this place open. If I was craving a great Italian meal this would not be the first place to come to mind. However, if a group of friends wanted to drink, socialize and share a few plates we would come here. Meatballs, pizza, salad and pasta dish is usually what we order and just share around the table.

lMjptoq1lA9I1J9BOM98_w.text: This review is for 4.5 stars.  Really solid new casual Italian restaurant in Summerlin.  Good happy hour, patio perfect for nice days or brunch, and solid wine by the glass list.  You can even get a few more ounces at a discounted price for most pours.  Although the beer list could use some help as there's only about a dozen total bottle/draft.  Menu is new Italian with tons of small plates and appetizers, pizzas for $14, and pastas around $20.  Everything seems sharable from the portion size to the tapas pricing.  The fig pizza, with some added prosciutto, was fantastic.  Tons of meat and thicker crust than your typical craft pizza.  Prosciutto is super thin and perfect compliment to the crust.  The cauliflower appetizer was fine with a few asparagus and an egg, but nothing more than a small opener to a delicious pizza entree.  The restaurant interior is really modern and the bar area is huge.  I would 100% be back for brunch, Happy Hour, or another dinner.  Local option that's perfect for a night out without breaking the bank.

v40lfLPIFuYWlX8s18f3hQ.text: Pretty disappointed about the service and the food here. We ate here last night for our reservation at 9:30pm. After being seated it took 15 minutes for someone who wasn't even our server to realize no one had greeted us at our table (it wasn't even busy).  Our server finally came and we ordered the truffle bread, the house specialty bolognese, and the short rib riadatori. The truffle bread was delicious, but the bolognese was all pasta noodles and tiny specs of meat, which I think is a rip off considering it costs $18 for the dish. The short rib riadatori had a strong lemonish sour zest to it that just seemed odd for a pasta sauce and we found it pretty hard to enjoy. I also asked for Parmesan cheese, and our server brought us a little cup of the crumbled Parmesan cheese, it wasn't freshly grated which is strange for being an Italian restaurant.   I'm not sure if it's because we had a late reservation, but the staff was being pretty loud and hanging out 2 tables down from us counting money and doing their closing duties. It just seemed a bit unprofessional to be doing those things so close to their guests while they are trying to enjoy dinner in my opinion.   I'm sad to say my experience here was disappointing to say the least.

8owomcuToI0zdDpd6iaR6g.text: North Italia is definitely one of the top summerlin restaurants, there pastas and pizzas are do die for. One thing they need to improve in my opinion is service.  I will be back for sure!!!!

SSReHsmhvJwEYH_Up8H3cQ.text: Really great atmosphere. Trendy setting with a great bar and cute patio. Farm fresh food. The salads are so delicious my fav is the kale salad it has pistachio and roasted grapes. Great small plate and app options. I like that the menu has some traditional Italian  dishes and some updated more modern and equally delicious options. Pasta dishes are also amazing and the portions are the perfect size not too big not too small .You can tell the ingredients are fresh and clean. The staff is super friendly. Only complaint is the parking in that shopping center stinks.

zirg2eFqYGu_vAZUCVC0kQ.text: Ugh. I really wanted to like this place and I may try again during another shift. Dined there on a busy Friday night. Yes, this is a popular place and the food is delicious. However, service was so fractured and delayed that the food isn't what I remember about the evening. There is clearly not enough staff to accommodate the crowd. There were long stretches where we did not see our waiter and our meal and drinks were terribly paced.

704BNZLaHc9LQoCrGG5ZYw.text: This was a solid 4.5. The food was incredibly good, however, the portions were a tiny bit on the skimpy side. They brought bread, butter and olive oil, crispy and good. We started with the vegetable salad, an order of the cauliflower, both were very tasty, great texture and very fresh. I had the Branzino and its some of the best I've had in a long time. Others had the Scallops and the Risotto and the Bolognese. the service and the atmosphere were great. I will return and try their pizza, it looked really good

4fOjN08ugT2joaFw68PBKw.text: The best food, the best service, and amazing atmosphere. You can't go wrong with anything on the menu. Everything is delicious. Once you go here you will want to keep going back. It is perfect for any occasion.

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States

eMbViusFbvksZeSVVeLwHQ.text: We just got Home from a Great Restaurant here in Vegas.  The North Italia has got to be one of the Top 5 here in NW (Summerlin) area of Vegas. We were greeted with a Smile as usual by all of the staff that were near the entrance. We opted for the Calamari app which turned out super as it was beer battered on top of a well seasoned arugula. Then we had some Zucca chips which was a Zuccini sliced wafer thin like a potato chip and cooked and seasoned with perfection. Our main meal after the Italian Bread with Oil & Balsamic was a Chicken base with roasted mushrooms spinach & toasted Pine Nut & a parmesan cream sauce. OMG it probably our Favorite since this is the 2nd or 3rd time we have had it. The restaurant has a vast menu of wine and of coarse all the alcohol  that normally a complete bar has. Janae was a very good server as they  have some of the Best there. Tim as always was a very cordial host. Thanks North Italia for making our last nite out for 2018 Perfect.

C42lmhsxskxHwLicXBxZrg.text: Let me start with the fact that the food is GREAT!!  That is actually 5 stars and what turned the experience to a positive one overall.  We had a birthday dinner with the family, a table of 9. We had the kids with us as well and the waiter seemed to be very annoyed by them. They are good kids and behaved very well, and this is a family restaurant after all. She was very snobby and condescending. a good example was her eye roll and how shocked she was, when we were surprised by her question of "what level of cooking would you like the salmon"? when we asked what that means (it's not a steak or a burger) she rolled her eyes and sighed.  I think management should look into the actual service as it seems to be the only week link in the reviews. Food is amazing, and the restaurant itself is beautiful.

4NMTN1McFbE9r6-FPaJdNQ.text: This is by far my favorite Italian restaurant. I have gone 4 times now and the food is beyond exceptional. Chef Jeremy is an amazing chef and always has our food right every time. Its always be so hot and each bite is so flavorful. The chefs plate is to die for.  I truly feel these negative comments on here are to make this restaurant look not only bad,  but to make them seem very unprofessional, and the complaints aren't genuine. I'm sure the team hears about these comments because I know my place of employment does and it can be hard listening to negative comments that customers feel they need express. Even when a situation is solved and your meals are gratis. The chefs even go out of there way to prepare special request for items that aren't even on the menu.   This restaurant is outstanding and I recommend it to all my friends and family. The prices are great especially since everything is made from scratch. Some servers are better than others but they still provide great service. Thank you North Italia for always making each visit beyond exceptional and exceeding expectations, you guys and gals rock!!

e19YmM-p2R9VE0g6jQrk8w.text: Great food and excellent service.  My husband and I have been here a few times and we love it! It's not an ambiance we would typically go for - it can be crowded and very loud inside. But the food, wine list, and service are great.  I try something different every time and my husband usually orders the squid ink pasta which is superb.   Overall, this is a great spot to try. If you have a sweet tooth, get the hazelnut cake dessert. You won't be disappointed.

FLu4X4Xamrd43xDqHBJNRg.text: OMG! So great...seriously, you must go! The drinks are wonderful, the pizza had truffle oil and honey - the taste was amazing.  Also, the pasta dishes are delicious also!  We have managed to get in without a reservation, however if you go anytime after 6:00pm make a reservation!  The service has been awesome all three times I have been.

8J8uFw71BxPXA-U15yij1g.text: We've been a few times now. Brunch and dinner.  Some items were good and a few misses.  The pig pizza is a clear winner. Short rib dinner entree was good.  Some of the pastas not in love with but will continue to try more menu items.  Bread with Ricotta was good.  Staff nice.  Good lemonade and tea.  Updated 1/15 - went yesterday for brunch and ordered the short rib hash and the breakfast burrito.  We have decided that after a handful of trips to North Italia we are over unimpressed with the showing of items we have tried and will take a rest from trying more items.  I would say the food is average quality and meant to please a crowd.

Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MUUpqKLHddubLwNUd4SqFA.text: Fourth time was a flop. 6:15 dinner reservation for two. 3 appetizers not available, including tomato app and calamari. What Italian restaurant doesn't have calamari? I had Caesars salad and braised short rib. Caesar was fine but short rib extremely salty, almost inedible. My wife had mussels which she liked. Service was spotty, she seemed very hurried, multiple mistakes in the check. No sign of any management touching the table. Probably our last visit, too many options in Italian to let it slide this far. Sorry.

3EEjcUYU7wuTLZAGJ9_3Cw.text: Update: North is still delicious...!!! 3/11/18  "Reunited & It Feels So Good...."  I fell in love with this modern, family oriented, indoor out door Italian restaurant when my favorite unfiltered dame introduced me to North in Scottsdale.   The vibe is welcoming and the fresh made daily  pasta & pizza dough is delicious!  Our overall service was pretty consistent considering their recent grand opening!  FOOD Crisp Calamari $13 Highly recommended golden brown calamari paired with arugula and lemon of course. Great portion size for the price. Tortellini $17 This vegetarian friendly main dish was smaller than I anticipated but filling.  Daily Pizza (Potato Spinach) $14 SURPRISINGLY SPICY and our server failed to mention it before ordering. Thankfully I'm about that spice life! My first potato pizza and I enjoyed it.  Dirty Almond Chai $5.00 This latte was refreshing & filthy at the same time and I enjoyed every sip!   DON'T SKIP DES Dessert was on the House compliments of management but I honestly would have paid double for the Tiramisu & Buddino.   Total $56+ Tip   Heck yes I'll be back! This is just the beginning!

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spinach Potato Pizza of the Day!
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I love this place!
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled Artichoke $13

-3OPOP3atU8AagafTf5nUw.text: North Italia is our latest discovery in Vegas.  We spent the majority of our time in Summerlin so the location was ideal.  It's located in a strip mall but the place was big with tables inside and out.  After we were seated, our eyes were drawn to the soup of the day:  butternut squash!  Our all-time favorite so we each naturally had to order a bowl.  Our appetizer was the Burrata which was a decadent date pistachio cheesy concoction.  We devoured that in no time.  The soup was creamy comfort food at it's best.  My entree was the chicken pesto and the hubby got the house special bolognese.  I must confess that after the appetizer and soup, I was 3/4 full so I picked at my entree...certain I would have enjoyed it more if I had room in my stomach.  Hubby happily finished his bolognese.    Too full to try the yelp recommended tiramisu...next time for sure.  We will be back!

L0tW90xEPhApHpSdjmHwhw.text: This is second time that I am at North Italia, and I had most delicious Italian pasta every time. Food is great, ambient is fresh and cozy. It has both indoor and outdoor seating. I like the lighting,  which make this place quiet relaxing. The crew are super cool and very friendly. I had all the pasta dishes in the menus and all taste great, the portions are bigger than average so leave more room when you go for dinner. If you like creamy souse and mushroom try Strozzapreti

n3IsDQwYIhi02IyFJFhzLA.text: I'm always in the mood for trying new Italian cuisines, especially when it comes to pizza. My girls and I wanted to meet in the middle since we were coming from different areas, Southwest and North side. North Italia was the spot, nicely situated in Boca Park. We sat in the outdoor patio, which was nice since they had the warmers. I love how open and spacious the restaurant is. Decor was beautiful. This would be a great place to have big groups, lots of seatings available.   We shared the Prosciutto Pizza with gluten free crust (extra $2.50), Chicken Parmesan, and Spaghetti and Meatballs (substituted with Rotini pasta). Wow. Everything was amazing. I love how the fig and goat cheese complimented each other in the prosciutto pizza. The crust was neither stiff as a cardboard or too doughy. The chicken parm had all the right amounts of melted cheeses. The Pasta and meatballs was a good traditional taste, it did have a little spice to it that I liked. Oh, and for dessert...the Hazelnut Torta. It's  Salted caramel gelato on top a warm brownie with toffee pieces and Nutella cream. Need I say more?

photos.caption: Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hazelnut Torta $8
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rotini pasta &amp; Meatballs $17 (gluten free)
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Parmesan $20 (soooo good)

HchWvZCEDV0liA17XDKIgw.text: I have had the pleasure of dining here twice now, both times the food and service has been absolutely outstanding. It's incredible how delicious their food is - it's so fresh, flavorful, and yet at the same time.. simple, and each flavor is distinct and has a purpose. The cocktails are refreshing and made well too. We got the charcuterie board - highly recommend this! Our waiter told us everything that was on it because we were so in love with all of the different items. I took my parents here and I will say it's the nicest meal I have had in a long time, and the experience itself will make me return soon. I didn't get a shot of all the food before it was eaten... but the chicken and all of the pasta were amazing too, although not pictured :)  My only regret is I didn't have room for dessert!

DkgPvNgjfO26urQH_wtYBQ.text: We were greeted immediately by a beautiful hostess. I was impressed by the cleanliness of this amazing establishment. My party was seated and the manager, Cole, came to our table to welcome us. He surprised us by providing some small plates to start our experience. Thanks, Cole! We will definitely be back!!!

KOhCh6gTpz6DeIuGIEWjDg.text: Clean and pretty interior Nice and friendly service. Simple but have plenty on menus Every food was delicious  Cocktail menu sounded interesting so i ordered, but the drink was unbalanced and flavors listed on the menu was lost. It wasnt good at all. Just get a glass of wine  (Ugly not washed sliced lemon in the cocktails)+(they need to clean their ice machine filter)

RGS0CA_WejsTVm1LkgPc3g.text: I know I'm in the minority here but I really didn't like anything about my meal here.  My wife got the arancini for an app and I gave it a try.  Not a fan (apparently I am basically the only one).   For my entree I got the chicken parm.  The chicken itself was  good quality white meat chicken but the flavors didn't do anything for me.  Plus I found it to be extremely salty.   Portion was pretty big and the pasta it came with was okay.  The wife went for the divers scallops.  She enjoyed it. I tried it and didn't.    For dessert was the tiramisu.  I'd say it was like 90% marscapone and about 10% lady fingers at most.   When the waitress came around and asked how it was, she could tell we weren't feeling it.    Everyone else loves this place and it was packed so maybe you take this review with a grain of salt.  Maybe I have stupid taste buds???  The waitress was very attentive and always had my soda refilled fast.  Which is appreciated.   Restaurant is clean and stylish.   The couple next to us was a little close and loud for comfort.   But like they say "it is what it is".  We won't be back most likely.   Food... meh to me.  But service was good.

d1EHe1N6FPuT4lDWllJU0A.text: I came in on windy Sunday evening around 730pm. I didn't have a reservation and asked for a table for 1. As it wasn't too busy I was promptly seated.   All the staff were friendly and engaging. My waiter was prompt and attentive. The menu has drinks on one side and their is plenty to choose from. As a solo diner and driving myself I only had water to drink. I ordered the bolognese which on the menu said it was a house specialty.   The food was really good. The meat sauce was hearty with the ratio of pasta. However, and this is the ding, the overall portion left me still hungry. Knowing what the price was for my pasta. I feel that I should be full when I'm done eating.   $21.56 pasta plus tip. You can't throw in a small salad or a piece of tasty bread?

4-iJzfyOR8-dan1nIWd8mA.text: Saturday early brunch hours. So many items to choose from to satisfy the palet. We opted for The Pig, and The Americano. Of course dessert too. The torta and the tiramisu. OMG all of it was to delight the senses. Outside of the taste this restaurant has exceptional customer service. Our beverages were never low, and we were continuously looked after. Very enjoyable experience. Would def recommend. Ample parking outside, easy to find location.

Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiramisu
Photo of North Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Torta

jKTHRyJxb8fqxeGk-oNB5A.text: To be honest I am shocked that I am just now writing a review because I have been coming here every week since they opened (which means it's a great place)! This just a guaranteed go-to place if you want an amazing meal. Their salads, the simple salad (pictured) and seasonal vegetable are my favorite, but they are all really excellent. Their salmon is also really well done- I usually add it to a salad. My other go to dish is their meatballs. DELISH. Such a solid restaurant. I have never been here and been disappointed with my food (EXCEPT FOR THE RARE CHANCE THEY RUN OUT OF SOMETHING- which does happen)! Another MUST is their iced unsweetened green tea. Not sure how they make it, but it out does anyyyy other that I have ever had- I could live off of it. The wait staff is not that great which is why I have put 4 stars. There are a select few that are good, but the rest are rushing and not present whatsoever when talking to you or taking your order- as if you're unsure if they're paying attention to what you're saying, which can be frustrating. It's just hit or miss, often times a bit worse when it's packed (which is often). The atmosphere, both indoor and outdoor, is amazing, clean, and well done! Love love this place & always look forward to returning.
